
Sniff the Death Honeysuckles

Author notes:


This e-book contains over 250,000 words which is carried through 426 Microsoft Word pages.

This e-book does not contain a chapter heading, such like, Chapter One; Chapter Two, etc.

Instead, the story unfolds in a numeric calendar date format with current time, daylight or nighttime hours, a set of current weather conditions, and the property location with character activity.

I enjoy learning parts and pieces of an unread novel, before diving into the content.

A Nuclear War is sometimes called either an Atomic Warfare or a Thermonuclear Warfare and is defined as a military conflict or a political strategy which deploys nuclear war bombs with a single warhead of radiated particles.

Nuclear War One encompassed two separate time dates of August 6th and August 9th, in the year 1945 A.D., when from the United States of America, within the Federal Government branch, at the White House, where President of the United States of America Harry S. Truman ordered a single U.S.A. bomber war airplane to drop down two separate nuclear bombs on top of the cities, Hiroshima and Nagasaki, within the country of Japan.

A nuclear bomb attack creates a field of sandy radioactive particles within the air waves coming from a mushroom-shaped cloud and is known as the nuclear fallout, dropping all the particles downwards towards the ground surface, within 15 minutes. Human and animal skin and body exposure to the nuclear fallout particles results in radiation poison that damages all the biological cells on each life force first and then is followed by a death act, finally.

Each nuclear bomb killed 226,000 individuals including innocent men, women, teenagers, and children, created a visible, heated infrared, and ultraviolet light waves producing a very large and very heated fireball capable of burning every person, plant, and pet. That Presidential Act ended World War Two conflict between the Allies nations and their nasty vile enemies.

In the year 1990, the number of nuclear war bombs holding a nuclear warhead, from numerous nations, throughout the globe, totaled 45,000.

In the year 2022, the following powerful global nations, the year and inventory of their nuclear war bombs include Russia, (1949), 6,300; United States of America, (1945), 5,600; China, (1964), 350; France, (1960), 250; United Kingdom, (1952), 50 bombs; Israel, (1960), 150; India, (1974), 70; Pakistan, (1998), 20, and North Korea, (2006), 10, for a total of 13,000 nuclear war bombs with a single warhead. This is 28.88 percent of 45,000 nuclear war bombs, in the world.

The other global countries owning a few nuclear war bombs with a single warhead included Albania; Algeria; Argentina; Australia; Brazil; Bulgaria; Canada; Egypt; Germany; India; Iran; Iraq; Israel; Italy; Japan; Libya: Mexico; Myanmar: Netherlands; Philippines; Poland; Rhodesia; Romania; Saudi Arabia; South Korea; Sweden; Switzerland; Syria; Taiwan, and Ukraine.

The nuclear bomb design was created by American inventor J. Robert Oppenheimer. He was born in the year 1904 and died in the year 1967 and was an American theoretical physicist and the Director of the Los Alamos Experimental Laboratory in the U.S. State of California.

I have created a personal and private Book Rating System for each one of my novels for the curious reader.


Rated G for good stuff.

Rated PG for pretty good stuff.

Rated M for mild stuff.

Rated R for really great stuff.

Rated C for cute stuff.


The storyline for this novel is Rated R for really great stuff with some boyfriend-girlfriend relationships; witty and vile humor,  teenly female catfights, teenly male dogfights, and some teenly deaths, with no she-ghosts and he-ghosts appearing.

The major character role presents a gang of wild and crazy teen natives attending their school sessions, completing their crop and home chores, and caring with love and respect for their loving parents.

The major scientific breakthrough, in the story, is skin paint called bite-nats, a combination of bacteria and nats, used for both fun and fight.

Additional valuable background information, on February 23, 2023, the peaceful relationship between the global nations halts and the peace talks stall, the country of Israel becomes annoyed, frustrated, anger, mad, and disappointed with all the other nations then launches from the Gaza Strip Military Post, dropping a single  nuclear warhead on top of the ocean paradise Kish Island, within the country of Iran, but missed the designated target.

Amen!

The flying and twirling single nuclear warhead lands then splashes down in the middle of the deep and blue Indian Ocean waters. Of course, the bomb explodes under the water particles killing all the immediate swimming sea life forms, without harming a single human and produces a mushroom-shape 30,000 feet above the water surface and into the bright skyline. And then all nations divide into two separate groups the next day, on February 24th and started fighting and killing each other, on February 26th, beginning World War Three.

The war battle lasts two days, from February 26th to February 28th, until all the world’s angry and worried citizens go and then attack their individual government building, in a brilliant coup, overtook all the evil governmental leaders and then hung each evil person by the exposed neck muscles from either the second or third floor of that same governmental building.

No more war!

A peaceful life and lives lasts for 53 years until a new evil female dictator tries and then fails to rule Planet Earth and all the earthlings, and some outer space aliens, again, on January 1st, in the year 2076, creating Nuclear War Three, using numerous nuclear warheads with very limited power, due to old age, rust spots, and corrosive wires.

Each individual tiny nuclear explosion creates a mushroom-shaped cloud expanding 15 feet in height by 12 feet in wide, producing 25 miles-per-second of fiery, fierce winds, covering a parameter of 16 miles around the blast, destroying 60 American towns. Each explosion, also, causes significant property damage and kills billions of peoples, plants, and pets, coming from each initial nuclear blast wave, intense heat waves, and tons of radiation tiny atom particles at first.

The intense, fierce, terrible and horrible nuclear and unclear sky of bombs stops eight months later on August 18th.

Why do you ask?

The nuclear bombs were all used and the nuclear bodies were all dead!

Then both the body and land damage occurs and then endures the aftermath, a Nuclear Winter.

The new Nuclear Winter is a thick blanket of black-colored 5,000,000 tons of tiny soot particles floating upwards and covering the pale blue atmosphere and wraps all the blinding rays of the bright heated sunlight away from the earthlings, producing cool weather over the European and Asia continents. The Nuclear Winter killed millions of surviving peoples, plants, and pets, destroying the food crops, plunging the survivors into a hungry famine.

The major effects from the nuclear exchange foresee the death of many millions of victims, the breakdown of institutions, government, professional, and commercial entities for the smooth continuation of a civilized civilization. Another effect is the loss of food, water and electricity production and the distribution of food, water, medical, computer, and informational services.

Nuclear War Three does not bring about the extinction of the humans but leaves a small number of survivors, living in a few remote geographical spots and, also, reduces the Quality of Life and the Life Expectancy on a human. Plus. the nuclear war bombs either permanently damages or totally destroys the delicate ecosystems and changes all the climate weather patterns.

From Modern World History, on August 15, 1945, the countries of Japan and Germany surrendered the fight and official ended World War Two battles, signing a legal document to promise not to start another vile fight with an armed weapon.

However, after the dust balls settled, abuse and use the pun, no leader presents a paper legal document to end the Three Nuclear War, due to death leaders and the lack of both the civil and government leadership. Instead, small gangs of wounded and healthy survivors come together and gather up and present their supplies, including food, fresh water, and medical aid kits and forms a new community.

Side notes: Based on modern day scientists, a total of 40,000 nuclear war bombs, housing a single warhead, will produce of an explosive yield of 13,000 mega-tons.

From the Ancient World History, Mount Tambora, the largest volcanic eruption in the year 1815 B.C., produced 120 million tons of sulfate dioxide aerosol sprays and heated ash plumes with a force of 33 billion tons of dynamite or 02.20 million atomic bombs landing, again, on the city of Hiroshima and ejected 42 cubic miles of rock particles and pebbles.
Some 74,000 years ago, Mount Toba produced 670 cubic miles of rock particles forming Lake Toba, and produced 6,000 million tons of sulfur dioxide or the force equivalent of 20,000,000 mega-tons of dynamite.

When outer space asteroid Chicxulub fell down and then impacted the soil surface on Planet Earth, the massive blast caused the extinction of the Dinosaur Race that equaled 70,000,000 mega-tons of energy.


Thanks for entering my imagination!


ipam


A wishing, instead of fishing for the food meal…
Story Plot:

After the Nuclear War Three, the world has dramatically changed, in regard, to climate, landscape, and citizens.

Many small farm communities are barely living in poverty, hunting off the damaged landscape, eating damaged animals, and drinking contaminated water.

However, there is a bright spot once every year. The annual Apprenticeship Program is here and is held at Metro City Birmingham.

The program invites every 16 years old male and female to compete for one paying job opportunity, in which, to better their life and the lives of their family unit, away from working the rough farmland and into lounging within city luxury.

Within the South Beach Colony, 16 years old and native female, Tulu is ready and eager to fight for her solo chance to live within a luxury environment, wearing a set of nice clothes, working at an office desk, and providing her family unit with all the comfort needs of ultimate happiness, instead of her and her family unit continuing to work the hard and harsh farm life as a patch of country pumpkins.
Cast of Citizens and Colonies:

Director Hico, Metro City, Birmingham

Kodare, Superintendent, North Ridge Mountain (Riders)

Present day and place and time


Year 2081
June 1st Monday


North America continent
South Beach Colony, Colonies of the U.S.A.

Thelee Farms
Ocean breeze and sizzling hot temperatures with bright sunshine
02:02 pm (early afternoon)


The bright red blood transforms instantly into maroon hue and then completely dries as a dark brown stain on her meaty index finger pad. She carefully rubs the open wound against the dirty yellow tinted sleeveless shirt, which is part of her work outfit for working inside each crop field. She flicks the encrusted red blood away and then places the wildflower stem inside her hand-held bouquet basket.
Tulu and her older sister Taffy are gathering up vegetables and fruits for their nightly supper as they have been tasked by their father. Now, they run around selecting and picking out an assortment of colorful wildflowers for the pretty dining table arrangement also while their hard-working mother continues to work soaking red beans, frying the raw meat, baking the doughy biscuits, and steaming the hard pecans for the dessert pie.
“No thistles! Mama doesn’t like thistles, even the pink ones.” Her older sister curtly reminds while hearing the loud whistle behind her back spine, spinning around with a sour frown to see the advancing figure. “Warty he-toad approacheth from the north!” Seventeen-year-old Taffy bellows out loud in an unfriendly tone.
Fifteen years old, younger biological sister Tulu roughly pirouettes on top of the other wildflowers, presents a goofy smile and then eye gleams McCamy. She wears a home-made sundress without sleeves and two thin straps over her two collar bone featuring a deep V-neck collar on the loose bodice. The dress fabric is striped pink-tinted, vertical lines on top of solid white hue. The long, flowy skirt falls straight down to her kneecaps and is tied with a thick ribbon in pink hue. The dress appears a little big and loose on her petite body as the flock is a hand-me-down from her older and taller sister.
Tulu starts to happily skip over the grass blades killing the new flower petals and rushes ahead to her beau, wildly waving both of her hands. She feels loving excitement.
Blonde-haired and blue-eyed McCamy stops and then leans down scooping his pair of calloused hands underneath her two ticklish armpits, swinging Tulu in a full circle, three times, and then buries his girl inside his muscular chest. He wraps protectively his two muscular biceps around her girl kissing the top of her hairy bone skull. Her brain cells quit swirling. Tulu inhales and then exhales with her teenly love, for her guy, too.
McCamy sighs and then breathes deeply with love, too, tenderly resting his face on top of her honeysuckle, sweet-smelling, brunette colored locks, since his body frame is six feet and four inches of bronze-tinted, muscle and strength, when he is compared to her delicate petite-ness of five feet and one inch.
Taffy continues to stand in the middle of the wildflower patch and presents a sour frown holding the basket of flora and vegetables while disgustingly snorting at the love bird pic. She continues to wear her dirty, yellow-tinted farm outfit, a sleeveless white tee shirt, a short, yellow-tinted skirt over a pair of tights, and a pair of sturdy brown-tinted, worn, not polished working cowgirl boots with the pointy toes. Her socks continue to protect and warm her tender feet.
The semi-flat meadowland is filled with tiny, green-tinted weeds, within patches of tiny colorful wildflowers, standing in a diagonal away from a green-tinted pasture land of grazing cows at Thelee Farms.
The semi-flat, limestone-colored tabletop land on top of each Birmingham cliff looks really funny to a pair of naked eyeballs. Each cliff resembles a flat, circular island surrounded on three sides by the calm waves of dark blue-tinted Gulf of Mexico ocean waters. Over each limestone cliff, a beautiful pale-blue sky glows each day featuring patches of swirling, strolling white clouds among the invisible but heated rays of hot sunshine.
The non-water side on top of each cliff displays a natural land bridge in gray limestone connecting to another cliff, where a line of moving vehicles will roughly roll over the semi-smooth stone, one-at-a-time, during the farm duty.
On top of each cliff, the landscape displays a unique pattern design also. On the edge of the semi-round cliff, the land is hard limestone rock, where the ocean winds cut into the earth and then blow away the fertile dirt and any type of grass seeds. Nothing grows there but a red-tinted sunburn on your pale face.
Within the middle of the flat, circular mountain cliff, a red-bricked homestead building has been safely constructed, where the farm family lives and thrives while watching the crops grow, the cows eat, and the children play. Around the homestead campus, a set of scattered individual circular patches provide food, livestock, and beauty on top of the mountain tabletop cliff.
An individual patch of green-tinted, grassy pasture land, within a natural circle, protects and also feeds a corral of grazing cows or a pen of working horses or other livestock animals. The semi-flat, circular meadow displays an area of short green weeds and patches of colorful wildflowers that provide feed and free all the sea birds. Another circle of red-tinted, sandy soil grows all the food crops for all the peoples. And a circular pattern of glittering gray-tinted limestone rock offers both beauty and death.
Within the colorful wildflower meadow, McCamy pulls back with a smile at his girl while talking to her rude and mean older sister Taffy. “Go away evil step-sister!” He smells freshly clean from his shower and has changed his dirty farm attire for a new outfit, a long, white-tinted, sleeveless tee shirt, a pair of tan-colored walking shorts, and a pair of ratty, brown-tinted flip-flops over his two naked feet. He enjoys the cool and comfortable flip-flops when not working his hard, tough farm chores.
Tulu giggles inside his chest. “Taffy’s my real sister. She’s just goofing with us, darling.”
“Scat, Taffy! This is my private time with my girl.” McCamy looks up with a sneer to see Taffy. Taffy wears a white-tinted, dirty, ratty cowgirl hiding her long, brown-colored hair strands wrapped in a long ponytail at the nape of her neck. He notes the biological differences with the two sisters.
Taffy is tall, like her father, with a pair of long legs and strong muscles, working in both the hot days and humid nights inside each crop field, like a sturdy plow mule, and she is smarter than each one of the academic teachers at the local academic building.
Tulu possesses a body frame of five feet and one inch which is covered in a set of thin muscles, a pair of short legs, and a set of petite toes, where her toes and her skin nicely suntans within the hot sun rays, smiling all the time at her beau McCamy.
“Supper’s at five o’clock, Tulu.” Taffy looks up with an evil grin and then eyeballs the bright sun. “You got about fifteen minutes, tops, before my daddy and my daddy’s shotgun comes around here looking for your a…”
“Ask Mama to hold our hot plates of food, for us, Taffy!” Tulu smiles inside his warming hug. “We’ll be along soon, Taffy. I hear McCamy’s stomach muscles howling.”
“Okay, warty she-toad!” Taffy dashes ahead with a smile toting an individual basket of fresh food items and wildflowers for the evening meal, moving away from the flat meadow of flowers, over a circular patch of solid rock limestone, and then hits the manicured lawn that leads to her homestead.
McCamy continues to hug his girl with a smile. “Tulu, Happy Birthday!”
Tulu pulls back with a puzzled brow to see him, “No, not yet! It’s not today, but the day after tomorrow, McCamy. Geez! Did you really graduate the top of your grade?”
He chuckles with a wink into her pretty eyeballs exhibiting his love, expressing his gift. “I bribed the Superintendent to release me for my academic bondage, until old age. I wanna start celebrating your birthday right now. I love you, Tulu,” McCamy hugs her for a second time and then pulls back with a grin, kneeling down on top of soft patch of grass. He explains, “I got your birthday present with me. Do you wanna try it on here?”
She continues to stand and then huffs with disappointment and worry. “Try it on! I…we both agreed that your current crop yield money goes for purchasing a used stream engine powered thresher machine for the field crops of corn, McCamy.”
He smiles. “Look! You turn sixteen years old, one time.”
“I can be sixteen years old, next year, too, and the year after that, and the year after that, until you buy that used thresher machine for the important crop fields of food stuffs feeding the entire world.”
“You can’t become sixteen years old again. I have a very special gift, muffin. Please, accept my generous heart-felt present from a simple poor hick.” He pouts.
She leans over and hugs him pulling back with a smile of happiness, saying with a smile. “McCamy, I love you. I accept you. I don’t need a gift or a present or…”
“…a wonderful surprise.” He displays a small, rusty, round-shaped, metal can without the lid. The contents swirls in pink-colored, sparkling, glittery paint.
“Paint colors pinky pink.” She smiles down at the open paint can. “I love the color pink. Awe! Thank you so much, McCamy! I can color my old beige wall in sparkling pink hue. Or we can save the new paint for our new house, when we get marry next year. You’re a nice thoughtful beau! I really love it.”
“The canister does not contain wall paint for your private bedroom, Tulu. Sit here! I’ll show you.” He stands upright then reaches down lifting Tulu up from the ground, sitting her fanny on top of the cut-off tree stump. He squat down and balances one kneecap, placing the rusty can beside his flip-flop. He reaches out and tenderly grabs her delicate wrist extending her arm into his chest, kissing her naked hand and then pulls back with a smile. He says, “I want you to hold still for me, muffin.” Tulu watches with keen interest and presents a smile feeling excited about her first birthday gift. He dips a tiny, horse-haired paint brush down into the open metal can lifting up the paint residue in the air, moving ahead and draws three separate completed circles around her naked wrist bone.
“Does this pink color wash off, darling?” She fears that she may be marked pinky tinted circles on her naked forearm for life.
“Yeah!” He dunks the horse-hair brush back down into the canister can and still holds her painted arm. He orders, “Now, close your pretty eyeballs!” She frowns at him in silence. He reaches up with his calloused hand then tenderly brushes each one of her eyelashes over each one of her pupils, saying with a smile. “I want you to think and concentrate with your pure mental thoughts on a set of rounded beads, creating three individual wrist bone bracelets.” He reaches out and gently touches her forehead temple. “Here, inside your smart mind! Think of a set of rounded beads, consisting of three separate wrist bone bracelets on your naked arm, muffin.”
Tulu keeps her two eyelashes shut and wears a frown and then wiggles her nose exhaling then inhaling with her air molecules, mentally concentrating on the required round beads as three individual bands of bracelets physically appearing around her wrist bone. She feels a tingling warmth then a rapidly coolness, opening her two eyelashes, seeing three pink-tinted bead bracelets, in place of three pink-paint stripes on her naked arm. He releases her hand. She lifts the same arm in a perpendicular pose as each physical bracelet dances against the crook on her elbow. Then she swiftly drops her forearm back down towards the dirt as each physical pink-tinted beaded bracelet beautifully tickles her hand bone. She gasps in happiness and shock. “O! This is so beautiful, McCamy.”
He grins. “You like, don’t you?” He reaches out then gingerly touches each bracelet on her wrist bone while explaining the concept. “Bite-nats, it is a shortened scientific word for ‘bacterial gnats.’ Bite-nats was created and used during Nuclear War Three, when the good guys invaded the Middle East countries. Then bite-nats was used as a type of battle gear over human flesh and blood body on each fighting rebel on both sides of the war. I secretively bartered some old corn huskers and wet grain colonels for this precious pink commodity. Are you surprised, muffin?” He leans down and kisses her naked hand pulling back with a smile.
She continues to study her new birthday gift and giggles with love. “I love them! How does the bite-nats produce work, Mr. Madman Scientist?” She touches each pink-tinted beaded bracelet with her other naked finger pads.
He reaches over and strokes the first bracelet on her arm explaining. “Simple! Bite-nats come in a liquid state, appearing like paint, but it ain’t. The gnats are little chemical insects that communicate or work within your brain cells, kind of like, a mental mind thought. You can make the gnats transform into any physical object, within your mind’s imagination. Then the group of bite-nats sees, feels, and tastes your mental images and then poof, they form into that particular ‘think object.’ When I asked you to concentrate on a set of rounded beads for three separate circles, the group of bite-nats, within the pink paint, read your mind thoughts and then it morphed into the three physical wrist bone jewelry bracelets.”
“Foreverly!” She smiles.
“As long as, you hold that mental thought, muffin, foreverly. Okay! Let’s test something else! I know. Think of pink paint!”
Tulu closes her two eyelashes while concentrating on the think object: pink paint. She quickly feels a warmth sensation popping open her two eyelashes, seeing the original three stripes of pink paint around her wrist bone.
She giggles with a grin. “Wow! Wonder if, I wanted…”
“Hold that thought, Tulu! The backlash of the paint is that it is limited to the current physical measurement of the liquid measurement of bite-nats on the biological body. So, the ‘think object’ must conform to the body area, like your forearm. Therefore, think of something that goes around your arm.”
She closes her two eyelashes again and hums with love while concentrating on her new ‘think object’. She quickly feels a warmth sensation and then a rapidly coolness opening her two eyelashes, seeing the object. She gasps in shock. The paint has morphed into three tiny, pink-shaped snake figures with a pair of bulging pink eyeballs and a mouth of pink fangs. Tulu giggles at her new “think object.”
McCamy reprimands her dangerous ‘think object’ saying with a sour frown. “Tulu, you must be very careful with the bite-nats play paint.”
She touches the soft pink skin on the bite-nats creation, one of the pink colored snakes that once had been a pretty wrist bone bracelet. Tulu announces with a smile, “Fake! No harm done!”
“Did I mention only a tangible item using the bite-nats paint appears, without bites, fangs, or paws? You can’t produce a playfully puppy or a fragranced flower or a pot of your mama’s red bean chili.”
She looks up and winks at McCamy, saying with a grin, “We’re having chili for dinner. How did you know that, darling?” She giggles with delight then closes her eyelashes pondering the same think object: bracelets.
The three tiny snakes disappear then are placed, like magic, with the same three pink-tinted, beaded wrist bone bracelets.
“But you can make something special like a piece of clothing item. Watch this!” He reaches down and lifts the horse-haired brush from the canister again then slowly draws a completed circle around her naked foot, marking a straight line across her bone arch. He announces, “Think object: sandal.”
She closes her two eyelashes and wears a permanent smile concentrating on her new think object: sandal. Tulu feels the tinkling warmth then rapidly coolness, opening her two eyelashes, staring down a at new fashion foot sandal. A pink-tinted, open-toed, leather foot sandal displays a three-inched heel and a single pink-tinted, rose-shaped flower bundled on top of her pinky toe bone.
“The other one…” She orders and rudely finger points down at her other naked foot. He artistically draws a set of circles and stripes around her other naked foot. She mentally performs the think object: sandal. Then, magically, a second fashion sandal swiftly appears on her other foot. She opens her two eyelashes then swiftly stands upright sliding off the tree stump, fumbling down into his chest and single arm. Tulu doesn’t possess a pair of city slicker, fashion high-heeled girly sandals or pretty ‘do nothing’ shoes, except for her sturdy pair of working cowgirl boots for each field crop duty and her pair of soft deer slippers for casual walking over the grass and the wooden floors of her house.
McCamy drops the paint brush on the grass then hugs her body. He swiftly standing upright, cuddling her into his biceps as she moans with true love into his muscular chest. He leans down then tenderly kisses her soft hair, slowly moving down, planting his wet kiss on her smooth forehead, her cute nose bridge, and then finds her soft red tinted girly lips.
Tulu wobbles side to side in her new pair of sandals while balancing safely within his arms. She wraps her short arms around his muscular chest dreaming of their marriage day, in two long years, when she turns eighteen years old. The new Colonies of the U.S.A. requires that a teenager become registered, recorded and then readied for marriage at the age of eighteen years old, not before.
They emerge from their hug then pull back from their shared kiss sounding with a set of chuckles. She smiles. “I can paint me a dress, a real wedding dream gown, on my wedding day, just for you, McCamy.” He nods in silent. She looks down and then eye burns the rusty canister while pondering her wedding ceremony here at her home Colony. She will be presented by her father, on her future wedding day, to her beau McCamy. She prefers the color traditional white dress, which had been used centuries ago by the cave-dwelling bridal maidens. However, food, fabric, and fun are in very short supply here, within the new Colonies of U.S.A.


Five years ago, in the year 2076, the vicious gang of enemies targeted the wealthy, well-known nation, the United States of America blasting an array of accurate laser bombs at each major metropolitan city housing huge populations of men, women, children, household pets, wildlife animals, manicured lawns, business employers, patient hospitals, academic schools, merchandise warehouses, manufacturing factories, and United States of America, Federal, State, and Local government buildings. The result was dead, poisoned, and never to be occupied prime real estate for 10,000 or more Earth years.

The man-made laser bombs pissed off Mother Nature, too, when it was her nasty turn, she created devastatingly earthquakes on the west coastline, within the three U.S. States of California, Oregon, and Washington while separating the dirt particles from solid landscape and then drowning the entire geographical landscape of people, plants, and pets down into the deep blue depths of the cold-feeling Pacific Ocean salt waters for eternity.

Now, the western coastline of the U.S.A. begins at a low-lying valley of brown dirt, within the ancient U.S. State of Colorado, moving south across the landscape towards the new salt lakes, within the ancient U.S. State of Arizona, inside the massive and vast ancient Grand Canyon, which is named as the “Grand Lakes” now.

The land property, consisting of the independent countries of Canada, Alaska, and the North Pole, have been cut off from the rest of the U.S.A civilization exhibiting numerous swirling moon-sized whirlpools, within the nasty cold, salt waters of the Pacific Ocean, where the dangerous waters eat both sperm whales and battle ships as an appetizer. And the current dangerous landscape contains scattered ship-sized craters of heated soil coming up from a range of active volcanic steam plumes and lakes of hot sizzling lava beds that live inside a set of underground caverns.

Mother Nature also decided to re-decorate the rest of the U.S.A. landscape stomping a gigantic eighteen-mile deep, diamond-shaped sinkhole starting at the ancient, dead city of Memphis, within the U.S. State of Tennessee, traveling upwards to the ancient, dead city of Fargo, within U.S. State of North Dakota then moving across to the ancient, dead city of Denver, within the U.S. State of Colorado and finally going downwards to the ancient, dead city of Oklahoma City, within the U.S. State of Oklahoma while wiping out the entire Mid-Western America landscape from the global map. The sinkhole measures 895 miles long by 850 miles wide.

Traveling westward from the southern town of Vicksburg, within the U.S. State of Mississippi, towards the city of Phoenix, within the U.S. State of Arizona, Mother Nature has planned, planted, and implemented numerous rows of active and dangerous vertically tall skyscraper-like volcanoes spitting out sizzling, gray-tinted ash plumes and sizzling rivers of heated red lava particles that covers the heated landscape down beyond to the ancient country of Mexico.

Next, Mother Nature has twisted her evil plot by flooding the entire eastern coastline of 1,595 lands miles, within the U.S.A. landscape, coming from the ancient, dead city of Portland, within the U.S. State of Maine down to the ancient, dead city of Miami, within the U.S. State of Florida and then going beyond the salty water seas and edge of the landscape hitting the small country of Cuba, where millions of drowned houses and dead Homo sapiens peacefully sleep foreverly on top of the Continental Shelf, within the deep blue Atlantic Ocean heated, salt waters.

Thus, the ancient city of Birmingham, that used to reside in the center of the U.S. State of Alabama, forms the new southeast corner of the ancient United States of America and is geographically called, the South Beach Colony or South Beach.



Back into the present day, time, and place, the newly created Birmingham Mountains, which was once called the Appalachian Foothills, begins at a tiny northeastern corner of the radiated and dead city of Charleston, within the U.S. State of West Virginia heading in a southwest direction for 440 miles, creating a row of average tall 700-foot high mountain cliffs, that guard the repositioned Gulf of Mexico warm waters from harm.
After the war of fighting humans and the vicious wrath of Mother Nature, the following U.S. States, North Carolina, Virginia, South Carolina, Florida, almost all of Georgia, half of Alabama, and one-third section of West Virginia, encountered too many war bombs and tons of nasty weather patterns causing the natural landscape to fall off the North America continent drowning first then sinking down to the bottom floor of the Atlantic Ocean waters, lying there foreverly, along with the humans, animals, and trees.
From the center geographical landscape in in Alabama down to the sandy shoreline of L.A. or Lower Alabama, that land mass broke off into dirt balls sliding down into the Gulf of Mexico warm waters, too, taking all the people, places, and pet with it.
The northern edge of the new Birmingham Mountain Range starts at the dead and radiated town of Charleston, within the U.S. State of West Virginia, creating a slightly semi-crooked diagonal line going through the other surviving cities of Madison, West Virginia, downwards into the ancient U.S. State of Tennessee and into the towns of Knoxville, Farragut, Sweetwater, and Lookout Mountain, heading further south into the ancient city of Trenton, Georgia, and goes further south into the ancient U.S. State of Alabama including the towns of Fort Payne, Collinsville, Reece City, Attalia, Trussville, and finally Birmingham.
Now, the warm waters of the Gulf of Mexico and the cool waters of the Atlantic Ocean has merged creating hot, sizzling heated waters along with weird aquatic mammals that like to get humans and land animals for their breakfast, brunch, lunch, mid-day snack, supper, dinner, and midnight snack meal.
If the heated waters and hot sea monsters are not enough to scare your butthole shitless, the high water levels will. When all of that extra, heavy landmass hit the North America Continental Shelf, like a pile of bricks, the Shelf did not displace the new property but increased the water level upwards by 40 miles. Now, the heated waters and the hungry sea monsters splash around and playfully slap the 700-high mountain cliffs, at a mile marker of 480 feet, only on an average of 220 feet from the cliff.

That’s both too close and too scary!

Back in the South Beach Colony, the fine weather provides excellent fertile top soil for food, livestock, and natives. The natives are called South Beachers, which is named after the deeply bronze tinted skin tissue on each working farmer, made from the wind, the heat and the sun.
The newly created Colonies of U.S.A. is governed by numerous sorta but not true governmental authority figures, called a Director. The Director does not hold governmental powers but distributes merchandise, such like, food, equipment parts, and clothes to his or her designated Colonies.
One Director uses one or more Superintendents to maintain both the peace and prosperity, within each geographically assigned Colony. Every year, each Colony and their assigned Director chooses one sixteen-year-old Apprentice to escape from their harsh country-bumpkin lifestyle and then advance their business career. Their new business career provides the winning Apprentice with a beautiful house, within each Metro City. The lucky Apprentice and the Apprentice’s family members also receive unlimited healthcare for their parents, education for their children, and employment for a lifetime as a new city slicker.
South Beach Colony
   (45 miles, south, Metro City Birmingham)
Farm owners, Thelee and Tourann
Father and mother of Tulu and Taffy

02:40 p.m.
Hot sizzling sunlight at 85 degrees Fahrenheit
   winds southwest winds at 10 miles-per-hour of ocean breeze
      with 85 percent humidity


Tulu claps with delight as each bite-nats bracelet bangs against her boney wrist saying with a smile. “I’m so happy, McCamy! Thank you for my wonderful present! I’ll cherish my new bracelets and my new fashion sandals, foreverly.”
“You can’t do that, muffin. Another drawback of the bite-nats is you can never remove the ‘think object’ from the human, naked flesh, like a pair of worn shoes,” he gently touches her temple saying with a smile and a nod. “It is truly a figment of your brain imagination.” He softly chuckles with his wonderful birthday gift for his girl.
“No! I can feel the warm leather of the sandal and each smooth stone on my bracelets.”
“Yes! You can, but you cannot remove the sandal. It is sorta soldered onto your naked foot, unlike a pair of iron shoes on my horse’s hoofs.”
She smiles. “Then I can wear them to bed and wear them, foreverly, all day and night.”
McCamy looks away from Tulu and wears a stern face turning to see the flat field crops of yellow corn, tall tan-colored wheat stalks, and brown-tinted soy beans and then returns back to see her eyeballs. One is bright emerald green; the other is bronze golden brown. He loves her pair of eyeballs, her long black colored hair, and her bronze tinted skin.
She rolls her eyeballs and then frowns at McCamy, shaking her leg with a bite-nats pink tinted sandal. “All right! The sandals are not the most appropriate shoe wear for handling a basket of corn husks or a tub of grain, but they feel like a pair of the sandals. And the sandals are permanently attached to my naked skin. I don’t understand.”
“Think of the object: paint,” he smiles and then reaches down to the object on the ground.
Tulu closes her two eyelashes and then mentally concentrates on the ‘think object: paint.’ Then she tumbles down on her naked feet, on top of the wildflowers, looking down her feet, wiggling her toes. She giggles with delight of her new birthday present. The physical pair of sandals have disappeared and has left rings of pink paint on each foot skin plus the original three stripes of pink tinted circles appear on her naked arm also.
He reaches over and then playfully sprays a hose pipe of cold water at her naked feet and then on her naked arm as the pink paint cleanly washes away and then disappears from her body, like magic, too.
“All gone!” McCamy grins dropping the garden hose pipe down to the ground, leaning over, and hugs his girl, planting his face on top of her honeysuckle-smelling hair roots, exhaling a deep sigh of love.
“Uoo! You, warty he-toad!” Tulu tries to beat her two fists on his hard chest within the tender hug but cannot.
He smiles without moving from her hair roots. “That’s not a nice compliment, coming from my future wife.” He pulls back from the hug and then leans down kissing her lips, before another nasty vocal assault, pulling back with a smile. He releases Tulu and then drops down to the grass, again, replacing the lid over the open canister, storing it back inside a black-tinted ratty backpack. He lifts the backpack from the ground and then places it onto her collar bone saying with a wink and a smile. “Hide the paint! No bragging to Taffy or your parents! Okay!” Tulu frowns. He exhales with a nod. “Muffin, it is illegal to own a canister of colorful bite-nats. I purchased the paint for your sixteenth birthday for you and not for you to share with anyone else. All right!”
She nods in silence.
He looks up with a smile at the drooping sun. “Time’s up and it’s passed the fifteen-minute deadline.” He views Tulu. “Let’s go and get some grub! I’m starving!” McCamy reaches out and tucks Tulu into his armpit swiftly moving ahead with his girl to her house for the supper meal.



Metro City Birmingham location
(45 miles, north, South Beach Colony)
Gray sky and dark storm clouds with cool temperatures

Dance Hall setting
02:48 p.m.


Inside a crumbling, three-story, brown-bricked, rectangular-shaped structure, on the first floor, within the cold open space, four oversized, thickly padded but worn wooden chairs stand center stage on top of an empty, dull-looking wooden stage platform. The platform holds palm-sized holes leading down into the basement setting and it views a faded yellow-painted both formal and former dance hall room setting, which was once part of a prosperous metro city, in the year 2076, known as the Birmingham Civic Center, within the U.S. State of Alabama.
A Civic Center is a tall building mostly made of brick or stone without glass windows. The interior walls are solid plaster holding social or civil events for the people, such like, grand banquet holding 1,000 individuals for a single wedding reception or a business meeting, viewing a Hollywood film or a Broadway play or an animal circus or a pod of twirling ice skaters or a showcase of new computers, or a playing two football teams plus side rows of eating establishments. The building is surrounded by numerous multi-story hotels with individual rental rooms for sleeping and bathing and numerous golf courses, hiking trails, walking parks, and swimming pools for playing.
Before the war, the Birmingham Civic Center comprises vast floor space for both sports and concert events, business and trade conventions, ballrooms for dinners and dances, and theaters for singers and shows. The building can house 23,000 patrons. The biggest feature of a civic center is the multiple connection points to major traveling roadways for ease of accessing the hall and then the swift speed of departure.
The concert hall holds 2,825 seats to hear and view orchestra concerts, ballet and jazz dance performances, and Broadway plays. The performance stage measures 84 feet wide by 88 feet long by 24 feet high. A pipe organ sits in the wall corner beside the entrance of the backstage platform. There are two chorus room and twenty dressing rooms, two rehearsal concert halls, 
A 1,000 seats inside the theater setting is used to see and hear and feel all singing operas, dancing ballerinas, smaller musical concerts and Broadway stage shows. The stage platform measures 45 feet long by 70 feet wide by 60 feet high overlooking a 16,000 ballroom floor. Surrounding the ballroom floor, a curved There are two rehearsal rooms, two chorus practice rooms, and ten dressing rooms with a star’s dressing room. 
The grand Exhibition Hall is one room and measures 220,000 square feet for large trade shows and meeting conventions accommodating 1,200 individual exhibition booths.
The 100,000 square feet contains 64 meeting rooms and a 16,000 square foot ballroom dance and dinner space holding 1,200 individuals.
A ten-story office building features meeting spaces, including academic classrooms, conference rooms, and 800-individual business offices.
The deadly array of 2076 A.D. war bombs destroyed and/or damaged most of the tall buildings, including the majority floor levels within the Birmingham Civic Center. However, Hico was able to resurrect one hotel building with individual bedroom settings and the massive theater space used for the Apprenticeship Program. The stage platform used to measure 45 feet long by 70 feet wide by 60 feet high overlooking a 16,000 square feet dancing ballroom floor. Surrounding the ballroom floor, four tiers of curved concrete benches holding 1,200 individuals.
Now, the theater space has been remade and renamed as the Dance Hall. The Dance Hall environment displays an elevated stage platform standing upright four feet from the flat dance floor; 30 feet in length and 50 feet in width, with a ceiling rooftop 60 feet high from the wooden stage. The stage platform overlooks a newly constructed 2,000 square feet ballroom dance floor between four walls of ugly peeling white tinted wallpaper with tiny lavender flowers. The cold harsh winters and cool air temperatures leak into the old building changing, modifying and disintegrating all the man-made materials. Built within one side wall corner and part of the entrance wall, six tiers of curved concrete benches can hold 1,500 individuals.
Further down the outside hallway, two rehearsal practice rooms and two converted chorus practice rooms are ready to accept all the new Apprentices for the annual competition. The ten cozy individual dressing rooms serve as private offices for the Metro City employees.
On top of the wooden stage platform, standing at six feet and four inches in height, a male of beauty possesses a perfect smile of straight, white teeth, a set of muscular biceps, a tone of bronze-tinted skin tissue, and a head of wavy, shoulder-length, blonde hair curls. He wears an un-zipped, silk, red-tinted, sleeveless, shirtless vest and a pair of matching trousers underneath a pair of flashy, red leather, soft dance shoes. He is the assigned superintendent of the North Ridge Mountain Colony. He is a native of the colony, which are called Riders. He survived the nuclear war and earned a job promotion dwelling within Birmingham Metro City overseeing the education and needs of his home colony. His name is Kodare and features a slender, dancer body frame with lean muscles.

Do not let Kodare fool you!

He is an old man of beauty, at the old age of 50 years, but appears 30 years old.
Before the deadly F-bombs and the deadly war battles, Kodare lived in the city of Chattanooga, within the U.S. State of Tennessee. His home town sits 180 miles, southwest, from Knoxville, Tennessee and 147 miles, northeast, of Birmingham, Alabama. The town lie in the valley floor at 676 feet above sea level and is surrounded by mountain peaks. The valley town consists of 150.69 square miles of landscape; 142.97 square miles of land and 07.72 square miles of water. The city lies beside the Tennessee River at the toenails of the Appalachian Mountain Range.
Lookout Mountain is one of the major peaks standing both upright and upwards, into the pale blue cloudy skyline at 1,832 feet high with 01.34 square miles summit of solid rock, without bodies of fresh water.
In the year 2021, in the month of July, Mother Nature created an earthquake that shook the solid ground, at 01.80 magnitude, on the 10.00 earthquake scale, five miles, east by northeast from the town of Lakesite, within the U.S. State of Tennessee, too close near the Lookout Mountain range.

In the year of 2076 A.D., the war bombs destroyed the flat landscape and lush forestlands on top of the ground and then murdered lots all of local residents burning the crop fields, killing the livestock, and destroying the wildlife. That’s a given point during a world war. However, Mother Nature became pissed off at all the pest humans destroying her private property and native animals and insects. So, she created a line of anger volcanoes raising up the ground soil staring at 676 feet high soaring upwards to a sky mile of 2,001 feet.

Yeah, baby!

Each earth soil quaked and the land mass shook releasing massive amounts of penned up, underground energy balls upwards into the solid surface landscape. The land mass displaced all the dirt particles, tree roots, and plant bushes thrusting the underground stones and rocks upwards, shifting the soil, the humans, the animals upright too and then plowed over the valley towns of East Ridge, Red Bank, Middle Valley and Cleveland, within the Tennessee property, and the city of Dalton, Georgia, in rock and dirt, foreverly, a dry graveyard of decaying bones.
The few survivors, including Superintendent Kodare, plus all the new migrants coming from all the destroyed valley towns, climbed up a steeple, tall, safe, and still standing Lookout Mountain establishing a new homestead and renamed the place North Ridge Mountain, within the ancient U.S. State of Tennessee.
The residents reside on three mountain sides, inside an individual tree houses made of raw tree timbers. The surviving and thriving residents rappel up and down into the lush forestlands around the shallow caves for both food and water.
The current weather pattern displays 66 degrees Fahrenheit, winds from the southeast at three miles-per-hour, and 52 percent humidity.
The natives use a set of ropes traveling up and down from tree house to tree house visiting or the lush sideways forestlands for obtaining both food and water while earning the nickname, the Riders. The sun shines brilliantly keeping the trees warm and growing upwards towards the pretty skyline, but each native will stay safely indoors, not outdoors. So, each Rider native naturally possesses a head of blonde hair, a tone of pale skin, and a pair of blue eyeballs.
Inside a cozy compartment behind one of the wall-papered walls, a musical controller sits in a chair behind a tall warm metal console starting to test all of the musical songs for the upcoming annual Apprenticeship Program.
The musical song Love Me Tender was performed by American singer and songwriter Elvis Presley, on September 9, 1956, and as he appeared on the broadcasted television program The Ed Sullivan Show to the people, that pre-sold 1,000,000 copies of his new single musical record. The musical song was written by songwriters Elvis Presley, Vera Matson, and Greg Alan Sykes.
The premiere release of the Hollywood movie film Love Me Tender happened on November 15, 1956 at the Paramount Theatre, in New York City, within the U.S. State of New York. The first week grossed 540,000.00 U.S. dollars.

Kodare stands in front of the row of wooden chair pacing side to side while narrating to his four fellow co-workers. “United States of America has changed foreverly, since Nuke War Three. Land masses have dissolved into ashes and then plummeted down into the acidic oceans of both the Atlantic and Pacific Ocean waves. The U.S.A. looks like a square-shaped donut hole with a 900-mile sinkhole smack dab in the middle of the map, where the previous U.S. States of North Dakota, Oklahoma, Kansas, Arkansas, Missouri and others used to stand. Life thrives on the outer edges of the donut hole, where warmer weather, abundant food, and a healthy Colonist lifestyle stay there rather than adventuring into the northern cold, wet, miserable sister Colonies.” Kodare reaches over and slams the hand-held television screen on top of his assigned padded chair seat then scoots away from both vicious Superintendent Doboil and flirty Superintendent Vovina, thinking about the upcoming encounter with the new group of boys for the annual Honeysuckle Ball.
Superintendent Vovina is the representative of the South Beach Colony as none of the original or raw natives care to associate with the local Colonies of the U.S.A. government authority or authorities preferring both a living place of isolation and independent. The true natives are referenced as the Beachers. And the Beachers do not send an alive and breathing native representative to Birmingham Metro City. So, Vovina is not a native Beacher either living all of her adult life here within Birmingham Metro City. And her former childhood is none of your business also. She was asked to represent the South Beach Colony decades ago and accepted the position by Director Hico.

Do not be afraid, ya’ll!

Vovina is an old woman at the age of 47 years old but appears as the younger age of 30 years old, with her female secretive mystery.
She grows tired of pacing the hard wooden floor then slowly sanders ahead and stops smoothly stealing the precious shiny object from Kodare’s padded chair, touching the first button. They sing songs, play instruments, dance on tap shoes, and perform an ancient Hollywood show. This is awesomely stimulating! Can I keep it, please? I believe this would be a nice gift to my natives inside the South Beach Colony.” She looks up and smile at Hico. “What do you think, Hico?” She wiggles the device near her grin. “This device is very, very nice, indeed. This device would persuade more of the South Beach farmers to leave their homes and then come here, settling here, while …”
“...we steal their fertile lands, their fresh water, and their healthy hot springs.” Kodare laughs as his voice echoes throughout the empty dancing ballroom spinning around and views her, “Yes, Vovina! It’s a very good idea. As a matter of fact, it’s an excellent idea, that I figured out first, all by myself. And I got another excellent idea. How about this one? An awesome-struck concept, wouldn’t you agree, Vovina? I have acquired two farms, last week. Do you like my old song and dance tune? Hmm, Vovina!”
Vovina turns and sneers at Kodare. “You snake, I’m the Superintendent of the South Beach Colony. I am the one that controls all of those dumb crop farmers. And I manipulate them to my will, not yours. You went behind my back…”
“… side…” Doboil laughs. “I like your exposed back side. It’s nice and nicely suntanned. Have you visited the South Beach sizzling rocks lately? As opposed, I guess being stuck up here in the freezing cold and ice icicles with us. Maybe, you have dripped a toe into one of the hot springs there too. Heard tell! The hot springs are harmony and tranquil in additional, say to be the famed, not lost ‘Foundation of Youth.’ Gossip goes rounds that you don’t use the bite-nats paint on your naked body either. Is that all true, Vovina?” He sits inside one of the worn and padded chairs wearing a smirk to Vovina hearing the new musical song. The hidden music Controller continues to test all the ancient speakers and the echoing acoustics from each different type of musical tune here within the Dance Hall.

Doboil is a short male of five feet and five inches, with a skinny body of bones and a tone of tight flesh, possessing a head of cropped, brown-colored hair strands, a pair of green tinted eyeballs, and a tint of yellow tinted skin. His skin tissue absorbs and spreads the sulfur minerals throughout his largest skin coming from the new natural water system. He wears a long-sleeved, silk, dress shirt in bright green, matching his bright pupils, a pair of white tinted pair of tight pants, and a pair of brown-tinted dance shoes, without socks. He is a true native representing the Swamp Island Colony, which are called Swampers.
The current homestead for the Swampers lies on a long, wide fresh body of water, a river without land. Thus, each Swamper family unit or an individual Swamper person lives on a river boat. The river sits 650 feet above sea level from the warm Gulf of Mexico waters. The current weather pattern features 77 degrees Fahrenheit, winds from the southwest at four miles-per-hour and 93 percent of humidity.
Five years ago, before the Third Nuclear War, in the year 2076 A.D., the fresh water river lies beside the lively fishing town of Guntersville, within the U.S. State of Alabama. The city of Guntersville is 42.40 square miles of land and 25.40 miles of land and 17 miles of water or 40 percent of fresh water. The dead residents rest on the hard soil of the Sequatchie Valley and play at the edge of the Tennessee River and Lake Guntersville.
The Sequatchie Valley is a long and narrow flat land located in lower portion of Tennessee and the upper region of Alabama and the valley is part of the Cumberland Plateau region coming from the Appalachian Mountain Range. The unique feature of the Sequatchie Valley the straightness formed by erosion of a compression anticline, not the rifting process. The flat valley floor is perfectly straight like the Prime Creator wants, 150 miles long by 65 miles wide.
Lake Guntersville consists of 69,000 acres of naturally fresh water with numerous native fish and it is the biggest lake, within the U.S. State of Alabama. The lake was created by a man-made dam structure, not Mother Nature.

Damn!

During and after the war bombings, the dam structure broke apart tumbling down into massive chunks of dangerous, deadly, hard rock boulders killing the first wave of both humans and animals. Then the dam water flooded the landscape drowning the peoples, the properties, and pets, except for most of swimming fishies and hissing water snakes.
The dam waters plus the massive rainstorms increased the river water level covering the west escapement on Little Mountain, within Tennessee, and Sand Mountain on eastern escapement, within Alabama.
The ancient towns of Pikeville, Dunlap, Whitwell, and Jasper in the U.S. State of Tennessee and the cities of Bridgeport, Scottsboro, Guntersville, and Blountsville in the U.S. State of Alabama now exist at the bottom of the massive river waterway, sealing, and preserving all the wet skeletons of humans and animals in a forever watery graveyard.
The few survivors, not including Doboil, plus the new set of migrants from the underwater towns learned to build and reside on fleets of rolling river boats, not solid ground, eating the aquatic life forms. Thus, the natives are called, the Swampers and resides in the Swamp Island Colony.
Before the war, Doboil resided in L.A. or the Lower Alabama region that meshed very nicely with the white sandy beaches of the Florida panhandle and the Gulf of Mexico salty coastline. When the bombing started, numerous coastal towns were hit and then destroyed. He loaded into his personal boat with his family members sailing up numerous inland Alabama fresh water rivers, in escape. When the intensity of the bombing continued, Doboil avoided both capture and death by surrendering all his family members to the enemies or the hunger gators, sacrificing his wife, three elementary children, one infant baby, four parents and eight grandparents, saving his lousy person. When the war stopped, he anchored, alone and lonely, within the fresh waters of flooded Lake Guntersville, which was renamed, the Swamp Island Colony.
All for one, not everyone else! The survivor cry came by each desperate starving, healthy survivor.
A wounded survivor received no help or food or support or supplies, eventually dying from food or water starvation or the barrel of smoking gun or the fangs from hunger animal.

Do not be deceived either!

Doboil is a middle-age male of 45 years old but looks 31 years old.
“Your flattery is flat, Doboil! Vovina, please, present your media blurb for my determination.” Director Hico sits in the center of the five wooden chairs, like an ancient throne chair, without the royal crown and robes, wearing a stern face.
Hico is a complete mystery man to his four employees with no family members or a circle of friends. He is unmarried and too old for his own children. If you dare to search the previous medical records, here in Birmingham Metro City, Hico is recorded as 53 years old, in the year 2073 A.D., before the Third Nuclear War. Five years later, in the year 2078 A.D., he appears as a young 30 years old male possessing a thick head of rich black tinted hair, a tone of wrinkle-free, pale tinted skin, a pair of aqua pupils and an oval-shaped face. He measures six feet tall with a plump body frame wearing a business suit in maroon hue, featuring a long jacket, a pink-tinted dress shirt, a green and pink bowtie, a pair of cuffed trousers, and a pair of shiny maroon leather shoes with pink-tinted socks.
Hico does not claim to fame a lost home like his four employees but enjoys telling stories about the ancient Birmingham town. Thus, he is a native from here living, fighting and surviving here too.
On top of the elevated stage platform, Superintendent Vovina reads from a sheet of paper narrating to her four co-workers, “Birmingham Metro City, the center of excellence that postures this Colony in the first position! We create an array of beneficial cozy comforters for any wandering Colonist, who has survived Nuke War Three.” She views and smiles to Hico. Hico nods in silence. Vovina nods then continues. “Where the Colonist might transverse from the North Ridge Mountain, a colony of hunters, or the Grand Rock Canyon; a colony of rocks or the Swamp Island…”
Doboil smiles. “Swampy water is composed of clay, sand, and hard coal chunks. That’s not a very good advertisement point, here, to the young teens, Hico! Colonists do not wanna fight with any of the Ecosystem Rejects, like a pod of deformed humpback dolphins or a nest of vicious people-chomping alligators. They want a nice easy life of luxury and peace and harmony that supplies warm days, hot nights, and a steaming bathe inside a lost hot spring.”
“Hold that thought! Hot Spring Fling! That can be our new theme for the upcoming annual dance contest, which is held here in Birmingham Metro City, every year.” Kodare nods with a laugh to Doboil. “Clever, ain’t it and ain’t I?”
Doboil exhales, “Ain’t it! Are you challenging the proper name of the Apprenticeship Program, bubba?”
Starbe agrees with her legally married husband Doboil and says with a smile. “It was named, Gator Town, in your formal life, ain’t it, honey-pie? When the gators swam up from the burning water of the Everglades and found a new source of food, humans. They aren’t called ‘swamp things’ anymore, Kodare.” She softly giggles then hears the new musical song.
The musical song Hillbilly Bone was performed by American Country musical artist Blade Shelton in the year 2011. The musical songwriters were Craig Michael Wiseman and Luke Robert Laird.
