Starbe is a petite, skinny woman of five feet and two inches possessing a tone of pink tinted skin tissue, a pair of violet-tinted eyeballs, and a head of short, cropped red flaming hair strands. She is dressed in an ankle-length gala gown in silver tinted sequins featuring a halter top and a fitted waistline, and a two-foot dress train, a pair of matching high-heeled fashion sandals and displays one white tinted, satin, elbow glove on her short arm. The other glove lays in her lap. Her toenails are painted in bright yellow hue. Her long fingernails are coated in rich black.
She hails from the ancient city of Knoxville, within the U.S. State of Tennessee.
In the year 2076 A.D., the city of Knoxville, within the U.S. State of Tennessee consists of 104.20 square miles of landscape, which is 98.50 square miles of land and 05.60 miles of water. The lowest elevation is 800 feet above sea level on the Tennessee River. The Tennessee River flows through the middle of the flat valley lands. The various hilltops with high summits include 1,391 feet upwards to 2,064 feet into the pale blue skyline.
The city proper with houses, peoples, farms, livestock, pets, wild animals, trees, bushes, flowers, and insects lies in a flat valley called the Great Appalachian Valley halfway between the Great Smoky Mountain Range on the east and the Cumberland Plateau to the west. The flat valley displays long, narrow short ridged hills surrounding a wide and long flat terrain. The flat terrain creates the first footstep into the Great Smoky Mountain’s lush and alive forests and lakes.
The city maintains a humid subtropical climate with a hot and humid summer reaching in July with an average air temperature of 78.40 °F and then a cold and wet winter, sometimes snowflakes, in the month of January with an average air temperature of 38.20 °F.
The average humidity factor is 71.50 percent. The city receives 2,613 hours or 59 days of sunshine rays of 30 percent of sunshine throughout the calendar year.
The annual rain precipitation is 48.00 inches and the seasonal snowfall is 06.50 inches. The record snowfall is 17.50 inches on February 13, 1960.
Historically, the town of Knoxville was a way station or a resting and refreshing spot for eastern, northern, and southern travelers and numerous migrants heading to the Wild West of America.
In the year 1914, the Candoro Marble Works opened for business and started mining for the pink marble importing the stone throughout the world. Pink marble is a type of crystalline limestone mineral found only in the geographical location of eastern Tennessee mountains of Knoxville.
Marble is a natural resource on Planet Earth. Thus, a marble bed embedded into the soil is a finite region, on the surface of the world and created by Mother Nature.
To mine the deeply embedded and hidden naturally formed marble stone, the rock is cut out from the ground or off the side of a mountain using diamond-stubbed, fast-moving, man-made cutting equipment tractors, creating a big hole or quarry pit. The pit is mathematical shaped into a gigantic square with tall sides and smooth flat floors without a rooftop, of course.
After the town of Knoxville had been selected by the United States of America, Federal Government branch as the main headquarter building for the newly created Tennessee Valley Authority or T.V.A., the city started to grow towards the north, down to the south and sideways to the east and west, within the flat valley, using millions of United States Federal, State and Local taxpayers’ dollars creating ugly and tall commercial buildings for businesses.
The Tennessee Valley Authority (T.V.A.) is the largest public electricity power provider in the United States of America supplying nuclear powered electricity to 5,000,000 homes and businesses. In the year 2020, the federally owned and operated corporation recorded 11.80 billion dollars in revenue monies and employs 12,000 persons throughout the U.S. States of Tennessee, northern Alabama, and northern Georgia.
The solid land mass of Knoxville houses 600 office buildings containing 21 million square miles of office space, employing 500,000 individuals. The city is the home to a major university of learning college students and sports jocks; professional baseball league; professional basketball Hall of Fame; an international laboratory research center; and corporate headquarter buildings for the largest movie theater chain; the largest truck stop chain, the largest grocery store chain; the largest digital advertisement company, the largest residential trailer construction chain, the largest personal sea craft manufacturing plant, and major restaurant chains.
All these national companies require one or two physical office buildings holding their working employees. Thus, both the daytime and nighttime’s skyline are scarred with tall structures starting at 378-feet high down to 336-feet high, down to 294-feet high, going down to 266 feet Sunsphere.
The Sunsphere is the name of a 266-foot high steel truss structure topped with a golden glass sphere built for the 1982 World’s Fair. A four-story concert amphitheater was completed and used for the same event.
The rest of the building offices stand at 210 feet, down to 196 feet, down to last skyscraper of 168 year.
The metropolitan towns surrounding the city of Knoxville includes Knox, Anderson, Blount, Campbell, Alcoa, Blaine, Maryville, Lenoir City, Loudon, Farragut, Oak Ridge, Rutledge, Clinton, Bean Station, Maynardville, Grainger, Morgan, Roane, Union, Halls Crossroads, Powell, Karns, Corryton, Concord, Morristown, Mascot, Sevierville, La Follette, Rutledge, Dandridge, Jefferson City, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Jacksboro, Harriman, Kingston, Rockwood, and Newport. The above towns represent a combined people population of 1,014,599, in the year 2008 A.D.
In the year 2076 A.D., the people population has swelled and then dwelled to 4,500,000 individuals, creating family units of mothers, fathers, teenagers, children, babies, and elderly citizens.
During Nuclear War Three, millions of dangerous, destructive and deadly war bombs coming from the U.S.A.’s enemies targeted the high hilltops blasting tons of dirt balls, rock boulders, animal guts, massive tree limbs up in the air first then falling down over the flat terrain second. The streets and buildings were covered and damaged in dirt, rock, limbs, and bone parts.
The enemy continued to blast off the hilltops, until every mountain peak was a flattened down into an ugly pancake-shape with burning forests and scorched dirt, on top of a damaged and holey ground soil. The surface shook, but not with numerous earthquakes.
Millions of people, plants, and pets died instantly during the first round of the nasty bombardment that lasted three weeks, until the great United States of America defended and then defeated their enemies leaving massive destruction, disease, starvation, and poverty among the healthy or injured or dying Americans.  The Knoxville survivors survived to encounter a more dangerous and deadly foe, Mother ‘fucking’ Nature. Mother Nature released her personal nasty wrath implementing the supercell weather pattern.
A supercell is a severe low-hanging thunderstorm, with the present of a cyclone threat and a rotating updraft of forced winds bouncing off the ground soil heading straight upwards into the sky. The supercell stands 50,000 feet in the skyline producing hundreds of earth-touching tornadoes tearing up the lovely landscape for thousands of land miles, killing millions of people, destroying millions of homes, and murdering millions of insects, snakes, spider, wildlife, livestock animals, and family pets.
The supercell thunderstorms ripped the damaged and remaining skyscraper buildings from the from the ground first and then tossed all the loose dangerous items and some humans upwards into the nasty black-tinted skyline and then slammed all the heavy objects and dead bodies back down onto the nasty ground creating a twisted mountain of metal parts and pieces.
All the damaged and non-damaged structures consisting of tall office buildings, retail shops, warehouses, manufacturing plants, cotton gins, game stadiums, museums, churches, boats, automobiles, trucks, farm equipment, construction equipment, street pavements, driveway pavements, residential houses, play parks, cable lines of electricity and hanging telephone and computer wires were slammed down from the skyline, plowed the ground surface and then all shoved into the massive gigantic quarry pit, where pink marble stones were mined. Thus, the landscape was cleared and cleaned creating tiny home-made shelter tents for the survivors, until the next set of nasty weather.
Over the weeks, the supercell nasty thunderstorms continued to ravage and rage on both the landscape and the survivors. So, the survivors ditched their home-made tents and then sot protective shelter down inside an underground cavern within the quarry pit saving their lives.
Over the next weeks, Mother Nature was both cruel and vicious sending the supercell nasty thunderstorms over the landscape again at a damaged Knoxville and surrounding towns, communities, and tent shelters.
So, the leaders of the survivors presented and proposed for the peoples and pets to live inside the underground mand-made quarry pits. The massive six-miles wide and eight-miles long quarry pit featured a massive 40 feet deep hole but contained scattered tiny individual cavern holding equipment and supplies. The peoples and the pets agreed. So, they moved and occurred each individual quarry caves living safely from the supercell thunderstorms, thriving peacefully. The hunters raided the local forests for food, fruits, and water.
After six months, in the year 2076 A.D., with more nasty supercell thunderstorms, dragging huge pieces of twisted metal up from the open forty-foot deep quarry pit, dropping metal bombs and then murdering some of the brave survivors, the leaders decided to pave a floor of strong and pretty pink marble over the pit hole, covering the twisted metal mess. Over the years, the leaders used maintained and utilized the same moving and paving equipment slowly covering miles of dirt soil, into a smooth, pretty, pink-tinted, permanent marble floor. The marble rock nicely cemented with both the metals and the dirt balls, foreverly, without resurfacing a single piece of metal and then also sent all the nasty earth-bound tornadoes towards another thriving township, without both death and destruction on the community of Knoxville, within the U.S. State of Tennessee.
Over time, that smooth, pretty, pink-tinted marble floor went for miles and miles and held permanently, without erosion, for years, as traveling persons walked on top of the marble stone along with the new United States of American. Government, sorta, established authority leaders, they quickly renamed the community of Knoxville into the Grand Valley Colony. The natives are nicknamed, the Rockers as they reside inside the marble rock caverns. Their natural D.N.A. genes has morphed their human skin tissue into pink hue from settling pink tinted marble dust with a pair of spooky, scary, bright, yellow-tinted eyeballs from living inside a cave, without natural sunlight. And their hair roots absorbed the pink-tinted marble dust too highlighting their natural hair strands with pink-tinted or glowing red colors.

Present day and time and space, back inside the ugly dance hall environment, walking around the same elevated stage platform, while avoiding a collision into Vovina, Kodare nods and states to his co-workers, “An evil swamp thing then! Hico, I have a better idea than giving out a tiny, shiny television thing, in exchange, for a plowed farm field of future food crops. Since, it’s my idea and my resources and isn’t working to maximum effectiveness, which will take the rest of the century, that I don’t plan on seeing. Listen to this! We hold a dance contest and then personally invite all the pretty gals and guys from the South Beach Colony to join our Apprenticeship Program. Once here, we lure the entire farm family here to Birmingham Metro City, kill them all, and then take possession of all farm lands via the Metro City protective rule, of course.” He chuckles with his brilliant idea.
“How about an archery contest? We can use sharp, pointy arrows. Or better yet, we can provide a shooting range with a handgun, which is both quicker and less messier.” Doboil says then grins at his slick comment.
“Be very careful here, my set of reject non-Nature Boys! My South Beachers are a set of crop farmers and expert cowboys with a big emphasize on the ‘boy’ part and my present company is totally excluded.” Vovina points to each male and laughs out loud, saying with a firm tone. “A cowboy with a big gun that shoots, spits, and saddles your behind faster than a can of dry bite-nats paint. I will speculate further here, if you invite their pretty girl, then you get their pretty gun. All the South Beach mamas and daddies are a compact and packed of protective tigers and tigresses over their young kin.”
Hico smiles. “My sugar plum Vovina makes an excellent analog. We can’t exclusively pick on South Beachers. Someone might get suspicious. We include, as usual, the sixteen-year-old teen representatives gathering from all the Colony natives, from my authority, coming from North Ridge Mountain, Swampland, Grand Rock Valley, and South Beach. I do favor the dance contest approach much like smooth glass as opposed to the raw blood and guts exhibition of a direct assault, for the competitive component, on my Apprenticeship Program.”
Kodare paces side to side with a stern face in front of Hico. “We used the ‘Smooth as Glass’ dance theme for the past four years. Do you remember that tall girl, Hico?” He laughs. “That girl bit your hand just like a spider.” The other Superintendents laugh out loud as Hico softly snarls with his flash back memory, recalling the tall and suntanned sixteen-year-old female.
Kodare wipes the joyous tears from his face saying with a smile. “There were four other teen representatives from South Beach Colony, who showed up here, then danced, and then didn’t win a spot, within the Apprenticeship Program,” he exhales with annoyance. “We had invited 35 families from the remaining 315 to attend our Apprenticeship Program during the Presentation Ceremony and then kept one teen Apprentice. Another failure there! The previous year, we had invited 62 families and then kept four Apprentices from going back home. The annual year before that, 78 families attended and then we kept five selected Apprentices. If you need a math lesson, that’s a reduction of 56 percent within the Apprenticeship attendance and eleven percent of the total families within the South Beach Colony. I do believe that someone is catching on out there, onto us.”
Vovina paces back and forth, shaking her curls stating with a sour frown. “I disagree with Kodare. No one’s catching onto us. We have covered our tracks perfectly. We have executed our plan precisely for the past four years. We just need a fresh new plot. And I have solved with a new solution. We include the usual set of sixteen-year-old teens and their same or older aged teen mates for a new ‘Couples Dance Contest’ which will determine the winner of our Apprenticeship Program. This brings the pretty girl and the stud-muffin guy plus both sets of families to Metro City Birmingham. Thrice the attendance, you’ll!” The other superintendents sound with a set of soft claps and numerous head nods. She wiggles the device near her smile. “And we can use this cute little toy from Kodare here too. We can broadcast the new couples’ dance contest for the very first time through the air waves, like decades ago. No loving parent would object to seeing their precious child on the old-fashion boob tube.” She laughs with an evil tone then presents a wicked grin to Hico.
“I like the new, but old concept of reviving the television devise again. But how do we kill off all the pesky South Beach Colony teens with a pair of seeing eyeballs from each Colonist, on that new television devise, Hico? Even within the newly remixed U.S.A. Government, that act is a cold-blooded murder. Cold-blooded murder is crime and punishable by law, I think.” Doboil nods with a smile to Hico. “Do we still kill people for killing other people, Hico? But we are very good with covering up accidentally accidents, plotted poisons, animal attacks…”
“…mysterious murders…” Kodare says then laughs and nods with his stern face. “But murder is still a cold blooded murderous act, in front of a live audience, for the first time ever. Since I last saw a cold-blooded murderous act, when rain of nukes hit the landscape and the people, within New York City, in the year 2073. We just survived our Third Nuclear War. People want peace, security, and happiness. I don’t simply understand, Vovina. Our plot is to rid the South Beach Colony of all the pesky farmers, not just the farm families that have a sixteen-year old teen, while stealing all the food crops, the clean bodies of water, and the amazing mystical hot springs. I can’t see your solution working effectively and benefiting us.” Kodare shakes his curls. “That’s why we established the Apprenticeship Program to capture and then eliminate the exclusive and elusive pesky farmers off their precious farm lands and then exploit the warm waters of Gulf of Mexico for our five persons. Then, all the future paying new Colonists will come to us and demand a slice of the pecan pie.”
Doboil nods with his smile then comments. “I compliment your devious mind, Vovina. And I trump it with my own evil thoughts. Let’s just rid all the dancers, not only the South Beach teens, during the new couples’ dance contest. Then there’ll be more land for us, more food for us, and more fun for us. Fun, as our fun in watching people bleed, suffer, and then die, on top of the dance floor, as long as, it is not them or one their family members. Who cares? This is pure selfish entertainment, which will be short-lived but great entertainment. We pair all the rough North Ridge Rider teens against all the mean Swamplander teens. Then, we let them duke it out with a set of live deadly weapons. Every Colonist is bored to tears inside their living room setting, at their shitty home and truly desire some type of pleasurable playtime, with a set of vicious playmates.” He laughs. “I can see it now tons of red blood staining the gray granite floor down there on the dance floor, then a suffering bleeding body over there and a dead body…”
“You’re mentally sick, Doboil!” Kodare states and spins around growling at his co-worker. He slaps his chest and smiles, “Now. I’m a peaceful man, only wanting one thing to sustain me until my…”
“…death…” Starbe laughs with her four fellow co-workers and then smiles. “Say it, out loud, Kodare! I dare you. You think it twenty-four hours of time, during day, night, sleep, bathe, and eat.” She smirks with the same evil thought.
“I want my bite-nats.” Kodare nods with a grin.
Hico exhales with a nod, “Bite-nats! Everything is a colorful hairbrush of bite-nats. I remember a time, when the thing was money. Every native had been greedy for money. Money had purchased everyone’s dreams and desires. Today, in the year 2087, bite-nats is the evil reign of happiness, health, and greedy consumption. By the way, a single bite-nats paint can is illegal from someone’s perceptive,” he chuckles with the other four superintendents. “Amusingly, my very old soul, but my fake young face of bite-nats likes your idea, Vovina. How does an artificial material invade our current and healthy life? We have fallen far from…”
“How has a can of bite-nats invaded our life? I disagree with Hico. It sustains our life, Director. Our beauty! Our grace! Our fun!” Vovina reaches up and then gingerly touches her pretty, suntanned face, prancing side to side in a purple tinted evening gown, with a three-foot dress train while secretly craving the more of the brighter and blinding spotlight, like a yesteryear former and dead Hollywood movie film starlet.
Starbe sneers with a nod then states. “The truth here, a can of bite-nats paint doesn’t prolong your precious biological life, Vovina. I know for a fact that you use a can of the bite-nats paint, all the time, because I’ve seen you without your mask. You are…”
“…a lovely, pretty person, like me, Starbe,” Kodare slaps his chest and smiles to Vovina, “So, we should negotiate or trade with the farmers, or better yet, share the find of the magical bite-nats paint cans with the dumb southern hicks. My understanding, they still don’t know about the luxurious treasure underneath their cowboy boots of bite-nats. They still don’t understand the rich purposes of the bite-nats paint. They don’t use it or ignore it or…”
“…wear it, like Vovina,” Starbe laughs with her co-workers. Vovina spins around and slaps her chest nodding for the affirmative, wearing a bright smile of nice white teeth.
Doboil nods with a stern face. “They live inside their safe and sound South Beach lands and above a hidden and mysterious Fountain of Youth hot spring. That’s located somewhere deep down within some somewhere caverns, which is inside some somewhere mountain cliff. I have been told over and over again that the secret locate is very dangerous and very difficult to reach by an average human. The heated hot steam flows upwards tenderly through a set of tiny fissures or broken pits of rock, heating the atmosphere, killing the deadly bacteria as the gentle Gulf warm breeze carries it far, far away from the cliff and the farm family member.”
“You should write teen love novels, Doboil, and make your customers pay you in bite-nats paint, make billions of dollars then quit your government job and move to the South Beach Colony.” Vovina giggles.
Hico stands upright from the chair and says with a smile. “I have decided. Kodare, pass out these mini-television devises to all the Colonies and then advertise our annual Apprenticeship Program here in Birmingham Metro City for the upcoming dance theme “Smell the…”
“…Death Honeysuckles…” Kodare states then laughs.
“Smell, the Sweet Honeysuckles…” Hico frowns at Kodare and then continues his orders, “So, each Colonist can see the visual picture and then hear the audio sound the upcoming live entertainment show here at Birmingham Metro City.”
Kodare nods in silence.
Hico smiles then orders, “Vovina, sugar plum, invite all the sixteen-year-old South Beach Colonists with a dancing or dating young male or female partner that will bring along all their immediate and extended biological family members, also, to our glorious Presentation Ceremony festivals.” Vovina nods with her smile, in silence. He exhales with a puff of annoyance then nods saying to his employee, “Doboil! I do not see your raised arm! But I feel your stinging eyeballs on my body.”
Doboil wiggles his hand, for fun, and states the words, with his concerns, “I can see many, many problems, with this unplanned of action, Hico.” He drops his hand and slaps his leg then exhales with a huff of worry.
“Then you and I are going to work out those unplanned actions and then achieve greatness. Begone, Kodare and Vovina!” Hico continues to stand in front of his ratty chair and waves his hand to both Kodare and Vovina. They quickly disappear from the elevated stage platform for their new duties.

The two owners of Thelee Farms are raising two biological daughters beside the rows of cotton, the valleys of vegetables, and the hill sides of rice while feeding most of the northern and southern regions. within the new Colonies of the U.S.A. Thelee’s family members enjoys the evening meal with their regular company tonight.
“Excellent meal, Tourann! I enjoy your cooking and your daughter.” McCamy says with a nod to her mother and then leans over playfully flirting with the daughter.
Tourann reaches over with a smile and then tugs on the shaggy, shoulder-length, blonde-tinted hair curls on McCamy with her free hand while motherly reprimanding the older teenager. “I do believe that it’s time for a cut, wash, and spray, young man! I’ve been instructing Taffy in the great art of hair salon-ing. She’s got some spare moments, maybe tomorrow afternoon, after her sewing lesson. She can groom you up to handsomely, McCamy.”
Taffy snorts out loud, since she doesn’t want to touch McCamy or McCamy’s ratty blonde locks. She looks at her sister and proposes with a wicked smirk. “Tulu is getting pretty good with a pair of sharp scissors. She’ll only nick one earlobe, warty he-toad.”
Tourann gasps. “Taffy, show your set of lady manners, please, while at my dinner table.”
“Yes ma’am!” Taffy nods with a grin to McCamy. “What did warty he-toad get you as a birthday present, this year, Tulu?”
“Taffy, you are the mostest, rudest young maid, within the outskirts of South Beach.” Tourann wiggles her dirty fingernail at her ill-breed, first-born child.
“Thanks, Mama! I try very hard to please.” Taffy accepts the bad teen reputation and beyond presenting a smile and a wink to McCamy.
McCamy nods with a smile and then honestly lies with his secret, winking at Tulu, “Shoes! But alas, the work pair is the wrong size. I plan to exchange them, tomorrow, while we all visit there in Birmingham Metro City.”
Tulu nods with a grin holding her secret silence, keeping her precious gift a hidden secret too, inside her heart and underneath her mattress bed springs.
Tourann wipes the wet hot tears from her dark skin on both of her eye sockets with the clean kitchen cloth. She explains, “You’re going to be sixteen years old so soon and then presented to Director Hico, exactly on your special day, Tulu. I labored for eighteen hours, girly, waiting for your head to crown on my…”
“Mama, please!” Tulu looks down with embarrassment and blushes to her lap.
“I’m so proud. We both are so proud and pleased, Tulu. You’ve accepted the responsibility of young womanhood, very early. Director Hico has confirmed our arrival to Metro City Birmingham and your appointment, as well, Tulu. We were so worried that your birth date would be received as a sign of immaturity for the annual Presentation Ceremony, before the acceptance into the Appreciation Program, Tulu. But Director Hico has sent and then confirmed your personal appointment by paper letter and to each traveling sixteen-year-old here in the South Beach Colony along with their immediate family members.” Tourann blows her nose on the kitchen cloth and then tucks it down into her worn blue-tinted apron. She smiled at Tulu, “Just think! You could be his next personal Birmingham Metro City Apprentice! We’ll be so proud.”
Tulu grins with a nod. Taffy rolls her eyeballs and then looks down grabbing the beverage while glancing at McCamy.
The Apprenticeship Program, for one lucky sixteen-year-old teen, translates into a better house, a better education, and a better everything, which is wonderful for the selected teen and the teen’s family.
Tourann, her husband Thelee, and her daughter Taffy can immediately move from their rural farmland into the civilized Birmingham Metro household, with a set of private school tutors, home servants, modern mechanic appliances, wardrobes of designer clothes, lots of formal parties, and entertaining nightly dances.
If Tulu is selected as the Apprentice, then she can bring her boyfriend McCamy, after they marry, of course, since he will benefit also as her new legally married husband. The Apprenticeship Program offers one family, each year, a wonderful life minus the hardship, the hard work, and the hardness of country living on a rural farm.
Inside the dining room, Tourann shakes her black tinted short curls and wears a frown staring at her ill-mannered child Taffy. “Tulu, she will restore our faith, like the axiom goes: An honest day’s hard! Ain’t that right, Thelee?”
Thelee is Tulu’s father as he nods in silent agreement while enjoying a second piece of pecan pie.
Tourann nods. “The one-year anniversary is today, when you were greeted by Director Hico for your personal Presentation Ceremony, within the Apprenticeship Program.”
Taffy consumes another bite of pecan pie and then eye burns McCamy, in silence.
Tourann sneers. “We were, one year ago, and still now. We, your daddy and I, continue to receive nagging questions and a set of surly comments from that day.” She slaps the table in fury and states with nasty timber. “Why did you do that, Taffy?”
Tulu defends her sister saying with a sweet smile and a nod to her mother. “I found the thistle bouquet quiet pretty containing an arrangement of dark purple flowers. If only Director Hico had not touched the prickly leaves, he would have selected Taffy for his Apprentice, Mama. I know that in my heart, Mama.”
Tourann exhales then states with a sour frown. “Bull thistles grow inside a cow pasture, fertilized by rain water, and cow shit.”
Taffy giggles. McCamy works on the first bite of the pecan pie looking down at the floor, wearing a smirk.
Tourann continues to nag at her first-born child. “Bull thistles are troublesome weeds, Taffy, not fragranced soft, silky wildflowers. Of all the pretty pastel floral flowers, within our lovely grass fields, you pick a patch of fat downy seedy balls of spines. Really, Taffy! What, on Planet Earth, were you mentally thinking, girly?”
Taffy rolls her eyeballs and then looks down at the floor, chewing on her pie slice.
“You forget the spit, dear.” Thelee states with a stern face then chews on the next pie slice.
“Mouth salvia produced from your pink tongue, like a six month old infant’s drool. You mouth spat on Director Hico’s person. Unbelievable! After, he blooded his prickled fingers from the non-silky bull thistles.” Tourann sneers.
“Mama, Taffy was being very thoughtful and quick thinking. Our mouth salvia contains tons of healthy enzymes for healing an open wound. Do you recall too? Three of his fingers were bleeding out his red blood cells, after Taffy tugged out the needle-like spines from the finger meat.” Tulu smiles with a nod.
Taffy winks at McCamy. McCamy holds the food inside the mouth, before he chokes to death from his vile laughter.
Tourann shakes her black curls again and states with a sour frown. “O! Do not get me started with your academic grades, young lady! O! The embarrassment of a mouth-spit kicking behavior had been added from Superintendent Vovina’s personal remark, an academically-challenged teen. That information has gotten you back home, here, permanently. You returned back home to us in humiliation while every single sixteen years old Colony teenager attended the beautiful Apprenticeship Program receiving a wonderful employment opportunity. Then, that sixteen-year-old Apprentice and her entire family had been transferred to a newly created Metro City Birmingham city, within the new Colonies of the U.S.A.”
Taffy swallows the food and looks up to see her mother, holding four finger pads near her frown. “Four teens were selected, Mama, including my best friend and Baycliff’s beau Amita. We have still yet to see….”
“I wasn’t selected for the Apprenticeship Program either Tourann and neither was McCamy or Baycliff.” Rusk says with a head nod and joins the Thelee family conversation.
Rusk is the biological twin brother of McCamy looking alike, acting different. Rusk wears a head of shoulder-length blonde curls and a pair of blue eyes, measuring at six feet and four inches tall, too, possessing a set of ripped muscles on his chest, in both his two arms and legs coming from years and days and hours with hard long farm chores. He dresses in a long, blue-tinted, sleeveless tee shirt hanging over a pair of tan-colored walking shorts, and a pair of ratty, brown-tinted flip-flops over his two naked feet.
“So, true! So, very true, Rusk! Your mama is spinning inside her grave too. Rusk and McCamy, both of you missing in a once-in-life-time chance for…” Tourann pulls out the cloth then sobs with her shallow tears into the fabrics, again, dearly missing both her dear friend and her farm neighbor.
“For what, Mama? What will McCamy, Rusk, Baycliff, and me miss on this place, our farm? Tulu and McCamy are going to marry next year, combine our farm and farm hands with more folks. Yeah, more folks to help perform all of hard work that we like, Mama. I love the farm and the farm life.” Taffy exhales with a worried brow. “Mama, how you ever noticed that only a set of females are always picked for the Apprenticeship Program?”
“You are absolutely, positively correct, girly. The smart ones, those smart females are living the luxury life there, not you, girly, not never there, Taffy. Today, tomorrow, the next day, or forever, girly! Farm life is hard work, long days. Your daddy and I want good happenings for you and our other smart daughter Tulu, along with her beau. McCamy, what’s your side of this tall tale? You and your twin Rusk are smart, good in school. Well, we were good in school. I’ve been told that your educational skills aren’t up to par anymore. What has happened to you, boy?”
“Farm work! Our daddy needs the help. We pitch in and then skip school and then other stuff.” McCamy stats and pokes the fork at the pie and then chews the food without viewing Tourann.
“Thelee, is this the man, we want to marry our daughter?” Tourann sneers at her husband.
“Every man must choose his own destiny, Tourann.” Thelee turns and winks to Tulu finishing his second piece of pie.
“Mama, please, be happy for Taffy, McCamy, and me! I’m being presented soonest. I’ll be a good Apprentice. I promise. I’ll not fail you, Mama!” Tulu turns and nods with a smile to her anger mother.
June 2nd Tuesday


Ebro Farms location
Birmingham Cliffs setting
10:10 a.m.
Ocean breeze, heated temperatures with parted clouds of sunlight


Tulu stands on all fours (her palms and her kneecaps) and then carefully eases over the flat edge on the limestone cliff surveying the sharp rock boulders that protrude out from the mountain side. She searches for that body.
She yells, “All clear down here, Taffy!” She swiftly crawls backward on all fours away from the dangerous edge and then slowly stands upright on of the solid rock surface, wiping off the sweat from her forehead with her fingers.
The landscape of dangerous Birmingham Cliffs make her teenly emotions both nervous and tense. The tall cliff tabletop stands 220 feet above the swirling warm waters of the Gulf of Mexico. She spins around with a stern face and views her sister Taffy.
In the middle of the hard rock surface, Taffy has purposefully lifted and then removed the circular wooden railing that stands guard around a huge cracked fissure pit decorating Ebro Farms, which lies parallel to the wooden cow fence. Taffy dangerously leans her upper torso over the open air space while searching intensively with both of her two eyeballs.
Tulu dashes ahead and then squats down hauling Taffy away from the edge of the fissure shouting with nervousness, “Careful there, Taffy!” She swiftly stands upright and exhales with a deep sigh. “That’s a long way down into the pit of burning fire. Why did you move the wooden guard railing, Taffy? We gotta replace it, before someone…”
“…dies…” Taffy yells then spins around slowly standing upright on top of the rock, nodding with a worried brow to Tulu. “Someone will die. I saw the numerous burning fire pits down there, inside that fissure burning some twenty feet below my feet. The thing keeps growing both wider and deeper. Rusk says it ever growls, if you sit cross-legged on top of the ground, really quiet. He comes out here to watch the baby calves, during their birth. Some of the jealous mama cows get rowdy with other calf younglings. Rusk babysits the little ones. Our purpose, this morning, a little calf had escaped from the fence. See there!” She points at the broken cow fence post. Tulu turns to see the broken fence post then nods in silence. Taffy nods and then looks back over her collar bone at the exposed fissure pit scratching an insect bite on her arm. “Think! Think! I saw that calf. Little One looks like it fell directly down into the fissure hold,” she returns back to see her sister. “One more look-see! Then I’m satisfied, Tulu. Rusk has to be certain and report back to his daddy.” She spins around and leads them back to the open fissure pit.
Tulu nods in silence and follows behind her sister towards a hole in the rock, without the protective railing.
Tulu stops and then drops down on all fours (palms and kneecaps) slowly crawling towards nothingness, stopping her finger pads at the edge on white-tinted limestone edge. She feels the heated waves drifting up the fissure fire then eases her face over the emptiness, scanning rapidly with her eyeballs along many protruded bright, yellow-tinted cavern ledges. She holds her breath feeling the toasty steam rise up from the continuous fire that burns deeply inside the mysterious fissure. Tulu clearly sees a pot of blue and red flames that acts like a geological furnace feeding warmth into the hot spring caverns which are dotted along the southeastern rock face on the Birmingham Cliffs.
McCamy told one of his scary adventures, when he rappelled down the 700-feet high mountainside and then swung out 100 feet from the rock face. Then, he bounced his two boot toes against the hard limestone once, twice, and then thrice accidentally hitting one of the open holes, within the rock face, with his smart-hole brother Rusk and his best friend Baycliff. Baycliff is named after the limestone cliffs with the freshwater bay, near his farmland located in the eastern portion of the South Beach Colony.
Taffy told the same fairy tale first, but Tulu thought it was pure hogwash.
On top of the hard surface, a set of hoofs prettily print a pair of geometric shapes in the moisture grass as each dog runs ahead and eagerly yelps for its prey. A set of voices loudly rumble in baritone timber as each horse halts on top of the smooth grass. A pair of teen males slide off each horse and advances to both Tulu and Taffy.
Then a pair of calloused hands quickly encloses around the tiny waist on Tulu jerking her backwards and then away from the dangerous cliff edge, swinging her upright to face her assailant. Two fingers gently wipe her sweaty black locks from her two angel eyes. Tulu grins at McCamy. He hugs Tulu and then tenderly kisses her soft hair, planting his jaw line on top of her bone skull, exhaling and then inhaling with love. McCamy whips his face upright then presents his sour frown to Taffy, narrowing his two eyelids, sneering first and says with a nasty timber. “Do not ever let Tulu near that fissure pit, again! Do you hear me, Taffy!”
Taffy stands in place and presents her sour frown strolling ahead towards Rusk, slapping her palm down at each bone skull on a running dog. The dogs start to jump in the air dirtying her tee shirt. She and the dogs continue ahead and then stop in front of Rusk. She leans down and whispers into his sweaty face. Rusk nods with an unhappy face. McCamy and Tulu spin around and then join the huddle.
Taffy nods and says to each twin. “I can’t come to any other conclusion, Rusk. I saw it. I think. It’s down there.” She views Tulu. “What do you think there, warty she-toad?”
Tulu turns her worried brow to see the cracked fissure pit and then returns back to see Rusk then comments. “I’m sorry, Rusk. I didn’t see the little calf’s body down there, but I did see the blazing fire of yellow, blue, and red colors. If the Little One fell down there, then it’s really burnt and toasted by now.”
McCamy reaches out and slaps the collar bone on Rusk nodding with a stern face. “Sorry there, bro! You get to go and tell our daddy the bad news. I’ll back you up. If the calf had escaped from that broken fence post, then it went over the cliff edge or down inside the open fissure pit. Either way, that calf is long dead now.” He turns and views the beautiful South Beach terrain enjoying the fertile grass lands, the white cotton fields, the knee-high brown tinted soy bean stalks, and the sturdy wooden railing that captures fifty heads of fine black and white colored beef cattle. The mature cows will be sold for trade goods later this season to Director Hico for his meal consumption at Metro City Birmingham.
McCamy exhales with puzzlement and ponders providing all the good food and the better livestock to Metro City Birmingham that holds the least number of hungry people, inside that old battered town, that represents part of old United States of America. But his daddy Ebro and all the other farm members on the South Beach council decide all the daily business arrangements for the South Beach Colony.



300 years ago, the fertile soil in the city of Birmingham, within the State of Alabama received an abundance of rain water and mountain top soil. The soil produced the finest crop fields of cotton, fruits, vegetables, floral, and plants on the planet.

After three Nuclear Wars, between the fighting United States of America and the other foreign countries plus Mother Nature, and finally poor timing, the Birmingham rich mountain soil flew off the summit peaks and then landed down in the Gulf of Mexico waters as each heavy storm rain drowned each vegetable garden down onto its rotten core underneath the flood waters.

Then, the intense heated sunlight killed each native floral plant and juicy fruit tree.

Thus, the end result was a wasteland of miles of sandy red dirt and scattered individual beautiful but creepy ground fissures emitting an upward plume of red and yellow fiery gases and water elements, like a geyser of beauty, but not crop field of rich food for all the local hungry residents.



Back into the present day, time and place, within Ebro Farms, on the limestone cliff, at 10:22 a.m., Rusk reaches over and slaps the bicep on his brother McCamy, nodding in silent acknowledgement, accepting his duty. One of the weird aftereffects from the last Nuclear War’s massive fallout residue is the creation of a block of solid dark matter space debris, within Earth’s atmosphere, where the array of sunlight cannot penetrate through the dark matter space block, except for a short period of time.
In the early morning hours, on top of Earth’s surface, from the time period of 05:01 a.m. until 5:59 a.m., a person sees only a dark black skyline, much like, during the nighttime hours, when a person sleeps for rest inside a bed mattress. Then, like a sack of oven popcorn colonels, at precisely 05:59 a.m., the Sun Block event swiftly burns away the dark matter within Earth’s atmosphere, making the air waves pop and sizzle from the heated light. Then the rays of heated sunshine glows brightly down burning each crop field with hot air temperature, signaling people to their daily work chores, starting at 06:01 a.m. at dawn, until 05:01 p.m. at dusk.
The time of dusk resets the Sun Block’s dark matter field, within Earth’s atmosphere, exactly at 05:01 p.m., every day.
During the Sun Block event, a man-made structure is closed up tight without showing the sun rays. Thus, a heavy dark tinted drape or a thick wooden pallet covers each viewing window and exposed door window, keeping the delicate human and mammal’s eyeballs protected from the dangerous blinding light.
The Thelee household provides no exception either. The glass windows and glass doors are covered in black-tinted curtains puddling down to the floor planks. In the back ground a slow-moving sweet musical song softly plays among the mumbles of soft words.
The musical song entitled Amazing Grace was written by John Newton.
John Newton was a slave trader by profession and mocked religious ideas, until he encountered a terrible thunder storm on the high seas near the town of Buncrana. The city held a people population of 6,000 individual living and thriving along the Wild Atlantic Way. Buncrana is located on the current coastline of Donegal, within the current country of Ireland.
The terrible violent sea storm off the coastline of Buncrana, in the year 1748, almost sunk his merchant ship and also a frightened John. He prayed for the safety of his person and all the ship crew mates. After his person was replaced in the same spot, on the ship’s deck, that crew mate was washed off the deck and then drowned in the wicked waves. John changed his heart and sparked a spiritual awakening. However, he continued to work in the slave trade and then retired in the year 1754 for health reasons. He studied theology and devoted his time becoming a new minister in the year 1764.
On New Year’s Day, in the year 1773, he preached at an Anglican church in the town of Olney, within the country of England speaking the first two lines coming from his popular “Amazing Grace” sermon. He said to the attendees, “I once was lost, but now am found. Was blind but now I see.”
Over the years, his preaching sermons became very popular within the newly formed United States of America. His sermons were published in book format, in the year 1790, in the two cities of New York City and Philadelphia. In the year 1830, his printed sermon was presented and established to a musical hymn.

South Beach is the current shoreline’s nickname, for the southeastern corner, with the Colonies of U.S.A., in the year 2076. Birmingham Metro City encompasses some of the old individual States from the United States of America and a few major town remnants starting in radiated Charleston, West Virginia, where only deformed mammals live, maybe some deformed men reside heading downwards to the smooth rock-coated landscape within the Grand Rock Valley Colony, going further southeast to drowning waters of the Swamp Island Colony and ending at the mountain cliffs in the South Beach Colony before falling off, dying in the heated waters of the Gulf of Mexico.
To understand the new and improved swirling waters of the Tennessee River, you must understand the city of Memphis.
In the year 2076 A.D., the city of Memphis resides on the Mississippi River, in the southeastern corner of the U.S. State of Tennessee, standing 337 feet high from sea level, where the high bluffs of limestone rock protect the land from the waters of the river. Memphis proper is comprised of 364.00 square miles of landscape, 355.00 square feet in land and 10.00 square miles or 2.74 percent of fresh water.
The current population is 4,348,260. The city landscape overlaps into numerous tiny rural homesteads in the three U.S. States of Arkansas, Mississippi, and Missouri.
Historically, a natural sight of human settlement, since 0001 A.D., by the Native American Indians. The first visitors to the Memphis landscape was Spanish conquistador Hernando de Soto, in the year 1541 A.D., exploring the New World or the future United States of America. Centuries later, the city became an agricultural market for cotton and lumber first then expanded into an international transportation hub with boats, planes, trains, and trucks moving commerce, cargo, food, and musical entertainment items.
The city features humid subtropical climate pattern. The summer days are both hot and humid with frequent afternoon and evening thunderstorms. The early autumn days are drier and mild with heated temperatures, until the month of October. Late autumn days and nights are rainy and cooler. The highest precipitation of rain occurs in the month of November.
The winter days are mild to chilly with sporadic snowfall of 02.70 inches. Ice storms and freezing rain drops occur endangering man-made poles, paved city streets, and all human life.
In the spring months, severe thunderstorms comprise large hail balls, strong winds, floods, and frequent bolts of lightning and some deadly land tornadoes.
The ancient United States of American history books did not lecture or teach or tattle to the students or the parents or the citizens regarding an underground fault line within the New Madrid Seismic Zone.
The New Madrid Seismic Zone contains an underground fault drawn 120 land miles starting at the southwestern city of Charleston, within the U.S. State of Missouri, downwards towards the city of Caruthersville, Missouri, through the town of Blytheville, Arkansas, heading in a northeasterly direction to the town of Marked Tree, Arkansas. The fault line crosses five U.S. States including Missouri, Tennessee, Mississippi, Kentucky and Arkansas and intersects three underwater places inside the Mississippi muddy river basin and two underwater points, inside the Ohio River.
In the central region, comprising a land-locked mass, without sea waters or shoreline edges, within the United States of America, a fault line occurs below the dirt, not on top of the surface and is located 200 feet below the grass blades.
On the west coastline of the U.S. States of Washington, Oregon, California, and Alaska and the country of Mexico, where the continental tectonic plate shifts then shuffles the surface area including the grasses, hills, dirt, rocks, trees, lakes, animals, and peoples.
The difference between a shoreline and a non-shoreline is the landscape features a hard, cold, dry, less fractured crust that does not shake, rattle, and roll off the landscape and then drown down into the cold sea waters. However, if an earthquake occurs below the land, the damage quickly spread underground affecting a radius 20 times larger than the epicenter.
On January 23, 1812 and then on February 7, 1812, the New Madrid fault line produced an earthquake with a magnitude of 7.5 shaking the city of Memphis extending the shifting pattern southwesterly down into the city of Birmingham, within the U.S. State of Alabama, which is 247 miles southwest from Memphis. The Mississippi River bed rose so high and rapidly that the river waters started to run backwards for 24 hours.
The after effects from the two earthquakes, above the ground and underneath the ground there at the present day city of Memphis, within the present day U.S. State of Tennessee, in the years 1811 and 1812, were ten times larger than the magnitude 07.80 earthquake on the shoreline town of present day city of San Francisco, within the present day U.S. State of California, in the year 1906 A.D.
In the year 2021 A.D., the fault line, within the New Madrid Semitic Zone, was still not active and was definitely not fully understood by the smartass scientists and could pose a potential danger of death and destruction from a future earthquake threatening parts and pieces of nine present day U.S. States, including Illinois, Indiana, Missouri, Arkansas, Kentucky, Tennessee, Oklahoma, Mississippi, and Alabama.
The smartass scientists told the calm American citizens, the probability risk of a damaging earthquake, with a magnitude of 08.00, held a low seven percentage points out of 100, over the time span of 50 long years. However, the smartass scientists did not include the threat of a nuclear war blast within their scientific and mathematical calculations.
Now, I must explain the concept of a watershed.
A watershed is a high level of solid land, such like, ridges and mountains, where rainfall and snowmelt particles drain or shed the liquid water downwards into all the small streams and rivers. Then the small streams and rivers shed downwards the same liquid waters down into larger bodies of water, such like, lakes, bays, rivers, and eventually the ocean waters.
For the Tennessee River, the watershed lands reside within the U.S. States of Tennessee, Alabama, Mississippi, and Kentucky, creating a U-shaped flowing body of fresh water over 652 land miles creating a basin of water of 40,876 square miles. The physical flow of water measures 70,575 cubic feet-per-second.
A cubic foot is the unit of volume measuring sides of length. One cubic foot equals 62.37 pounds.
The Tennessee River sits 813 feet high above sea level.
Historically and geographically, the Tennessee River is formed from two smaller rivers joining together beside the city of Knoxville, within the U.S. State of Tennessee flowing in a southwesterly direction beside the city of Chattanooga below the Appalachian Mountain foothills, missing the U.S. State of Georgia landscape completely by 250 feet and then crosses downwards beside the cities of Huntsville, Decatur, and Muscle Shoals, within the U.S. State of Alabama, skirting along the northern border on the U.S. State of Mississippi running back into the Tennessee landscape and heads upwards towards the city of Paducah, within the U.S. State of Kentucky and then dumps down into the Ohio River.
Now, Mother Nature created a specific pathway for the Tennessee River. Of course, mankind came along and redirected her lovely work.
Over the decades, the array of individual man-made dams were constructed to block the natural flow of the river water and veered the waters towards a new developing man-made town, for transport, commerce and trade or creating a new lake reservoir for recreational entertainment, throughout four U.S. States including Tennessee, Alabama, Mississippi, and Kentucky.
In the year 2076, during the surprising viciously planned invasion fight, within Nuclear War Three, the massive bombardment on the major city of Chattanooga surrounded by a mountain range viciously destroyed all the peoples and the properties first then killed millions of life forms second, when massive rocky summits rolled down in waves of large rock boulders coming from the damaged mountain peaks onto the burning land and splashing down into the river waters.
