These Tennessee River tributaries quietly flooded and then quickly drowned all the coastline landscape or wiped out the following man-made cities, including Bridgeport, Alabama; Chattanooga, Tennessee; Cherokee, Alabama; Clifton, Tennessee; Decatur, Alabama; Florence, Alabama; Gilbertsville, Kentucky; Grand Rivers, Kentucky; Guntersville, Alabama; Huntsville, Alabama; Killen, Alabama; Langston, Alabama; Muscle Shoals, Alabama; Paducah, Kentucky; Savannah, Tennessee; Scottsboro, Alabama; Sheffield, Alabama; South Pittsburg, Tennessee; Triana, Alabama, and Waterloo, Alabama leaving a gigantic semi-circular fresh water lake holding numerous native species of fish, turtles, snakes, and birds covering the northern portion of Alabama, the southern part of Tennessee, and the eastern side of Kentucky. Amen!

Back 50,000 years ago, the geographical central portion of the United States of America was covered by an inland sea that drained down into the Mississippi River and all of its watery tributaries dumping down into the Gulf of Mexico waters, creating large rich fertile floodplains traveling downwards into the sea beds and the sea salty waters.
The Mississippi River is the second longest river and the second largest drainage system residing on the North America continent.
The tiny fresh water stream begins at Brower’s Spring located in the U.S. State of Montana creating 3,710 miles of the Mississippi River.
Brower’s Spring is also the water source for the Missouri River.
Actually, there is still an on-going scientific geographical debate among the academicians, if the source of the mighty Mississippi River starts at either Brower’s Spring or Lake Itasca, in the Itasca State Park, in Clearwater County, within the U.S. State of Minnesota. The depth of Lake Itasca is three feet deep.
The tributary bodies of water draining down into the Mississippi River sheds from 32 different U.S. States and two provinces in the country of Canada between the Rocky Mountain and the Appalachian Mountain Range. Some of the major tributaries include Saint Croix River; Wisconsin River; Rock River; Illinois River; Kaskaskia River; Ohio River; Minnesota River; Des Moines River; Missouri River; White River; Arkansas River; Ouachita River; Yazoo River; Big Black River; Red River, and the Atchafalaya River. The catchment basin is 1,245,000 square miles.
The river waters flow in a southernly direction for 2,320 miles through the major U.S.A. cities including Saint Cloud, Minnesota; Minneapolis, Minnesota; Saint Paul, Minnesota and La Crosse, Wisconsin. And all the Quad Cities from the two U.S. States of Indiana and Illinois traveling down into the present day city of Saint Louis, within the U.S. State of Missouri; Memphis, Tennessee; Greenville, Mississippi; Vicksburg, Mississippi; Baton Rouge, Louisiana; New Orleans, Louisiana, and finally at the ocean town of  Pilottown, within the Plaquemines Parish, of the U.S. State of Louisiana channeling downwards into the warm waters of the Gulf of Mexico.
The river borders or passes through the following ten U.S. States including Minnesota, Wisconsin, Iowa, Illinois, Missouri, Kentucky, Tennessee, Arkansas, Mississippi, and Louisiana.
The Mississippi River discharges water particles at 700,000 cubic feet-per-second.
The world’s longest river, Amazon, discharges water particles at 7,000,000 cubic feet-per-second.
For centuries, since the birth of mankind, the Mississippi River surface waters dump thick layers of rich silt deposits onto the river beds creating rich fertile lands for farm crops, where the first inhabitants of North America continent, in 4,000 B.C., the Native Americans Indians resided and thrived. The Native American Indians were first established hunters-gatherers cultivating sunflowers, goosefoot, marsh elder, and wild squash vegetables for food. 
In the year 800 A.D., the natives morphed from hunter-gatherers into productive crop farmers planting and then harvesting agricultural crops featuring maize corn, field beans, and squash vegetables.
Over a geologic timeframe, the naturally outflowing course, on the Mississippi River, has changed its watery pathway with numerous methods and time periods while still draining down into the Gulf of Mexico waters, due either to Mother Nature inferences or man-made creations with locks, damns, and levees.
Along with those crazy, inventive, ancient productive crop farmers, modern mankind, with their modern man-made implements continue to farm the fertile lands over a greater time and place and then continue to create their new modern man-made environment problems including poisoned water, toxic air, and contaminated soil. And all of these new man-made poisons and toxins continue to become channeled down through the Mississippi River into the Gulf of Mexico creating the Dead Zone. The Dead Zone, within the Gulf of Mexico, is 100 miles wide by 100 miles long featuring man-made toxic chemicals from agricultural runoff draining off all fertile farm lands creating a poisonous zone of death to aquatic life forms. Nothing lives or survives or thrives there but death. And it is getting bigger too.
For decades, scientists claim fresh river waters and salt ocean sea do not mix. Since the creation of the North America continent, fresh surface water runoff has drained into the Gulf of Mexico floating on top of the salty water, creating a dark blue plume. The dark blue plume enters the Straits of Florida and then the Gulf Stream skirting the tip on the Florida peninsula traveling up the southeast coastline of Georgia and then finally blends into the Atlantic Ocean cold salt waters.
The final Mother Nature inference, she applies the natural process of avulsion or delta switching. The mouth on the river shifts its outflow region every 1,000 years as deposits of thicker and thicker silt and sediments begin to clog the current channel water. The water lever increases and causes the flow to find a steeper more direct route channeling downwards into the Gulf of Mexico. The avulsion process, over the past 5,000 years, has shifted the coastline of south Louisiana by 50 land miles, within the Gulf of Mexico waters.
First, the current formation of the Mississippi River basin was shaped by the Laurentide Ice Sheet from the Ice Age in the year 5000 B.C. When the ice sheet began to recede, rich sediment particles were deposited among the beds, creating the flat and fertile Mississippi Valley. When the ice sheets started to melt, giant glacial rivers drained water pathways into the Mississippi watershed creating such like, the valleys along the Minnesota River and James River. When ice sheets completed retreated, the newly created rivers flowed into Hudson Bay basin or the Arctic Ocean waters, leaving the 2,032 mile long Mississippi River.
Close to 300,000 years ago, the solid ice sheets, during the Ilinoian Stage blocked the formation of the Mississippi basin at Rock Island, Illinois and then diverted the current channel farther to the west along the western border on the U.S. State of Illinois. Thus, currently, the canal waters flow down the ancient channel coming from Rock Island to Hennepin, Illinois, south to Alton, Illinois and then follows the Illinois River dumping into the present Mississippi River basin.
In the year 2500 B.C., the mouth on the Mississippi River dumped out at the present location of Bayou Teche.
To provide a bird’s eye, on the ancient geographical location, the town of Saint Martinsville, within the St. Martin Parish, in the U.S. State of Louisiana lies on Bayou Teche. The town resides 16 miles east from city of Lafayette; 20 miles west of the Atchafalaya River; 10 miles north of the town of New Iberia, and two miles south of the Gulf of Mexico waters.
After the avulsion process completely, the newly formed bayou starts at the present day city of Port Barre flowing 135 miles south, kissing the lower Atchafalaya River waters at the town of Berwick. The name, Teche, is rumored to come from the Native American Chitimacha Indian word, tenche, meaning snake. The Chitimacha Indian Lore tells an ancient story about a massive river snake attacking their seashore villages and killing both some of their natives and animals. A great many Chitimacha Braves took many years to find and then kill the massive snake. When its massive carcass rested in death and started to decompose, the heavy bones left a deep indentation in the landscape as waters flowed down and then flooded the depression creating the bayou.
In the year 800 B.C., the mouth of the Mississippi River shuffled again moving further away from Bayou Teche in a southeasterly direction, due to the avulsion process.
In the year 200 A.D., the mouth of the river switched location a 1,000 years later, shifting again, in an east by southeast direction moving to the present day location of Bayou Lafourche.
After the avulsion, the river mouth split forming a descending fork named Bayou Lafourche. The early settlers used the bayou as a means of communication, a method of transportation, and a source of fresh water.
In the year 1000 A.D., the mouth of the river switched again further east by southeast to the present day location of Pilottown, Louisiana.
In the year 1400 A.D., the Red River of the South, within the U.S. State of Texas flows parallel to the lower region on the Mississippi River and then channels down into Gulf of Mexico waters.
Over the centuries, an oxbow watery loop forms on the Mississippi River creating a westward connection at present day location of Angola, Louisiana.
Red River runs in central United States of America is named from its reddish water color passing through bed fields of red within its watershed. Two springs branches in the Texas Panhandle form and then flow in an eastern direction bordering between the two U.S. States of Texas and Oklahoma then the border line of U.S. State of Arkansas between turning south at Fulton, flowing into the U.S. State of Louisiana, feeding the man-named Atchafalaya River and then dumps down into the Gulf of Mexico waters. The Red River is 1,360 miles and flows at 57,000 cubic feet-per-second.
Since the melting of the ice sheets from the Ice Age and then the creation of all the natural river systems, the natural course on the Red River and the Mississippi River had been entirely separate and then flowed parallel to each other separated between independent swamps and bayous but still dumped down into the Gulf of Mexico waters.
In the year 1401 A.D., Mother Nature intervenes. The waters on the Mississippi River continues to flow to the south and then starts to turn steering to the west, developing a loop. The loop finally intersects the Red River waters creating a downstream flow. The humans named the lower Red River waters, the Atchafalaya River. In the year 2021, the Atchafalaya River was a second transportation avenue for all river boat ships and still dumped both waters and ships down into the Gulf of Mexico warm waters. 
In the year 1876, in the month of March, the Mississippi River changes its watery course and creates a new river channel at the town of Reverie, within the U.S. State of Tennessee, physically separating the landscape of both people and animals from the U.S. States of Arkansas and Tennessee.
In the year 1881, the town of Kaskaskia, within the U.S. State of Illinois stands on top of a peninsula at the confluence of two rivers, the Mississippi River and the Kaskaskia River. After flooding rain water overtakes the peninsula forming a new Mississippi River channel and cuts the town layout from the rest of the landscape. In the year 2021, the town of Kaskaskia is an island with 14 residents living on 2,300 acres of land and is only accessible by a Missouri roadway.
Beside the threat of heavy and continuous rain water from the skies upon a river system that will start to flow then floods the ground soil, a second threat to the land and the natives is an earthquake.
The New Madrid Seismic Zone, along the Mississippi River, is located at present day city of New Madrid, within the U.S. State of Missouri between the two river cities of Memphis and Saint Louis and is a failed rift or aulacogen. The failed rift formed at the same time as the Gulf of Mexico waters. This geographical area is highly active with numerous seismically movement including the ancient previous earthquakes in the years 1811 and 1812.
Those two ancient earthquakes affected the surrounding landscape, of course, and were felt as far as the land-locked cities in the Midwest, within the South, and on the Eastern coastline and also created a new lake.
At 01:00 p.m., on Christmas Day, on the date of December 25, 1699, the first written record of an earthquake was felt inside a French missionary site, on the Mississippi River. The site was reported near present day city of Memphis, within the U.S. State of Tennessee. The ancient world explorers recorded ground shaking.
At 07:15 a.m., on December 16, in the year 1811 A.D., on the fault line, at the epicenter in northeast Arkansas, an earthquake with a magnitude of 9.0 shook for 12 minutes the landscape, at the future site of Memphis, Tennessee creating uplifts of ground soil and a sight of water waves moving upstream on the Mississippi River. Trees were knocked down and river banks collapsed.
Glass window panes and furniture pieces shook in Washington D.C. Bells rang in Richmond, Virginia. House foundations and fresh water from underground well structures sloshed in the air in Charleston, South Carolina. Plaster walls dropped off houses in Columbia, South Carolina. Furniture pieces moved across the floors in the city of Jefferson, Indiana and terrified residents fled their shaking homes in the cities of Lebanon, Ohio and Herculaneum, Missouri.
At 09:45 a.m., on February 7, in the year 1812, at the epicenter of New Madrid, within the U.S. State of Missouri created a magnitude 07.50 underground earthquake and then destroyed the town of New Madrid. In the town of Saint Louis, within the U.S. State of Missouri, many houses were severely damaged and some of the rooftop chimneys were toppled down onto the ground. 
On the Reelfoot Fault, a reverse fault segment crossed underneath bottom soil on the Mississippi River heading south at the Kentucky Bend and continued to the east as the Lake County Uplift. The uplift plus the fault created temporary waterfalls on the Mississippi River, created an upstream wave, and created the formation of the Reelfoot Lake from damming streams.
At 09:15 a.m., on January 23, in the year 1815, a rupture on the northern New Madrid Fault line, at the epicenter in southern Illinois, in the city of New Madrid, Tennessee created a magnitude 07.30 underground earthquake resulting in widespread ground deformation, landslides, fissures, cavern collapses.
From the years 1812 to 1984, the New Madrid Seismic Zone recorded 4,000 earthquakes highlighting the largest quakes in the years of 1877, 1843, and 1895.
On October 31, in the year 1895, an earthquake event produced a 06.60 magnitude, at the epicenter, in the town of Charleston, within the U.S. State of Missouri. The quake damaged buildings in the city, crated sand volcanoes, cracked the bridges, and toppled chimneys in the cities of Cairo, Illinois; St Louis, Missouri; Memphis, Tennessee; Gadsden, Alabama and Evansville, Indiana.
On the date, of November 9th, in the year 1968, a 05.40 magnitude earthquake near the town of Dale, within the U.S. State of Illinois damaging man-made buildings and was felt by people and pets, within 23 U.S. States, including the Eastern coastline, on the ocean town of Boston, within the U.S. State of Massachusetts.
The New Madrid Fault Line is embedded in a sub-surface rift that formed during the breakup of the single supercontinent landmass, 750 million years ago. The rift failed to split the surface layers of land into its own continent, thus remaining intact, like a wounded scar, creating a Zone of Weakness. This hollow scar lies deep underground and has made the Earth’s crust, within the New Madrid Fault Line landscape, a weaker landmass than the rest of the North America continent.
The Zone of Weakness is an image of a human’s cupped palm as the rift and all drifting air molecules form a pocket or a zone pocket. The Zone of Weakness is an important factor relative to the east to west compression forces coming from the continental drift of the North American plate, in turn, this landmass become more prone earthquakes far away from the tectonic plate border.
This cupped-image of a human palm sits directly underneath the river beds on the eastern bank of the Mississippi River and the bluff cliffs of Memphis, Tennessee.
From a geology point of view, the water depths at Lake Itasca, starting the first-born stream of the might Mississippi River, begins at three feet deep, and then the water level raises upwards to 12 feet deep, between the upper northern city of Saint Paul, within the U.S. State of Minnesota. At the center geographical river city of Cairo, within the U.S. State of Illinois, the water depth raises 30 feet in depth. Below the city of Cairo, the river water reaches 100 feet deep. The deepest part of the Mississippi River averages 200 feet in water depth at the city of New Orleans.
Mother Nature makes rain clouds producing sheets of rain, feeding fresh clean water to both men and animals. Rain waters flood all rivers and the Mississippi River is not exempt from Mother Nature. In the year 1927 A.D., the governmental engineers closed off all side water channels forcing the increase of flood waters into the main river. The speed of the river particles would scrape the bottom sediments deepening the river bed and decreasing flood water overflowing onto the landscape. Well, the engineers were wrong.
So, the Great Mississippi Flood of 1927; Great Flood of 1951, and the Great Flood of 1993 affected the river beds and flooded the landscape anyways displacing people and plants. Over the long decades, the ancient American geologists predicted the course of the Mississippi River will change its route going through the Atchafalaya Basin or Lake Pontchartrain still dumping all the fresh waters down into the Gulf of Mexico waters.

In the early mild winter days, at the start of the new calendar year 2076 A.D., the bombardment of colorful laser beams by foreign man-made weapons start to damage and then burn all the healthy groves of trees, the diverse aquatic fauna, flowers, and fishes first and then continue to perturb the massive deep 200 feet of fresh waters on the Mississippi River.
At the mouth of the Mississippi River, the massive bomb attack blast the waters, the properties, the ships, the soldiers, the peoples, and the pets, over and over again, creating a second unnatural tidal wall, on top of the river, thrusting forward a monster 113 foot high wall of water in a northernly direction. The rushing wall of water increases the mechanical stress on the New Madrid Fault Line, along the Mississippi River, compressing the lithosphere, perturbing the shallow sub-surface failed rift. The naturally created 100 feet high tidal wave generates a massive ground motion and fills the blue sky first, then the lands next, and finally the seas last. The solid heavy matter perturbs the non-active fault line into life starting to shake, rattle, and roll surface waters, lands, and underground streams, and dirt balls into numerous geographical gigantic upthrust of waves with hard rocks and thick dirt particles pouring over and then wiping out 25 million peoples, places, and pets, within eleven U.S. States including Alabama, Arkansas, Georgia, Kentucky, Illinois, Indiana, Mississippi, Missouri, Oklahoma, Tennessee, and Texas.
Eight month later, on August 18th, the Nuclear War Three is won by the rebels from the United States of America, the Mississippi Basin with all its fish species, turtles, snakes, fauna, and groves of woodlands have disappeared creating a new shoreline in the center of the formal U.S. State of Mississippi and leaves behind a tiny semi-crooked creek stream of fresh drinking water smoothly flowing northernly into the dead and burnt Canada boundary.

Back then, in the year 2076 A.D., the gleeful popular ancient city of Memphis was located at the southwestern corner, with the Deep South. Now, Nashville Metro City is the newest southwestern corner, within the newly created Colonies of the U.S.A.
Three weeks, after all the water droplets dried and the fiery skyline cleared, pouring brightly heated sunrays down on the damage landscape, starting at the major city of Knoxville, in-between all the low-lying smaller towns of Harrison; Kingston; Lenoir City; Loudon; Soddy-Daisy, and Signal Mountain, finally ending on the outskirts of the major city of Chattanooga, the river waters dried up creating flat valleys of dry dirt and dead grove of trees. The falling bombs had blown off large swatches of heavy, fiery rock boulders from all the mountain summits raining down, blocking the river bed and halted water flow into the Tennessee River, thus creating the Grand Rock Valley Colony.
In the back yard of the Birmingham Metro City, running ten miles from the dry meadow fields, a 248 foot long by 136 foot wide by 97 foot high, without a rooftop, ugly, metal foot bridge flows over the rough-moving Tennessee River leading directly into the ancient city of Nashville, within the ancient U.S. State of Tennessee. However, an uglier, 66 foot long, by 18 foot wide, by 117 foot high row of metal security gates, blocked and bolted, stands between you and the other civilized Colony.
Only an assigned and paid Director can grant your person with his or her vocal permission to enter his or her guarded and protected Colony, since there is limited transportation, limited food, limited employment, and unlimited opportunity for a set of naughty stuff, by a gang of naughty folks.
Within Birmingham Metro City, among the cold air temperatures and a skyline of thick gray-tinted clouds of mild winter weather, Director Hico briefly speaks to his captured audience, the immediate and extended family members and their male or female new Apprentice. A female is given a lovely bouquet of flowers. A male receives a handshake, not a flower. The 16 years old males and females are separated from their family members and then split apart entering a different section inside an ancient building, with some new and improved features, known as the Metro City Dance Hall, which once named the Birmingham Civic Center.

At 03:01 p.m., the Presentation Ceremony was held in front of the ancient building, in the cold windy weather, perturbing all the Apprentices, for their upcoming fighting fun, and detouring all the biological guardians foreverly from the program. Hico usually always encouraged all family members to return home, so he conducted his program in secret without interference from a nosy or bossy parent.
However, this new solar season, Hico has invited all the family members to stay and reside in one of the ratty hotels located a block away from the Metro City Dance Hall and they will come and watch their child dance in the new floor competition.
The Metro City Dance Hall appears both damaged and ugly standing ten stories high on the outside walls of broken, smashed, crushed, and missing row of red bricks, wearing a ratty metal tin roof in various shade prints from silver-tint to red-tint protecting the interior walls. The side towers offered nice individual hotel rooms during the happier times, in the year 2076 A.D. Now, all the windows have been boarded or cemented covering each empty hole for protection from the nasty weather elements and flying mammals and any soaring metal objects.
The front entrance displays ten dirty, whitish-black colored, tall, thick concrete, circular columns holding the center portion of the building upright and steady, even after the massive laser bombardment.
The smooth front porch slab presents shallow and deep pot holes and short and long cracked concrete fissures but is suitable for walking for an upright human or a crawling animal. A visitor or an Apprentice climbs 34 whitish-black concrete steps with missing blocks and cracked fissures but is suitable for marching for an upright human or a crawling animal.
Then the person enters an open archway from one of four doorways, without a wooden or metal protection door. Walking further into the entranceway setting, the person feels and views all the ceiling holes seeing the gray tinted clouds in the sky and above their hair roots. Then the person halts and slowly enters through an active electronic machine scanning each body frame for a deadly weapon, in case, an angry fit from an emotional teen, after losing the only spot, within the Apprenticeship Program.
Once an approval from the machine, the person walks through the row of metal doors entering the dance hall reception lobby. The lobby space is dark and cold. The entrance wall feels cold and contains a long metal wall in black hue with scattered rusty spots. Across from the metal wall, a warm wooden wall of new and ancient planks in dark hue and features two archways. Each archway holds four sliding doors, all closed. Behind the closed doors, the dance hall waits for the Apprentices.
Each side wall is an open space leading deeper into a new hallway. Further down the hallway, lovely colors pop on all the walls.
If a visitor or an Apprentice moves to the left-side open wall, the wall colors change into dark green introducing the work room for Superintendent Kodare then pads further down into blood red tinted walls towards the work room for Superintendent Doboil.
In the opposite side, if a visitor or an Apprentice shuffles to the right-side open wall, the wooden walls change into pretty lavender paint introducing the first work room for the females under the direction of Superintendent Vovina, padding further down, viewing a pink-tinted walls and finally the last work room for the female teens with Superintendent Starbe.
Inside the damaged ancient building, the theater stage platform still exits and is still located behind the two archways, in its original place and wooden state, for all future entertainment performances. Like in the year 2076 A.D., before the Third Nuclear War, people enjoyed attending a theater stage performance forgetting about their troubles and worries for one long moment. And the theater stage actors needed to practice for a brilliant performance making the visitors happy again. Thus, each theater stage is built beside a rehearsal stage for all the actors and actresses.
Hico has employed the same concept. Beside each intact and non-damaged original theater stage, there are two rehearsal stages. Each rehearsal room has been slightly modified and presents a smaller version of the entertainment theater with a smaller center stage a few inches from a solid floor and reduced floor space without windows and a draw curtain for drama, on the side wall.
Over the five year period, within the Apprenticeship Program, Hico has slowly added male teens mixed with the female teen Apprentices creating the need for two additional rehearsal rooms. He cut through the chorus space and modified the room duplicating the two female rehearsal rooms for the teens. Each enclosed dressing room for an actor or actress is the current office space for a working superintendent.
The musical song Material Girl came from the album entitled Like A Virgin and performed by American musical artist Madonna in the year 1984. The musical songs played were Pop sounds.

At 03:13 p.m., moving down an empty hallway, that was once painted in pretty shade of lavender hue, presents columns of peeling paint particles in dull gray hue, depressing rows of dead potted flowers, and columns of old and dusty framed pictures of ancient and dead city leaders, a 30-year-old looking, tall, slender woman named Superintendent Vovina leads a line of twenty-six female teens from the front of a depleted, red brick-covered, ten-story building, strolling down an ugly hallway while clapping with her smile.
Vovina yells without seeing any of her teens, “Come this way! Follow me, my little sugar plums! Tsk! Tsk! March along! One. Two. Three. We have much to accomplish, before our assigned bedtime ritual. March along! One. Two. Three.” Each female Apprentice forms a long line, which is broken out into pairs or a single girl.
Moving down the ugly hallway, a cute petite teen measures five feet and two inches in short height, a head of shoulder length dirty blonde hair strands, a tone of peach-beige tinted skin, and a pair of green colored pupils wearing an ankle-length red tinted dress with long sleeves underneath a pink tinted turtleneck shirt and a pair of work boots in black hue. Apprentice Kiwi smiles with excitement of the Apprenticeship Program and follows behind the back spine on a taller teen, moving between a pair of two other new Apprentices, touching her bouquet of flowers. She says, “This bouquet of flowers is beautiful.”
A tall, sexy teen measures five feet and eleven inches in height on a muscular body frame, a head of short brown tinted hair, a tone of ivory skin and a pair of brown eyes wearing a ratty, tacky, short mini-dress in ugly brown fabric, which has been patched repeatedly, and a pair of flat non-polished sandals exposing her unpolished toenails. Apprentice Brazoria follows behind the swishing skirt on Vovina and then drops her flower bouquet down on the floor. She snarls with a lovely sneer, “This ain’t a real bouquet of flowers. The flowers represent a nest of nasty honeysuckle vines that grow wild all over the dirt and up through the broken concrete slabs here in Birmingham Metro City and thrive through all kinds of weather, including ice and snow.”
The teen appears a tall height of five feet and eight inches, on a queen-sized body frame, possessing a tone of pink tinted skin, a pair of violet eyeballs, and a head of long red tinted hair strands, wearing a short-sleeved, blue-tinted tee shirt over a pair of orange-tinted, ankle-length pants and a pair of soft leather shoes in green hue. Apprentice Jellico moves ahead with another teen and pats her small bouquet of honeysuckles saying with a smile. “The flowers smell heavenly to my nose holes. Almost like, I can eat all of them for dinner time.”
The teen presents an average height and weight body frame, of five feet and six inches, possessing a tone of peach tinted skin, a head of cropped strawberry blonde hair strands, and a pair of brown eyes, wearing a pair of ripped white-tinted blue jeans, an aquamarine colored, long-sleeved tee shirt, and a pair of unpolished, brown-tinted cowgirl boots. Apprentice Atoka points down at the tiny light green tinted stem on each honeysuckle plant in her bouquet. “You don’t eat the honeysuckle plant. You suck down a honeysuckle by pulling out the flower stem which leaks out its sweet honey juice and then lick the plant stick with your tongue,” she jerks one of the tiny stems from the flower and lifts to her mouth, sucking on the plant stem, pulling it out with a smile and a nod, “Mmm! It’s sweetly good! We lick sticks back home in Miss.”
The petite, plain-looking teen measures five feet and three inches possessing a head of long auburn tinted hair strands, a pair of grey colored pupils, and a tone of yellow tinted skin, wearing an ankle-length, yellow tinted wool dress without sleeves with a black tinted turtleneck shirt and a pair of brown tinted work boots. Apprentice Etta moves down the empty hallway sounding with loud laughter beside her new friend Atoka. “You talk funny, girlfriend! And what are you missing here? I see that you got both your travel bag and your bouquet of honeysuckles.”
Atoka nods with a grin then says. “Miss is a shorten name for the old State called Mississippi. We used to be an independent Colony, in the year 2076, and worked with our own government, governor and guts…”
“Guts and glory!” The teen whispers for her eardrums and appears in average height standing at five feet and seven inches on an overweight body frame, a head of short black tinted hair strands, a pair of black pupils, and a tone of black skin wearing a long-sleeved, pink-tinted tee shirt, a pair of white tinted walking shorts, and a pair of polished black-tinted cowgirl boots. Apprentice Ocee strolls alone and frowns down at the floor, holding the flower bouquet near her leg.
She shouts out loud for all eardrums, “Guts and glory! That was once the ancient theme motto within the old United States of America, before my home town of Memphis, Tennessee sunk down into the dried beds on the non-flowing Mississippi River. Now, my home town is gone and the new motto is long and gone or beaten and bloody…”
“I agree with her.” Una spins around and nods to Ocee. Una presents a slender body frame measuring five feet and two inches, possessing a short hair bob of dirty blonde-tinted strands, a pair of amber pupils, and a tone of coffee-colored skin flesh. She wears an ankle-length ratty dress in pink hue underneath a long coat in brown tint and a pair of brown tinted work boots.
Ocee looks up and slaps her chest nodding back to the new teen, saying out loud. “My name is Ocee.” She speeds her step then strolls beside her new friend Una.
“O! You’re the baby whale that Hico had to carry from the South Beach Colony, this afternoon, rolling off them Birmingham Cliffs. Ain’t that right, girlfriend?” Brazoria still follows Vovina and laughs with an evil tone. She has memorized and assessed each teen girl for the solo position of the Apprentice job. No other female measures greater than Brazoria.
Ocee gasps in confusion then yells at the rear hairy bone skull on a taller Brazoria. “I beg your pardon, non-girlfriend!”
A tall, skinny teen measures five feet and ten inches possessing a head of long brown hair strands, a tone of honey colored skin, and a pair of hazel pupils, wearing a fitted, knee-length dress in bright yellow fabric with scattered large red flowers and a pair of red-tinted, polished cowgirl boots. Apprentice Pemona follows behind the two shorter body frames on Ocee and Una studying the body size and the body movements on a taller muscular Brazoria. Pemona laughs with a grin and then yells for fun. “Didn’t Director Hico purposefully or accidentally nickname you, Godzilla Brazoria, sweetie?” The other teens laugh with Pemona inside the nosily hallway.
Brazoria spins around from the skirt hemline on Vovina and shuffles backwards jabbing her unpolished fingernail, sounding with a lady sneer at a tall Pemona, then a plump Ocee, and finally a petite Una. “I do not like you or you or you. This place is a pure girly competition for the one to graduate from the Apprenticeship Program, not some old timey Garden Party, ya’ll. We’re here to compete. Period! And I plan to rule totally.” She spins around without tripping over the unfamiliar floor and views the pretty dress on Vovina still snarling in anger at the new teen named Pemona.
Una touches her chest and smiles at the back spine on Brazoria saying to all the girls. “I’m Una. I believe we should work together and not fight for the leadership position and then show Director Hico that there is a need for many Apprentices to fix and repair the new Colonies of the U.S.A. back to its original glory and glamour.”
Before reaching the extended hallway with pink tinted walls, Vovina rolls both of her eyeballs at the cat fight among the female teens and then turns to face an open archway, strolling through the doorway into a new room, which is named the Art Gallery.

Yesterday morning, inside the South Beach Colony, at McCamy Farm’s property, beside the fiery fusion setting, at 10:44 am, McCamy’s twin brother Rusk pulls a rider-less, white-colored mare beside his black-tinted stallion then halts the two beasts of burden. He reaches over and jerks out the old shotgun from the leather saddle bag spinning around with a worried brow, scanning the limestone cliff and searches for the enemy, without seeing the enemy. Rusk slowly advances ahead towards Tulu.

Tulu stands upright in the same spot tilting her chin down into her chest, wearing a bright red-tinted swollen face coming from her steady set of rolling sad hot tears. Each tear continues to roll down from her eye socket, over her warm cheekbones, hitting her parted lips as she slowly spits out each word from her painful tale, thumbing back over her collar bone to the fiery fissure pit.

He reaches out and pulls off a set of rappelling gear from the other saddle bag, spinning around to face cliff, moving ahead towards the fiery fissure pit.

She pulls on his naked arm, without successful, yelling and screaming with more terror of him falling down into the fiery fissure pit of hell, also, along with her wounded sister Taffy and her wounded boyfriend McCamy.

Tulu dashes ahead, squats down and kneels next to Rusk while screaming, sobbing, and crying out all of her fearful worries. On top of the soft dirt particles, Rusk continues to shake his head of ratty, shoulder-length, blonde curls, which always matches his twin brother’s while finishing the assembly of the metal parts. He stands upright from the dirt and dons the climbing gear over his tall body frame. He struts ahead towards the deadly fiery fissure pit and then stops anchoring a steel hook around an extremely large, pointy stationary rock boulder and then jerks the rope steady for his body security. He does not want to tumble down and then die inside the fiery fissure pit either.

He slowly back steps towards the open lip on the pit first and then stops standing on top of the lip feeling the heated fumes raising up from the fissure’s belly of fireballs. Tulu stands on top of the rock surface and away from the fissure lip while pacing side to side, wringing both of her hands, sobbing with tears of fear and worry for her sister and her boyfriend.

He slowly shakes his shoulder length blonde hair at Tulu while wiping the heavy sweat from both of his eyebrows. He drops down and rests flat on his chest on top of the cool limestone rocks while breathing a set of heavy breathes, after briefly inhaling all the thick wet moisture molecules within the pit walls.

Tulu rushes ahead with a worried brow towards Rusk sliding down over the rock surface, before hitting his sweaty face with her two kneecaps.

Rusk slowly stands upright on both of his kneecaps and then looks behind his collar bone wearing a sad face and stares at open pit flush on top of the smooth rock surface, where the wooden man-made railing had been moved and the lip on the deadly fissure had been exposed. He shakes his blonde curls and starts to cry with his own wet sad tears and then curses out loud feeling both his sorrow and sadness, losing his twin brother to the fireballs within the fissure’s belly. He slowly views the crying face and two red tinted eyeballs on Tulu.

Tulu slowly stands upright from the rock surface still producing her heated tears and then assists Rusk to stand upright also. They lovingly cuddle in their sadness then slowly pad ahead back to the two horses and then stop exhaling with more heated tears of sorrow and emotions of sadness with the two deaths of McCamy and Taffy.

Rusk leans down and lifts the petite body on Tulu sitting her on top of McCamy’s horse. He mounts his own stallion. Then they both slowly walk the horses back home Thelee Farms, that afternoon, announcing the terrible bad news.



Back into the present day, time, and place, at 05:18 p.m., Tulu’s active mind mentally returns back into the Art Gallery setting and as her body feels the cold temperatures bombard her semi-naked teenage body, within the pretty bathrobe, standing in front of her chop block. “I only have a room full of sisters. I always wanted a big brother,” another Swamp Island girl shouts.
“We are family now!” Another Grand Rock Valley girl screams and bounces up and down sounding with an array of giggles with a silly smile to each male dancer.
Hico nods with a grin. “The time is eight o’clock, in the evening. We will dance all night, since the night is filled with young dancers. Enjoy the night! Tomorrow, the new day brings about your competitive fight! And the only winner takes it all!” He turns and nods to Vovina. She starts the ancient music player. A musical song with soft slow-moving set of beats flows through the air waves. The rows of mismatched chairs have been removed from the dance floor, except for three long food table on the entrance wall. The entrance doors are closed, and the family members are resting back at their assigned hotel room eating a hot meal also.
The musical song Will Always Love You was released, in the year 1973, by American singer and songwriter Dolly Parton. She wrote the song as a goodbye farewell to her former singer partner and musical mentor of seven years, Porter Wagoner, after deciding to pursue a solo musical career.

His Hawk mask is outlined in black and blonde colored tone that intertwines with a set of horizontal streaks around the eye brow, both ears, and the jaw line, like a set of smooth feathers, on a real hawk. June 4th Thursday


Day One
Dance Competition

Dance Hall location
Cold temperatures with dull moonlight and gray clouds
07:01 p.m.


A single bright spot light flickers down on top of the darkened dance floor. The single percussion snarl drum rolls in a steady beat.
The Dance Hall environment displays an elevated stage platform standing upright four feet from the flat dance floor; 30 feet in length and 50 feet in width, with a ceiling rooftop 60 feet high from the wooden stage. The stage platform overlooks a newly constructed 2,000 square feet ballroom dance floor between four walls of ugly peeling white tinted wallpaper with tiny lavender flowers. The cold harsh winters and cool air temperatures leak into the old building changing, modifying and disintegrating all the man-made materials. Built within one side wall corner and part of the entrance wall, six tiers of curved concrete benches can hold 1,500 individuals.
Superintendent Vovina wears a brown and white colored Puppy dog bite-nats face mask and an ankle-length white and brown-colored bite-nats gown standing on top of the stage, waving at the roaring audience members, who sit or stand on top of a curved hard concrete bleacher, within Metro City Dance Hall, and the other home sitters, who live and watch from outside Metro City Birmingham.
She screams out loud, “Lights, please!”
The music crescendos from a range of soft piano notes into an ear-piercing steel guitar string while the single spot light expands and then encompasses Vovina, then the dance floor, then the small stage of figures, and then the four sections of cheering, waving, standing, jumping, spitting, and bouncing rowdy spectators. Vovina tosses both of her arms in the air and wears a smile. “Welcome, everyone! Welcome to Apprenticeship Program!” The audience cheers and claps again. She grins and speaks loudly into the microphone. “Thank you, everyone! May I introduce to the live audience, Director Hico of Metro City Birmingham!” The audience cheers and claps again.
A single spotlight hits down on the shoes of a singular figure. The shoes stands on the edge of the stage platform then expands and finally encompasses coming upwards from the feet towards the skull. The light expands and covers the entire stage moving backwards and then outwards towards the dance floor and then into the bleachers with the rows of rowdy spectators.
Hico tosses both of his arms into the air and says with a nod. “Thank you! Thank you! I am honored to be here hosting the Fifth Annual Apprenticeship Program. And for the first time, appearing before, well, I am appearing before a live audience for the first time. But I don’t seem to be myself.” He reaches up and then touches his face covered in an Elephant bite-nats mask with an aggregated gray tinted trunk hanging down from its nose dangling into the middle of his chest. He smiled with a silly grin asking, “Do you like my happy face?” The audience cheers and claps again.
He wears a black tinted tuxedo with a red tinted bowtie, a gray tinted shirt, and a pair of black leather shoes then shakes his Elephant trunk side to side laughing out loud. He exhales then states with a smile, “Thank you! I will explain my changed appearance shortly.”
On top of the stage platform, in the single row of five oversized chairs, Vovina sits next to the empty chair that belongs to Hico then leans over with a whisper into Doboil. “What’s he doing?”
Kodare sits beside the empty chair of Hico and exhibits his Monkey bite-nats mask staring at the rowdy audience members, wearing a black tinted sleeveless, shirtless vest, a pair of matching dance pants, and a pair of orange tinted dance shoes.
Starbe sits beside Kodare and continuous flicks back and forth each ear tip on her Giraffe bite-nats mask, staring at the rowdy audience members also, wearing an ankle-length ball gown with a halter top in glittering translucence sequins with brilliant rainbow colors.
Doboil displays a Fox bite-nats mask with a pair of tiny reddish-brown hairy ears, staring at the rowdy audience also, wearing a red tinted sleeveless, shirtless vest, a matching pair of dance pants, and a pair of yellow dance shoes. He leans over and whispers back to her cheekbone. “He changed the rules.”
“What rules?” Vovina asks and stares at the rowdy audience.
“…rules are very simple…” Hico says and stares at the rowdy audience through the Elephant mask. “One, we all will have fun. Two, we all will have fun and participate. Three, we all will have fun and participate, wearing a mask.” The rowdy audience continues to loudly sound with an array of hand applauds, wild cheers, lip whistles, and foot stomps as the noise echoes throughout the Dance Hall. He says without nodding his bone skull with the heavy bite-nats trunk. “I am glad. You are glad. I have selected the mighty mammal bull elephant as my face mask. Tonight, is the first dance competition. And you can become a participate within the evening’s competition too. You can design your own personal face mask also. Bring out the bite-nats tubes!”
The ceiling tiles slowly part and then reveal an array of dangling slender clear glass tubes. Each tube slowly drops down from the open hole and then stops a few feet from each human bone skull. Then each hose sprays the bite-nats paint and then douses each person with rainbow colors red, green, blue, orange, yellow, pink, purple, silver, and gold. The audience becomes wilder and crazier while loudly applauding and cheering inside the Dance Hall.
Hico continues to stand at the edge of the platform and watches the audience.
Each chair sitter decorates a face, both arms, and their entire clothed body with the multi-colored bite-nats paint as each tube quickly empties with the colored paint. Then, the audience sounds with louder hand applauds, wild cheers, lip whistles, and foot stomps in favorite of Director Hico and the current presentation of the Apprenticeship Program in both live-action and living color.
“Bring out the dancers!” Hico waves both of his arm in the air, signaling the two door keepers. A door keeper stand at attention then silently nods back to Hico beside a closed door, on the side wall. Each keeper wears a tan colored sleeveless vest, a pair of matching trousers, a pair of tan colored boot, and an ugly brown and black tinted insect bite-nats mask.
The spot light dances back and forth across the black and white marble floor in a wild pattern as a musical song of rock and roll musical notes blasts loudly in the air, coming from a set of hidden audio speakers.
The musical song The Beautiful People was released on September 1996 on the second studio album entitled Antichrist Superstar and was performed by the American rock and roll band named Marilyn Manson. The song was written by Marilyn Manson and Twiggy Ramirez. The producers included Trent Reznor; Dave Ogilvie, and Marilyn Manson. The musical band played Rock and Alternative Rock sounds.
The lead singer Marilyn Manson is properly named as Brian Hugh Warner. He was an American rock musician and former music journalist. He was famous for his controversial stage persona and image within his musical band.
His stage name is joining of the two American cultural icons named the Hollywood movie starlet Marilyn Monroe and jailed multi-murderer Charles Manson creating a pronounced public appeal for heavy metal fans.

She wrote the song as a goodbye farewell to her former singer partner and musical mentor of seven years, Porter Wagoner, after deciding to pursue a solo musical career.

The teen dancers start to sway in slow-motion to the new musical song. Hico continues to stand at the edge of the platform and then tosses both of his arms into the air shouting out loud. “Stop!” The music stops playing. Each male dance spins around to see Hico as each female dancer stares at Hico also. The sound of silence invades the dance floor. The spot light beams onto his Elephant mask. He states, “I forgot to explain the simple rules.” The audience and dancers laugh out loud.
He smiles. “First, our teens have worked so hard to achieve this endeavor that I congratulate each and everyone one of you.” The audience and dancers clap and then cease.
“Second, the competition will be limited for precisely fifty minutes. Third, I feel very badly saying this. But everyone can succumb to failure. If your face mask waivers ever so slightly or disappears from your face for less than a second, then you will be eliminated from Apprenticeship Program.” The audience and dancers perform a playful set of loud boos and heavy foot stomps and then cease.
“I would like to remind everyone to practice good sportsmanship here. Please note! There is a panel of seated judges, who have been selected from our pool of Metro City finest…”
“Who are the seated judges against the side wall?” Vovina asks and turns staring at the side wall, studying each judge, who wears an ugly black and brown-tinted Insect bite-nats face mask.
“A row of Metro City trash cans.” Doboil turns and growls shifting his Fox face mask, staring at the same wall of judges.
She gasps. “Are the dance judges really the local Metro City prisoners? Did Hico really do that? Why has Hico dumped out a row of criminals from the tankers, who are acting as a dance judge?”
“Who better to judge a throat-cutting, knife-wielding, gut-twisting, deadly dance competition, dear?” Doboil laughs.
“Is this your brilliant idea instead? It’s splendid, Doboil!” Vovina smiles shifting her Puppy dog face mask.
Hico continues to stand and shouts on the edge of the stage, waving both of his arms at the row of judges. “Each judge will park on the sidelines and in sight of each dancer. Their dance decision is final. No replays! No repeats! No returns! I am sorry for the interruption again. Please forgive me! Start the music again!” He continues to stand on the edge of the platform and watches each dancer.
On top of the dance floor, the young male hot body wearing the Hawk mask circles around an upright Tulu and then stops standing back in front of her Calico cat mask, reaching out, hugging her into his naked chest. He whispers into her eardrum as the soft, slow-moving, musical note echoes throughout the room. “You are beautiful, Zavala.”
She giggles into his naked chest. “You can call me, Tulu. Okay! I don’t like that funky sounding name. What’s your name, your real name, sir?”
“Zapata,” he whispers into her eardrum.
She pulls back with a smile and sways inside his arms, smiling at his Hawk mask. “Come on now! We’re in here for a long night. Fifty minutes of stomping on my tender toes. I should get a real name, not that brotherly slur.”
“I don’t stomp on toes!” Zapata cocks his head wearing a pair of goofy red-tinted chicken lips at Tulu. “But I’ve noted very swiftly that you’re un-balanced,” he looks down at her dress hemline. “Are you wearing a pair of new shoes?”
Tulu stops her swaying motion and then lifts up her dress hemline showing her heels and yellow-painted toenails. “I think, too high,” she giggles. “I’m a little wobbly. I usually wear nothing.” He laughs. She smiles. “I meant to say, that I wear nothing on my naked feet. I like the feel of grass and earth. Do you like my dance shoes, Zapata?”
“You’re very beautiful, Tulu,” he leans over and then sweet breathes into her face.
She giggles. “Do you think my shoes are beautiful, Zapata?”
“You’re beautiful, Tulu. They’re beautiful, Tulu. You smell nice like a vine of honeysuckles. You have remembered our lovely pact,” he pulls her into his naked chest slowly swaying to the musical song.
She giggles from his tender touch and sways to the soft music. “I remember everything. Funny! I’m not nervous or concerned about losing my bite-nats face mask. How do you feel, Zapata?”

Hammer, in the year 1990, from his album entitled Please Hammer Don’t Hurt ‘Em. The musical tunes played Pop Rap and Pop sounds.

Zapata smiles and enjoys the moment of the thrilling dance competition saying with delight to Tulu. “I feel like a hopping bunny rabbit.”
“Me, too!” She pulls away from Zapata and then tosses both of her arms to the left and her shoes to the right, laughing at her funny dance moves. He joins her silly dance movements, swinging his limbs in the opposite direction, avoiding permanent injury to her body.
Hico continues to stand on the edge of the platform and tosses one arm in the air yelling out loud. “Stop the music!” The music ceases. Each bite-nats mask views Hico again. He points down on the dance floor at the exposed Apprentice, who is only covered in golden tinted bite-nats paint all over her body and wears a face of tears. He yells “Judges, what is your final decision here?” Each judge lifts up a tiny black tinted flag that represents an Apprentice dismissal from the dance competition.
Hico shakes his finger at the exposed female teen Apprentice without showing his facial expressions inside his Elephant face mask. “I am sorry, Apprentice. You have been eliminated from the dance competition tonight. Please, follow the set of door keepers out from the Dance Hall. You will be able to collect your personal luggage and then leave the building. Thanks for participating!” The audience member loudly sounds with a set of boos and hisses.
Beside the open archway, the two door keepers rush ahead towards the female dancer and then stops sounding with a sneer. One reaches out and grabs the arm on the female. The other door keeper reaches out and grabs the arm on the male dancer.
On top of the dance floor, the male dancer fights back with the door keeper growling in fury, shouting out loud. “Hey! Get your dirty hands off my arm, dude! I’m supposed to stay and play here tonight. Hey! I don’t wanna leave here. Let go of my arm! I’m paid to…”
The exposed sixteen-year-old female Apprentice feels disappointment slowly padding ahead towards the open archway without the door keeper. She could not hold her think object during the dance and then her human body became exposed with the splatters of golden-tinted bite-nats paint. She swiftly exits the dance floor with tears of sadness, going back to see her parents, who live in the Grand Rock Valley Colony.
The two door keepers work together and finally drag the rowdy male dancer from the dance floor and into an empty hallway as the male dancer continues to shout and fight. He is supposed to stay and play within the dance competition.
Inside the Dance Hall, on top of the stage platform, Hico continues to stand on the edge of the stage in silence and then smiles. “Well, that didn’t work!” He claps and announces. “So, everyone, back to dancing! Please start the music again!” The same musical song of rock and rock notes blasts throughout the air waves. Both the remaining and surviving dance couples swing and then shake a body to the fun music. Hico continues to stand at the edge of the stage and watch each dancer.




Three hours later…

11:40 p.m.
Basement setting
Cold temperatures with dull moonlight and no stars


Underneath an empty and quiet dance floor, without an individual hidden speaker for musical songs, within the Dance Hall, a small area of space contains a few pieces of used, ripped, and stinky sitting furniture, for decades ago, when the ancient city of Birmingham held a set of town events long before Nuclear War Three. The room’s odor fragrance consists of drifting pine cone scents, musty air molecules, and faint smells of sweet honeysuckle juice.
Two yellow-tinted, faded, ripped long sitting sofas, three oversized, red-tinted, ripped sitting chairs, a single wooden writing table, four broken but working table lamps, all items rest underneath a dirty beige-colored floor rug, on top of the basement floor, that also holds other secret things.
On the entrance wall made of solid damp concrete blocks, McCamy slams open the basement door and sounds with a loud huff stomping ahead in a pair of dirty faded blue jeans, a slightly dirty red-tinted, short-sleeved tee shirt, and his favorite polished, brown and orange-tinted cowboy boots. His three childhood buddies, Hixson, Rusk, and Baycliff, follow behind his back spine.
Hixson carries in his cupped hand and holds one of the tiny electronic mini-television screens playing a musical song for all eardrums. He dances swaying his arms and hips to all the musical tones while wearing a smile.
The musical song Let’s Hear It for the Boy was released on February 14, 1984 and recorded by musical solo artist Deniece Williams. The song was written by Tom Snow and Dean Pitchford and produced by George Duke.
