Baycliff wears a smile, a pair of dirty faded blue jeans, a slightly dirty yellow-tinted, short-sleeved tee shirt, and a pair of polished, green and blue tinted cowboy boots. He stops his dance steps then halts leaning down with a soft chuckle, reaching out and then playfully tickles her ribs.
She giggles out loud then slaps his hand away from her folded position slowly standing upright on both of her kneecaps on top of the dirty carpet, after hiding underneath an open air-conditioning metal vent and then crawls backwards from the long side wall. She scratches the white cobwebs from her newly cropped brown-tinted pixie hairstyle then slowly stands upright from the semi-dirty rug sounding with a lady grunt. She wears a pair of dirty faded blue jeans, a slightly dirty orange-colored, short-sleeved tee shirt, and a pair of unpolished, red and black cowgirl boots. She spins around and presents a stern face strolling ahead towards a wooden writing desk. The desk stands opposite from the entrance wall. She stops then leans over scribbling down all the top secret data information inside a paper notebook with her ink pen, dropping down the pen down on top of the paper. She stands upright then glances up to see the wall clock above the table, saying with puzzlement. “Why are ya’ll back from the dancing event, soonest?” She looks down at the table then swings around seeing a row of males sitting in a ratty furniture piece here inside the basement room.
The four males duplicate the physical appearance of Superintendent Kodare and all his male dancers from the North Ridge Mountain Colony, possessing a tall body frame, a head of cropped blonde-tinted hair strands, a pair of blue eyes and a tone of bronze-tinted skin.
She leans against the table folding both of her naked forearms, saying with a puzzled brow again. “What’s going on now? Ain’t there no dance competition practice for the male teens, after the grand event, tonight?”
“We’re perfect!” Rusk smiles and wears a pair of dirty faded blue jeans, a slightly dirty blue-colored, short-sleeved tee shirt, and a pair of polished orange and purple-tinted, leather cowboy boots, sitting on top of a non-stinky but patched yellow-tinted sofa then leans down grabbing a cold beverage from the small travel cooler, posed between him and the other sitting chair.
“I concur with my buddy Rusk.” Hixson grins and wears a pair of dirty faded blue jeans, a slightly dirty green-tinted, short-sleeved tee shirt, and a pair of polished brown and black-tinted, leather cowboy boots, leaning down and grabs a different cold beverage from the same travel cooler. He sits upright and snaps the tab open slurping down the cold liquid, sitting in the other chair beside Rusk.
“How can you tell them twins apart, Hixson?” Baycliff asks and sits inside a ripped and torn red-tinted oversized chair, turning with a puzzled brow to see Rusk then McCamy.
“That’s so easy! McCamy’s meaner,” Hixson turns and winks at McCamy then starts to laugh. McCamy reaches down and picks up pitching a handful of trash from the semi-dirty floor at Hixson. Hixson bats the items away from his effortlessly while chuckling along with Rusk and Baycliff.
“We’re pooped! That’s the bestest proper term here.” Baycliff states and reseats sipping then swallows the cold liquid, after standing then stealing a new beverage from the travel cooler. He burps out loud then grins.
“He-man can’t dance.” Rusk states then chuckles along with Hixson.
Baycliff sips the liquid then swallows turning to frown at Rusk, raising his timber. “Hey! I like to dance the two-step, not this Fango-Tango-Fluffy-Puffy stuff for the flock of flamingos at Hixson’s pond.”
“I killed those flamingos for eating my corn stalks.” Hixson states with a smile then sips swallowing the cold liquid, burping out loud and then grins to Baycliff.
Rusk nods then says to Hixson, “I dare say that we got the right man for the right job.” He turns and frowns at Baycliff, “Don’t eat all of Taffy’s food, Baycliff!” He reaches over and steals a couple of cracker packets from a single brown weaver picnic basket, provided by Taffy, resting on top of the low wooden table in front of the sofa, pitching one to Hixson.
Baycliff states then smiles, “We can get more. And I like to steal too.” Yellowish-brown abused food particles disgustingly stick in-between Baycliff’s white teeth as he presents for gross fun drama then laughs along with Hixson.
“Gross, man! Go upstairs and brush your teeth and comb your hair and take a bath as you sweat, like all of Hixson’s pigs.” Rusk states with a smile then eats chewing the crackers.
“I ate all of those hogs last winter at Holiday.” Hixson states then grins with his own yellowish-brown tinted abused food particles between his front teeth, also, laughing along with Baycliff and Rusk.
McCamy doesn’t laugh but continues to sit wearing a stern face, in his ratty oversized blue-tinted chair, staring at the familiar female and then demands with a serious tone. “What’s the latest buzz, Taffy?”
Taffy says without reviewing her notes, nodding with a stern face. “They have changed the game plan, again.”
“Something else, not new! I know, I get a new idea here. We kidnap Tulu and then go back home to South Beach.” Hixson states then chews the crackers turning and nods to McCamy.
“We stay!” Taffy turns and nods to Baycliff.
Baycliff winks then states to Taffy. “Yeah, we stay!”
McCamy shakes his newly cropped blonde-tinted curls on his bone skull saying with a stern face back to Taffy. “Look! We’ve stayed and scouted out here, within Metro City Birmingham, hiding out, inside this nasty basement space, for two whole days and nights, Taffy. We can’t find any type of sign or signs of a threat or threats to my girl Tulu.”
“Baycliff is your threat, hoss! He cozies up to Tulu, during each dance of night or night of dance or every dance.” Rusk turns and winks to Baycliff sipping then swallows his cold beverage, burping out loud then laughs along with Hixson.
Taffy gasps in shock and then shouts, “Baycliff!” She turns and views him.
Baycliff states with a nod, “Yeah! I got painted up as Hawk man this dance round too. Squawk! Squawk!” He burps out loud, after finishing the cold beverage.
McCamy turns and sneers at Baycliff stating with a deadly timber, “Yeah! And you looked a little too comfy, over there, holding my girl.” He continues to growl at his childhood friend Baycliff.
Baycliff pitches the empty metal beverage container down on top of the semi-dirty floor and states with a smile to McCamy. “Yeah! I followed your obtuse instructions, snot-hole. Hold her close!”
Rusk and Hixson swiftly stand upright from their seat and then face each other hugging their bodies very close, like a dance, while wildly chuckling. They start to sway sideways without the musical notes. Taffy laughs. Baycliff snorts. McCamy sneers at the two silly teens.
Baycliff watches the dancing pair and narrates with a smile, “Whisper in her ear. Lead like a gentleman. Act like a jackass.” Rusk pulls back then slams his palm into the smooth cheekbone on Hixson leaving a red imprint for both a visual and vocal illustration. Baycliff laughs as McCamy chuckles.
Hixson back steps from the fist impact then gasps in shock and gingerly touches his stinging cheekbone with a loud grunt, swiftly tackling a laughing Rusk. Both of them fall down and then land on top of the semi-dirty floor rug, trying to pound a fist into each other’s skull.
Baycliff leans back into the cushions sounding with loud laughter and enjoys the rough fight between Rusk and Hixson. He nods with a smile, “Yeah! Now, she even wants me to call her, Tulu, sweetheart.” McCamy swiftly stands upright and sounds with a deadly sneer warning, before killing Baycliff, stomping his boot toe towards the teen.
Taffy swiftly dashes ahead from the table then halts standing in front of a taller, muscular McCamy, blocking his vicious frontal attack on a sitting snot-hole Baycliff. She fingers McCamy back down into the ratty chair using her girly growl. McCamy re-seats and continues to growl and eye burns at a sitting smart-hole Baycliff.
Baycliff wiggles into the seat cushions then laughs winking with a smile to McCamy. “Yeah! You can become Hawk man, tomorrow night, during the dance competition, bro. I’ll be last in line, instead of first.”
McCamy exhales with worry for his girl and his friends turning and stares at Taffy, saying with a stern face. “I wanna be gone from here by tomorrow night. Taffy, there’s no direct threat to my girl Tulu. And she will never become picked for that single Apprenticeship post as she’ll be back home with me and us.”
Taffy slowly back pedals from the furniture pieces and McCamy then stops standing in the middle of the room, exhaling with worry for her sister. She states with a stern face, “The threat includes all the South Beachers, here, not just Tulu.”
McCamy frowns. “Someone, come here and tell her, please! So, we can all go home and end this charade. Our parents are deeply depressed and frantically worried sick about our two misplaced, non-burnt bodies, Taffy.”
Rusk and Hixson separate from the ground fight and then sit down in the same place wiping the nasty muck off their clothes, sounding with laughter of amusement.
Baycliff nods with a stern face to his childhood friends. “Fake deaths. Fake funeral. Fake Apprentices. I believe Taffy. Hico changes the Apprenticeship’s plans every day. You don’t change plans every day, unless you’re plain stupid or plain hiding something. Just because Tulu wasn’t touched tonight, doesn’t mean it won’t be tomorrow night. Yeah, there’s something strange going on here, McCamy. I wanna find it along with Taffy.”
“How long does the Apprenticeship Program last? I’ve been asking that same, solo question, since the beginning. And no person has an answer to that same, solo question. Or no one wants to answer that same, solo question. Or no one knows the answer to that same, solo question. Period!” Rusk turns and nods with a stern face to Baycliff. McCamy frowns in silence while Hixson eats a second pack of crackers with his dripping mouth drool.
Taffy exhales with worry then states to her friends. “That’s another clue, right there! Hico runs this show, creating his show, for a very specific reason. I wanna know what, why, where, when, and how. The Apprenticeship Program has been running for five years, every new year, in the cold month of January, since the year 2076. Where is the location of all the previous sixteen-year-old female teens now? What other Metro City campus employs them? If they are all employed by another Colony, within the newly established Colonies of the U.S.A., why don’t we have an Apprentice working with your father, Baycliff? He’s the sheriff and one of the leaders at the South Beach Colony. And my final question, when will this Apprenticeship Program stop? The answer is never, until we stop it.”
McCamy exhales with confusion and shakes his bone skull stating with a stern face. “Taffy, that’s all great and good! But it’ll take us days, weeks, and months to answer all of your posed intellectual social, civil and academic questions. I suggest here that you go and contact Hico, get an appointment, and pose all of your excellent unanswered questions to him. We have an open government or something like that.”
Baycliff nods with a stern face lifting the hand-held tiny machine, shaking the device near his jaw line. “I know why Tulu is here. And I don’t like it. And that’s why I’m here. But why are four South Beachers present here, McCamy? Kodare shanghaied those teen girls from their parents using this little device, a new mini-television set, getting them here inside Metro City Birmingham for the Apprenticeship Program. Hico can’t possibly provide enough employment work jobs for all of those teens. What’s up with that, McCamy?”
McCamy exhales with worry then states with a nod. “You heard Hico’s words also. The dance competition offers only one Apprentice spot. Both of you’ll are making a mountain out of a few mole holes. I got a new idea. We grab my girl Tulu and then get outta of here, going back home to South Beach.”
She shakes her short pixie curls with a stern face. “No! We stay!” She slaps her chest and nods with a smile. “I’m entering the dance competition.” Baycliff gasps in shock. McCamy shakes his skull, in silence. Rusk nods with a smile, in silence.
Hixson swallows the food then frowns at Taffy, “Uh! I’m not rocking the boat here, Captain. I think…”
“No!” Taffy stomps ahead then stops in front of the row of ratty furniture pieces, jabbing her unpolished fingernail at Hixson, saying with a sour frown. “I think here, cowboy! I’m the brains! I’m the smart one! I’m the strong one! I’m the Plan Mistress!” She slaps her dirty shirt and wears a sour tone. “I planned our fake deaths. I planned our escape from the fissure. I planned our entrance into the Apprenticeship Program. I planned everything! Now, I plan to enter the Apprenticeship Program,” she nods with a smirk, in silence, crossing her arms, staring at McCamy.
“We stay!” Rusk nods with a smile to Taffy. McCamy exhales with annoyance and worry in silence.
“Shore, Taffy!” Baycliff states the nods several times to Taffy.
Hixson states with a confused brow. “How are you going to enter a dance, without Tulu seeing you, Taffy?” He finishes the beverage and then burps out loud.
McCamy states with a confused brow. “The better question here! How are you going to dance, when the competition is filled with all of the invited dancers?”
Rusk winks and states to Taffy. “Awe! That’s so easy! You go and beat up an ugly one, hoss! Then your problem is solved. Now, I would suggest…”
“Naw!” Baycliff states and shakes his newly cropped blonde-colored hair roots wearing with a confused brow to Taffy. “I can’t beat a girl up for doing nothing to me. Now, if she decides to bust my pretty nose holes, then I’d pop her girly jaw, like Lyford did that time,” he turns with a smile to see his childhood friend Rusk. “Do you remember that big ugly kid, Rusk?”
“Well then, you can charm her wits!” Rusk laughs.
“That takes too long!” Baycliff states with a worried brow then exhales with frustration looking down at the dirty floor.
Taffy rolls her eyeballs then looks back, uncrossing her arms, swiftly advancing towards Baycliff and then stops. She leans down and reaches out grabbing each one of his smooth cheekbones, planting her wet kiss on top of his soft pink lips, holding on for three seconds. She releases his lips then stands upright slowly back stepping, breathing in heavy pants of oxygen. She states, “Go and do exactly that to one of the South Beach girls! Then you go and take her back home to South Beach while I take her place here tomorrow night.” Each male teen sounds with hardy laughter of amusement.
“Let’s go and pick you a pretty one, hoss!” Rusk laughs out loud and swiftly stands upright from the ratty chair.
“Not Tulu! No one never, ever touches my girl!” McCamy shouts out his warning and swiftly stands upright from his ratty chair turning to face the closed door, shaking his bone skull. He leads from the basement room into an empty cold concrete hallway back to the living quarter with childish bunk beds within the Bull Pen setting.
Now, the basement space is quiet without the loud music coming from Hixson’s mini-television device.
“Shore!” Baycliff continues to sit and wipes off his wet lips with the back of his hand smiling at Taffy. “Yeah! Shore there, Taffy!” He slowly stands upright from his ratty chair while still smiling and nodding to Taffy, scooting around her upright body. He sounds with a soft chuckle slowly moving ahead towards the open archway and wears a silly grin. An array of soft chuckles echo throughout the secret hallway as the sound slowly moves down towards the secret exit door.
“Boys!” She exhales with annoyance then spins around slamming the door shut.
June 5th Friday


Day Two
Dance Competition

Underground basement setting
05:49 p.m.
Cold temperatures, gray sky without bright stars


The closed door slams open.
McCamy enters first into the basement room and wears the infamous Hawk bite-nats mask over his natural face and a black-tinted, sleeveless, shirtless vest barely touching the top waistline on a pair of matching black-tinted tight dance pants The tight dance pants are tucked down into his pair of worn but polished black and brown tinted cowboy boots. He de-masks into the colors of black, brown, and yellow and stops in front of Taffy then lifts up a paper letter near his loud sneer.
Taffy quickly loses her Chick bite-nats face mask and presents the dry colors in bright yellow, dull black, and stark white paint on her stunned face while parting her lips. She displays a yellow-tinted, ankle-length, sleeveless ballgown and a pair of high heeled fashion sandals. She sounds with a gasp then looks down at the semi-dirty floor, then her open backpack and finally returns back to see McCamy. She reaches out for the paper letter and says with a lady sneer. “That’s my property!”
He pulls back the paper from her arm length and presents a low growl, “How interesting! Since it contains the name, Baycliff, on the first printed line, the letter comes from his beau Amita.”
Rusk, Hixson, and Baycliff appear and stop forming a line, standing in front of Taffy. Each South Beach teen stands at the same height and weight possessing a head of cropped blonde-tinted hair stands and a black-tinted vest with a pair of matching tight dance pants but an individual pair of polished colorful cowboy boots, not the sissy black leather dance shoes. Rusk presents a face of solid black dry bite-nats paint with bright yellow-tinted rings around both of his natural eye sockets, without wearing his Panther bite-nats face mask.
Hixson wears dull red bite-nats dried paint over his natural face with horizontal strikes of black, yellow and gray, without presenting his Hyena bite-nats face mask.
Baycliff displays slashes of dry bite-nats paint in the colors of dull yellow, dark black, and stark white, not wearing his Tiger bite-nats face mask.
Rusk stands beside his brother McCamy sounding with a gasp then reaches over, jerking the letter from McCamy’s hand while silently reading each word. He looks up with a loud sneer to see Taffy and then hands the paper letter to Hixson for a visual inspection also.
“It’s time for your personal confession here, Taffy! Why are we still staying and playing here? Why are we here, at all?” McCamy says with a snarl.
Baycliff moves ahead from the cowboy line then spins around standing beside Taffy, facing his three childhood friends. He exhales with a huff of worry then explains with his stern face. “I’m trying to find my girl Amita. She came here last year, during the Apprenticeship Program, to reside here, for her work job. However, she has moved or hasn’t been seen by any eyeballs, since the Apprenticeship Program.”
McCamy turns then growls at Baycliff then states. “You…you risked my girl Tulu to find a…a ghost!”
Taffy lifts both of her arms in the air and says with a lady snarl back to McCamy. “Look! Something else strange is happening here, McCamy, within Metro City Birmingham. Hico and the others, they benefit…”
“…been conducting these silly dance contests for the previous four years,” McCamy yells at her then tosses both of his arms in the air wearing a sour frown, dropping both of his arms and slaps his legs. “I can’t believe that I’ve been a pawn, a pasty, a pushover. I think...”
“Do not think, bro!” Hixson states and stares at both Taffy and Baycliff then exhales with his teenly feelings of anger, betrayal, and deceive, too.
McCamy points at Taffy and then slaps his chest saying with a stern face, “Taffy, we, that’s you and me! We are in big trouble here for a set of fake deaths plus a set of fake funerals, for a set of black words on a white sheet of paper!” He spins away from Taffy and lifts both of his arms, slamming his shifting body into his brother, sounding with a loud sneer then drops both of his arms slapping his legs. He swiftly advances ahead towards the open archway yelling to everyone, “We’re all going back home, right now. I wish you good luck in whatever you need to find here, Taffy. You’re lookout, Hixson! Rusk stands, waits, and watches for the movement of Tulu! Then, we grab my girl and we all escape out the backdoor tunnel and travel back to our home in South Beach.” He exits the room and stomps down the long hallway. Hixson drops the letter on the floor then spins around to face the open archway following behind McCamy too. McCamy does not heard the footsteps from two parties then shouts out loud, “Rusk!”
“That was a very dangerous and foolish game, Taffy!” Rusk shakes his bone skull then exhales with worry for Taffy, his brother, and his friends.
“Thanks for getting me this far, Rusk!” She nods with a stern face. Hixson and McCamy continue to advance down the long hallway.
“Rusk!” The voice of McCamy echoes inside the long hallway. McCamy needs Rusk’s help to extract Tulu from the rest of unsuspecting Apprentice girls, before the two lines of females march into the Dance Hall for the second night of competition.
Rusk slowly back pedals from both Taffy and Baycliff and presents a sour frown to Taffy then spins around exiting the basement room also, in silence.
Taffy spins around and stands in front of Baycliff reaching out and touches his collar bone. She nods with a worried brow. “We’ll find her together! They did what they could. Let them go back home to South Beach. She is here, Baycliff. I believe her words in her letter too.”
Baycliff leans over and hugs Taffy pulling back with a worried brow, saying into her face with a soft whisper. “Maybe, you should go ahead and leave here too, Taffy. Rusk’s right. This is a dangerous place for you here at Metro City Birmingham with the dictatorship of Dictator Hico.”
She gasps in shock and shakes her pixie hair curls. “No! My promise is for both her and you. Go back up into the Bull Pen arena, with the other dances, before you’re missed. I’m heading upstairs. I’m going to replace my sister Tulu, before they find an Apprentice missing, and then we’ll all be discovered.” He leans over and hugs Taffy against his naked chest, again, planting his wet kiss on her yellow-painted cheekbone.
Outside the dark hallway, Rusk stands then swiftly backs away from the door crack between the wooden frame and the door frame, wearing a stern face, spying on girlfriend Taffy and his childhood friend Baycliff. He exhales with worry for the both of them then spins around quickly dashing back down the cold, secret hallway.



Thirty minutes later…

Bull Pen setting
Superintendent Kodare
North Ridge Mountain Colony
06:22 p.m.


Inside the practice dance hall of dull pearl white tint, a line of male dancers stands upright and faces a row of rusty lockers on the entrance wall. The rear wall exhibits a single beaten up and rotten white tinted wood that leads into a practice dance floor. The entrance door is closed.
Superintendent Kodare appears like his line of male dancers but older. He possesses a head of cropped blonde-tinted hair strands, a pair of blue eyes, and a tone of bronze-tinted skin, compliments of the bite-nats paint. He holds a small canister of bite-nats paint and a tiny paint brush.
Kodare stands in front of the first male dancer and says with a smile. “Flip down your arm!” He leans over drawing a thin hollow outline, like a straight pen, and then thickens the middle with a heavy glob of pale blue-tinted bite-nats paint.
The first dancer wears a Tiger bite-nats face mask and looks down at the painted art work inside his inner forearm, rumbling with a sexy baritone timber. “What’s this thing?”
Kodare continues to stare down at his pale blue paint job sounding with short laughter then explains to the stupid teen. “It’s called a blade. Haven’t you ever seen a blade before, Zapata?”
The same dancer sneers first then says. “Yeah, I’ve seen a blade before,” he closes both of his eyelids then mentally performs the think object: blade. The pale blue paint glitters first then creates a single flash blade forming inside the meat on his lower arm, covering his palm upwards towards the crook of his elbow. The flash blade measures eight inches in length shining underneath the bright overhead lights. Tiger flips the solid blade in the air and then catches the weapon by the hilt pointing the sharp pointy tip at the bronze-colored nose bridge on Kodare, sounding with a sneer. He says with deadly timber, “My name’s Baycliff, not Zapata.”
An older mature Kodare wisely jerks backwards from the true tip on the blade then snarls into the Tiger mask on Baycliff, saying with a stern face. “You don’t frighten me, Zapata!” Loud sniggers echo within the room coming from each teen dancer. He stands upright then sneers at the line of younger and stronger teen males, shouting with an angry face. “All of you are called Zapata, which means, brother, for the obvious reason. All of you are mine! And all of you better remember that concept too!” He sidesteps then halts in front of a black-tinted Panther bite-nats mask, sniffing the sweet odor, exclaiming his distaste. “Your body smells!”
The male dancer in the Panther mask leans over and sneers into the face of Kodare replying back. “And you kiss your mama too!”
“Wash that odor off your body, right now!” Kodare demands.
Panther stands upright and presents a grin lifting up his muscular arm, sniffing one of his hairy arm pits. He drops his arm down to his side and then chuckles to Kodare exclaiming with delight. “I like it! My smell makes all the girls crazy.” Loud sniggers echo throughout the room.
Kodare slowly sidesteps to the next male without challenging another smart-hole male dancer hailing from the North Ridge Mountain Colony. Fifteen minutes ago, two different North Riders entered the Bull Pen setting then quit the dance competition but not before threatening to beat Kodare into a pile of dog poop, if they didn’t get their monies tonight for their dancing fee. Kodare quickly paid them their monies and then they left the Bull Pen furniture pieces intact and Kodare alone.
Within the same line, the fifth male dancer stares down with a frown at his painted arm expressing to Kodare. “It looks funny with one arm painted, Kodare. Someone might get suspicious.”
“My mark of greatness for the North Ridge Riders!” Kodare says then laughs alone.
The same dancer lifts his arm near his jaw line without creating the physical flash blade and explains to his superintendent. “It looks like a tattoo! But I guarantee you that one of Swamplanders will notice it. You need to give us two tattoos for the price of one, Kodare!” He laughs with his fellow North Riders.
Kodare stares down at the painted arm on the Rider and says with a smile, “Mm! That’s a great idea. Twice as nice! Twice the prize! You think big which means your rewards will be bigger.” He leans down with a chuckle then paints a second bite-nats pale blue outline inside the other muscular arm on the same dancer, slowly moving down the line and then doubles back with a second paint job. He back steps from his row of dancers standing against the entrance wall, saying with a smile. “This is the first night of our true competition. This is the first night of our true victory. This is the first night of the true rule, within the Apprenticeship Program.”
Tiger/Baycliff watches Kodare then leans over whispering into the eardrum on his childhood friend Rusk. “Taffy is right, Rusk. Hico has changed the rules again and it doesn’t sound nice.”
Panther mask represents Rusk, who whispers back to Tiger/Baycliff. “Stay sharp, bro!”
In front of the line of dancers, Kodare performs the think object: mask. His painted brown and yellow bite-nats face becomes a Monkey mask and as he stares at each bite-nats painted mask, consisting of Lion, Tiger, Panther, Tasmanian devil, and the other dead mammals that used to live on the planet, before three Nuclear Wars. He nods with a silly grin within his Monkey mask expressing to his dancers. “Yesterday, you were a lowly paid escort for a female Apprentice. Tonight, consider yourself part of this new deadly competition,” he points down to his own painted arm in pale blue glittering bite-nats paint. “This is your victory. This is your weapon,” he fingers his own Monkey mask then swiftly de-masks the object, laughing out loud then announces. “The first Apprentice that un-masks on the dance floor, you kill dead!” Loud hoots erupt.







Pig Pen setting
Superintendent Doboil
Swamp Island Colony
06:33 p.m.

Five years ago, the lovely reception room was painted in dull brown hue. Now, each wall has faded over the cold winter years into a dull yellow tint within a narrow, rectangular-shaped space holding a long row of rusty blue tinted personal lockers on the entrance wall. The rear wall exhibits a single beaten and rotten white wooden door leading into a practice dance floor for Doboil’s use only. The two side walls possess dull yellow paint, without a piece of art work or a glass window. And the entrance door is closed.
Doboil wears a sharp business suit in brown hue, a matching dress shirt, a pair of matching leather shoes, and a brightly colored orange tinted necktie. His hair roots are painted in orange hue. Yellow and black streaks slash sideways within his Fox bite-nats face mask. He slowly paces side to side cupping both of his wrist bones behind his back spine, saying with a smile down to the floor. “The prize is more important for you, your family, and your life. Remember that! Hico has slightly adjusted the rules, within the Apprenticeship Program. The last male or female dancer standing and holding his or her bite-nats mask intact will receive the grand prize. Period!” He stops then faces a line of his teen male dancers, consisting of his brave Swamplanders, who wear a bite-nats face mask, such like, Alligator, Snake, Coyote, Dinosaur, Scorpion, Lizard, and the other swamp or desert dead animals that used to live on the planet, before the destruction of three Nuclear Wars.
Doboil also understands the physical lack of height and weak state of strength, when each Swamplander is compared to a tough and taller Rider. However, each Swamplander possesses die-hard determination and personal Free Will. He says with a smirk. “Good luck, Swamplanders!” Each dancer is dressed in white-tinted, sleeveless, shirtless vest, exposing a pale-tinted naked chest, a pair of white-tinted dancer pants, and a matching pair of dancer shoes as each one loudly cheers with a victory sign, within Pig Pen.



Art Gallery setting
Superintendent Vovina
South Beach Colony
06:40 p.m.

Vovina stands in front of the room with numerous rows of chop block tables holding a pretty teenage female, compliments of bite-nats paint, of course. She wears a pink and gray tinted Mouse bite-nats face mask on her face surrounded by a set of dangling curls of red tinted hair strands, a crimson-colored, shoulder-less gown, a pair of matching silk elbow gloves, a ruby necklace and a matching ruby wrist bone bracelet. Her lips are painted in bright red hue.
She smiles at each decorated Apprentice. “Apprentices, each one of you look beautiful tonight. Each girl has performed excellently, and your parents are very proud too. I am proud also. There is no eliminator within our group of twenty girls. Of course, we have seen only two Apprentices and four male dancers gone from the Apprenticeship Program, after two nights. This is the first time and night that we have allowed both invited guests and family members to view the Apprenticeship Program along with the first-time live-feed visual scene on our new tiny device, shaped like an ancient mini-television set, during the ancient times.” She waves her hand and grins while encouraging her girls. “Do the best you can with your dance steps! You will not be graded on your accurate dance movements but maintaining your lovely creation of the combined bite-nats gown and face mask. I recalled during the dance practice last night that some of you were concentrating on other things instead of dancing,” she chuckles and then says with a sour frown. “Hold your thought! This is a gentle reminder. If you cannot maintain your painted bite-nats face mask during the dance competition, then you will not be standing upright at the end of the dance competition. I promise you that true statement. Thus, you will be eliminated permanently from the Apprenticeship Program. Does each one of you understand my instructions?”
Each painted bite-nats face mask nods in silence back to Vovina and is represented with a barnyard animal, such like, Kitten, Dog, Horse, Cow, Lamb, Chick, and the other mellow farm animals that are long dead from the series of three Nuclear Wars.


Power Room setting
Superintendent Starbe
Grand Rock Valley Colony
06:51 p.m.

The square-shaped room had once been painted in bright orange. After numerous harsh winters, the paint has faded down into the hot pink tone on three solid walls. One of the side walls holds an elevated platform stage with a ratty patched black tinted hanging curtain drape dangling down from the ceiling covering the rest of the wall paint.
The interior of the room displays numerous rows of wooden chop blocks, which is similar to the Art Galley setting, but this room is dubbed the Power Room.
The entrance wall displays a double-wide closed door between rows of individual mounted cleaning hoses to wash off the used and abused fun bite-nats paint.
The forward wall displays one single chop block, where Superintendent Starbe stands and stares at her Apprentices, saying with a stern face and a firm tone. “This night of competition is fierce, fiery, violent, swift, and deadly, if you do not maintain your bite-nats face mask. I will repeat that again. Hold your thought! Think object: mask.” She presses both of her nervous hands down her golden-tinted, sequined-covered, sleeveless slip dress and then reaches up touching her golden-colored throat necklace that compliments her tawny and white-tinted Giraffe bite-nats face mask. She moves a pair of brown lips explaining to her girls. “As you know, we represent two Colonies, like Vovina and her group of twenty Apprentices. So far, we have lost one Apprentice from the Grand Rock Valley Colony, leaving a total of nine teens. And we have sacrificed one girl from the Swamp Island Colony, leaving a total of nine girls. But do not fret here! We are strong with lot of eighteen beautiful and smarter Apprentices and we are stronger than the other twenty girls, within Vovina’s group.” The girls sound with a loud cheer.
Starbe shares. “Look around and memory each face mask, on your fellow Apprentice! That’s very important tonight. Also, tonight, the group of male dances will be dressed in two separate colors. The North Ridge male dancers will exhibit the black dancing attire. Your personal Swamplander escort will be colored in white that blends nicely into their pale glowing skin. Do not dance with any of the males in a black tinted vest! He and his female Apprentice have been labeled our deadly competition tonight. So now, you know your new foes! Are we really for the challenge ahead of us, Apprentices?” The row of face masks, such as, Kangaroo, Flamingo, Deer, Dove, Duck, Raccoon, and the other colorful faces perform an individual head nod and then sound with another loud cheer of victory.
Starbe smiles behind her Giraffe mask then expresses with delight. “Excellent! Please, lead me towards the Dance Hall! Hico is waiting for us!” The first girl in the rear row swings around and exits the Power Room leading her friends. Starbe follows last while softly chuckling with delight.


Dance Hall location
07:01 p.m.


The dance hall setting appears dark but loud. The live audience sits in the dark and inside rows of hard bleacher seats while making lots of noise.
“Bring out the dancers!” Hico shouts within his blood-red tinted Bull bite-nats face mask and stands on the edge of the stage platform within the darkness. He wears a blood-red tinted business suit, a white tinted dress shirt and a matching bowtie, and a pair of blood-red tinted leather shoes. His face mask displays two golden tinted horns on his forehead, a matching nose ring, and an individual golden-tinted round-shaped earring on each bull’s ear point.
The two door keepers stand beside each door frame and then reaches out slowly opening the beaten up and rotten two doors. The outside hallway light creeps first onto the dark dance floor.
A single spot light wildly dances across the black and white granite dance floor, without a dancer. A loud rock and roll musical song starts to blast throughout the air waves as the overhead lamps power to display an empty dance floor.
The musical song Eye of the Tiger was recorded by American musical band Survivor, in the month of June, in the year 1982. The members of the musical band included James “Jim” M. Peterik (backup vocals; keyboards and songwriter); Frank “Frankie” Michael Sullivan (guitar); Dave Bickler (lead vocal; keyboards); Marc Droubay (drummer) and Stephan Ellis (bass guitar). The musical song was created for the Hollywood movie film Rocky III featuring Hollywood superstar movie film actor Sylvester Stallone.

The live audience stands and sways to the music while wildly cheering with hand claps, lip whistles, and foot stomps for the group of teen dancers.
An individual line with twelve female Apprentices elegantly flow through each open archway.
Two lines with twelve male dancers depart from the rear wall and then strut down the side steps from the stage platform, slowly moving down onto the dance floor.
A line of females forms and faces the stage platform with Hico and the four Superintendents. An individual male scoots around and then selects the proper female based on last night’s secret information with her new bite-nats face mask. The two rows, each with a dancer, spins to face each other. The rock and roll musical tune stops.
The musical notes from playing trumpets toot and clanking cymbals ting together.
Each female gracefully curtseys and as each male respectfully bows. Then each dancer stands upright wearing a happy smile, waiting for the new song for the upcoming first dance.

Inside the dance hall, on top of the elevated stage platform, Hico continues to stand on the edge and screams out loud, “Stop!” The musical cadence stops. The live audience sounds with a low moan. He back steps from the edge of the stage then wiggles the two bull horns while sounding with a loud chuckle. He exhales with a big breath of sour odor then states with a smile. “I have decided.”
On top of the dance floor, Tiger/Baycliff leans over and wraps both his arms around the bare shoulders on Chick/Taffy while whispering into her eardrum. “Riders have painted a set of twin flash blades on each lower forearm.” Taffy stiffs with fear. He feels her tense and then whispers. “Hold your thought! Think object: mask.” Taffy quickly relaxes and then leans into his naked chest, exhaling with deep worry in silence.
On top of the stage, Hico grins. “The Apprenticeship Program should not be limited and then awarded to one lonely teen.” The live audience members cheer out loud hearing Hico’s words. He says. “The Apprenticeship Program should be earned by every teenager on the dance team, representing their entire Colony.” The audience members scream out loud hearing Hico’s words.
“The Apprenticeship Program should reward both all the winning teens and their personal home Colony,” He grins with an evil smile. The audience members holler louder. Hico announces, “Please, show us the new score board!” He points towards the top of the side wall with ripped and torn wallpaper of tiny lavender flowers.
The four confused Superintendents, two rows of puzzled dancers, and the eager audience members all view a large rectangular-shaped box. The box brightens through the torn and exposed wallpaper material. The electronic board displays four individual boxes labeled with the name of each Colony in bright red letters: South Beach, North Ridge, Swamp Island, and Grand Rock. The audience members cheer wildly.
Hico points down to the dance floor and says with a smile. “There are the four Colonies, present here tonight, consisting of South Beach, a colony of land farmers.” The audience members sounds with a set of loud boos.
He states with a disappointing frown. “Now! Now! Let us all be a good sportsmen and sportswomen here!” The audience members softly clap without the loud cheers.
He laughs then says with a smile. “The second colony is the North Ridge Mountain Colony.” The audience members wildly cheer and clap.
“The third colony is the Swamp Island Colony.” More cheers and claps come from the audience.
The final colony is the home of the Grand Rock Valley Colony.” The audience members start to wildly cheer, hand clap, lip whistle and foot stomp. Hico points back up to the electronic score board and shouts over the loud noise to the controller, who sits and monitors the box board behind the side wall. “Please, show us, the scores on the box board!” An individual green tinted light displays the numeric number “00” within each lighted box underneath the name of each Colony. He states with a smile. “Normally, one single winner receives one single prize.” The audience member start to sound with loud boos.
He says with a head nod. “However, my new rule encompasses many more than a single winner of the Apprenticeship Program, tonight, which will…must include all of their fellow teens and the entire Colony of friends, neighbors, and families. Do you agree with me?” The audience members start to sway and dance while wildly cheering. He motions his hand for quiet. The audience obliges. He sings with a grin, “Hmm! I believe we shall…must award prizes to both the winning the team of teens and their entire home Colony.” The audience members excessively sound with loud cheers, hand claps, lip whistles, and foot stomps.
He points to the opposite side wall away from the electronic score board shouting over the noise. “Please, show us, the grand prize for each winning team of teens and their winning home Colony, on the other side wall.”
On the opposite side wall, the ripped and torn wallpaper burns sideways and then reveals a new hole. Inside the new hole, a newly built-in wooden shelf slowly steers ahead and then stops underneath a row of bright lights. On top of the wooden shelf, rows of individual bite-nats clear container tubes both shine and sparkle with an individual color of red, orange, green, blue, purple, yellow, silver and gold.
“Bite-nats! Bite-nats! Bite-nats! Bite-nats!” All audience members chant in unison while flinging individual body parts to the left and then to the right and into their neighbor’s face and space, seeing the new fancy product that cannot be purchased at the local grocery store or in the dirt soil.
Hico performs several head nods wiggling the bull horns sounding with wild laughter, hearing and seeing at the wild audience members. He explains, “Bite-nats is the grand prize for the winner team of teens and their home Colony at the dance contest tonight,” he swings back to see the other side of the dance hall pointing at the score board. “Please, show the starting math number underneath each Colony name, on the score board please!” Each box displays a blue tinted number 1000 inside each box. He states with a smirk, “You see the maximum points of 1000 have been established for each Colony, marking the deadly competition.” The audience members wildly clap and cheer.
He lifts both of his palms near his jaw line without hitting the two sharp tips on the bull horns stating with a frown, “Wait! I have made a small error.” The audience member perform gasp in unison.
He drops both of his palms and then hits his legs explaining the new situation, “So far, each Colony contains an un-even number of teens.” The audience members perform a set of loud boos.
He shares, “But I have a solution!” The audience members sound with a combination of both boos and cheers.
He continues, “We can combine our forces.” The audience members continue to sound with a combination of both boos and cheers.
He tells, “How about we combine the Swamp Island Colony, which I shall label, as a team of Swamplanders, with the Grand Rock Valley Colony, which I shall label, as a team of Rockers?” The audience cheers.
He chuckles. “I do believe that is an excellent idea too. That would leave the South Beach Colony, which I shall label, as a team of Beachers, who will be paired with the North Ridge Mountain Colony, where I shall call, a team of Riders.” The audience member erupt into a combination of both boos and cheers.
He laughs with a single head nod then comments, “Well, we are, sorta, in agreement here. So, we have reached a new and fun dance solution. Please, adjust the electronic score board with my new decisions.” Hico views the side wall.
The score board blinks in black tint then illuminates displaying two individual boxes. The first box exhibits the name: Swamplanders/Rockers. The second box shows the name: Beachers/Riders. Each box contains a green tinted number: 2000.
He smiles at the new display. “Now, we see that each paired Colony exhibits 2000 points. That’s more than enough to win the grand prize of bite-nats. Don’t you think so too?” Hico views the audience. The audience members wildly perform loud screams and hand claps. 
He shares, “Now, I have a new rule here. The winner with the highest score wins. But that doesn’t make any sense to me.” The audience members perform laughter and nods their bone skulls.
He sings then smiles, “Hmm! If a competitor loses their bite-nats face mask, then the score board will deducts 20 points, which is 10 points for the Apprentice and 10 points for her dance partner, thus reducing the negative numbers from the total positive score of 2000. Therefore, the combined Colony with the most mathematical points displayed on the score board will win everything.” The audience members start to wildly hand clap and vocally cheer again.
He continues. “And the paired winning team of teens and the entire two Colonies with families, friends, and neighbors will receive a batch of new bite-nats also. I promise.” The audience members sound with an array of hand claps, wild cheers, lip whistles, and foot stomps. The shelf with rows of individual bite-nats tubes glitter on the side wall. Hico tosses both of his arms away from the two sharp bull horns yelling out loud. “Start the music!”
The classical musical waltz is entitled Blue Danube Waltz. A set of violins bow nicely lead into a dance waltz. The classical piece of musical notes were composed and written by musician Johann Strauss, in the year 1866..

The musical song Beat It was recorded by American musical superstar artist and songwriter Michael Jackson, on February 14, 1983. The song was pulled from his sixth studio record album entitled Thriller released in the year 1982. The song was produced by Michael Jackson and Quincey Jones. His musical genre included Hard Rock and Dance Rock sounds.
The musical song is played in the musical key of E flat Minor at a fast tempo of 138 beats-per-minute.
The musical video and musical theme was inspired by his older brother Jermaine Jackson, when his family members experienced, in front of the living room window, three bad rumbles (fights) between two rival gang members, in the city of Gary, within the U.S. State of Indiana.
On the popular musical song, the fluttering squealing backbeat from the solo guitarist was played by Eddie Van Halen. He is the lead guitarist from the American Hard Rock musical band Van Halen.

Are there any more brilliant ideas for a set of deadly weapons? Can we use anything else inside this room?” Each team member turns and scans the room looking for more insects or new weapon ideas.
Rusk reaches down and collects all of the paint cans from the wood surface storing them inside his oval backpack on his wide chest, saying with a smile. “I have a great idea for a weapon. Grab some of the paint cans and stow inside your personal backpack. If you get sprayed with any type of wet liquid consisting of water or even a type of favored or flavored beverage, remember the paint washes off immediately exposing your unprotected naked skin. Then you will revert back to a human and you are un-protected to a vicious Rider. You can splat a quick color dot of paint from the captured paint can and then think object: armor to save your hind.”
“That’s a great life-saving tip, Bandit!” Taffy states with a smile then exhales with worry presenting a stern face.
Wolf stands in place and then touches his temple saying with a stern face. “Think object: food.” The other teens laugh.
“If you can oblige my hungry belly, fearless leader?” Bat states with a nod then laughs again with the other teens.
“Leader twirls. Leader dances. Leader looks. Leader…” Taffy shouts then spins around with a smile disappearing behind the dangling curtain. She had seen the stacked items in the wall corner. Hico or his nasty dance guards had rummaged through each backpack belonging to Rusk, McCamy, Hixson, Baycliff, and Taffy, which in turn, had nicely pinpointed their clever teenly disguise, within the Sniff the Sweet Honeysuckles Dance event. Each backpack had been emptied and then searched for a new weapon but only discovered a set of food items. The ratty backpack had been tossed down on the floor in the opposite wall corner.
Taffy slides down over the hard wood grabbing one of the backpacks, collecting all the food and beverages items for her teammates. She stands upright from the wooden stage and dashes around the dangling curtain, moving ahead with a smile, reaching down and holds a packet of crackers near her jaw line. She slowly advances ahead and tosses the individual packets of crackers in the air to selected teammates, for fun.
“Leader disappears. Leader emerges. Leader attacks.” Wolf stands by his chop block table and re-paints his body looking up to see Taffy. He lifts both of his arms in the air and catches the two packets of crackers in each palm sitting down on the floor, ripping off the protective wrapping and crams them into an open mouth. He chews with a sweet moan.
Taffy doles out all the discovered food items to each team member spinning around, returning back and sits on top of the short elevated stage with Rusk. She drops the backpack of food for tomorrow’s breakfast and then grabs a pack of crackers, opening the wrapping. She gobbles down the stale crackers experiencing exhaustion, hunger, and worry, exhaling with a deep sigh. She softy asks with a worried tone, “Do you think Baycliff is okay, Rusk? He’s okay, isn’t that right, Rusk? Rough and tough snot-hole McCamy, he’ll be mad if his only friend Baycliff in the entire world gets hurt.
Rusk laughs out loud before eating another cracker shaking his bone skull. “You can’t harm Baycliff. No one can harm Baycliff. He gets his height, strong, ego, attitude, and meanness from his daddy. His daddy is the sheriff of South Beach for that very reason. No one messes with that Son of a Gun. Period! That Son of the Gun has the biggest farm, the biggest gun, and the biggest mouth his…naw…this side of the dried up Mississippi River stream.” He chuckles with amusement then eats the cracker.
“Yeah,” she states then laughs with delight at the tough manly personality on Baycliff. She informs. “McCamy and Baycliff are the same and act like a set of twin brothers, but not,” she exhales with a puff of worry then asks. “Where did you find your tender caring feelings, as the younger brother of smart-hold McCamy, Rusk?”
Rusk swallows the lump of wet dough then looks up to see the ceiling, saying. “And let us praise the Good Lord for Tulu!” He looks down and views Taffy, saying with a grin. “Tulu, she gives McCamy one tender caring feeling. Else he’d be no different from the solid limestone emotionless cliffs, where we still play as teens,” he looks down at the floor and then returns back to see Taffy, saying with a smile. “You did the right thing faking the successful ploy, coming here to Metro City Birmingham. You did some good here, Taffy, the Plan Mistress. We all will survive this, including a snot-hole Baycliff. I predict me and you might have to rescue his fanny a couple of times, before this thing ends, tomorrow night. Are you up for a manly battle with me and then a girly rescue of Baycliff, Bandit Leader?” She leans over with a grin then tickles his rib cage, for fun, sounding with soft laugh then sits upright eating another cracker.
Rusk catches her arm then wraps his arm around her body whispering into her eardrum. “McCamy and Hixson ain’t sitting still on top of the living room sofa at South Beach while we wait here in Metro City Birmingham. They’ll come soonest. They’ll bring back my daddy and my daddy’s shotgun and your daddy and your daddy’s shotgun. I can tell you that…”
She chokes on the food item coughing out loud, guarding her worried secret.
He drops the cracker packet down on the floor and then leans over slapping her back spine, clearing her esophagus of the wet uneaten food. Taffy mouth spits a wet lump of food down on top of the floor, wiping her gathered tears from each eye socket. He tenderly asks with worry. “Taffy, are you okay, honey bun? You need to remember to chew the food item with each tooth molar and then swallow only all the chewed food,” he chuckles with amusement gently rubbing her back spine.
She coughs again and clears out the last particles of unchewed food from her esophagus, saying with a light croak. “Right!” She says in her natural timber, “Chew the food and then swallow! I just forgot,” Taffy continues to wipe off her gathered tears from each eye socket while worrying about her family and friends.
Rusk leans over with a smile whispering into her cheekbone, “When this mess is all done. And we get back home to my farm. Taffy, I want like us to…”
“...go to bed, right now, love birds!” Wolf states appearing before Taffy and Rusk, reaching down and slaps his red tinted spiked bite-nats glove on top of Rusk’s collar bone, saying with a smile. “Get some rest!” He stands upright and lectures to the young couple nodding with a stern face. “I don’t know the time of day or night our new fight dance or dance fight or death dance competition will start. Hico has too many deadly surprises in store for us, tomorrow,” he body spins away from Taffy and Rusk and moves ahead tossing both of his red tinted bite-nats painted arms in the air, saying with a grin. He explains and demonstrations at the same time to all the teens, “Drop down a couple of chop blocks. Paint up a set of pretty pillows, soft blankets, and bed covers for your tired body. Close your two eyelids. Touch the wet paint. Then dream of satiny sheets, you’ll sleep like a crib of drooling babies tonight,” he laughs and stops gently preparing six individual chop blocks to form a king-sized bed mattress, touching the wet bite-nats paint. His bed mattress displays a gold-tinted thick bedcover with rows of tiny white-tinted diamond shapes and numerous individual pillows. His body slides down on top of the golden matching bed linens still wearing the body armor for his sleeping ritual. Above his red tinted painted bone skull, the bed frame is golden tinted bite-nats paint too with four individual columns surrounding and guarding his person. The other teens stare then chuckle with delight admiring the kingly bedroom set for the sleepy King Wolf. Then they start to create their own simply or elaborate bedroom setting for the nightly ritual of sleep without nightmares.


Dance Hall location
Stage Platform setting
10:58 p.m.

Hico, Vovina, and Kodare, along with some of the dance guards, have all returned back into the semi-clean dance hall, stepping over the numerous rows of lighted candles that fumigate the smelly odor of death, within the enclosed room. The death bodies and body parts of teens have been removed and are finally boxed up sending back to their immediate family kinfolks. The cleaning crew is still working on the floor tiles, the wallpaper, and the ceiling tiles while either removing the blood stains, painting over the blood strains or deciding to leave the blood stains. No new musical notes plays in the background for the workers or the employees.
The two surviving superintendents and Hico have arrived here to discuss the future plans for the next upcoming dance fight competition standing on top of the stage platform, viewing each other. Vovina walks on the lip of the stage. Kodare sits in his own chair beside Hico.
“Kiss my bite-nats! That cowgirl picked a Rider male over her own South Beach cowboy. Yeehaw! This Apprenticeship Program has proven to be a wave of great entertainment this year rather than the usual dull Kodarian Social Event.” Vovina states with laughter, spins around, and smiles at Kodare. She has washed off her old bite-nats paint and has applied a new coat in pretty rainbow colors. Her skin glows in pink hue; her makeup shines in pinks and purples and her long hair strands are colored in strawberry blonde. She models a short dress in lavender featuring short sleeves, a round neckline, and a ruffled skirt and dances on a pair of high heeled lavender fashion sandals. Her toenails are painted in bright red; her fingernails in dark green hue.
Kodare has washed off his beautiful bite-nats paint also and does not wear a new coat covering his 51 year old manly body, displaying his naturally wrinkled, ghostly pale-skin tone, a head of cropped dark brown hair strands, and a pair of tired blue eyes. He dresses in a pair of faded blue jeans, a long-sleeved flannel shirt in red, yellow, and green checks, a red tinted hoodie jacket, and a pair of unpolished brown cowboy boots covering his cold shivering body from the cool air temperatures in the winter month of January. The bite-nates paint helps to control both the hot and the cold weather elements on a human body too. He continues to sit and performs a low hiss then states to Vovina, “I ain’t dull, doll! Come over to my…”
“My word!” She states then smiles. “Why did you make that cowboy, the leader of the Rider team, Hico? The Riders are going to kill that cute teen. Then the dance competition will become dull and boring again. The same old show boat doesn’t sail up the dried up Mississippi River, like in the four past years. I remind firmly that I can use that cute male, since I require healthy male teens with a strong back and lots of good muscle tone for my personal assignments.”
Hico sits in the middle of the ancient and rotten row of wooden chairs, after washing off his bite-nats paint decoration also. He does not display new coat of paint either presenting an older face plus his out of shape body frame wearing a pair of wool trousers in red hue, a brown tinted sports coat, a red tinted wool sweater, and a pair of unpolished black tinted work boots. He does not start at Vovina but watches the workers saying with a smile. “The new set of dancers is a group of smart and resourceful teens. They will not make a good worker for you, Vovina, only a good rebel for a vicious fight. I have a better plan here. I did my homework assignments, Teacher. The seventeen-year-old female, who is named Taffy, she is a true criminal fugitive now, who has turned into a cold-blooded murderess. Eye witnesses saw her kill that poor helpless Apprentice Una with her bare hands in a cold-blooded act with her teenly anger and girly rage. Then she arrived there at the South Beach Colony and then killed her own loving parents for her greed and her possession of the tubes of bite-nats. Poor thing! We must surrender and present her live body to the South Beach law enforcement authorities that will make us become the ‘Heroes of Metro City Birmingham.’”
“South Beachers disrespect and hate us, Hico.” Kodare states then laughs at the silly idea coming from Hico, turning to stare at the nose profile on Hico. “You can’t set one bare naked foot there on top of the cool limestone cliff, without a personal body guard, along with his loaded shotgun, now. What makes you think you can drag their Colonist trash into their own Colony, without severe ramifications on you, me and us, Hico?”
Hico continues. “I have already coffined-up each dead body that represents a former dead Rocker, Swamplander, Beacher, and Rider down inside numerous rusty transports which are ready for our personal land journey to the South Beach Colony. We parade and party down in South Beach, mourn their dead, bury the smelly things, and then hand off the evil murderess, where we kindly ask for all the bite-nats rights. Or else! Something bad will come instead! Everyone wants their daily supply of bite-nats now, after seeing the miracle product work on the new mini-television screens, during the vicious fight dance tonight.”
“Are you plotting to start World War Four? All the nuclear devices have went somewhere buried down in the sea water or shot up towards the abandoned moon base. The South Beach farmers aren’t dumb or weak, Hico. They work outside in the blistering heat creating an adult, as well as, a young child both tough and strong.” Kodare states then frowns at Hico. “They will not surrender easily and do not negotiate without a shotgun either. They don’t understand the value of bite-nats which holds the wealth of a hidden treasure chest underneath their pair of red-tinted sandy cowboy booted feet.”
Hico nods. “We start the dance battle, early tomorrow morning, at nine o’clock. The surviving teens attack each other. Then we move the rest of the bloody action outside into the ‘Concrete Jungle’ setting, which is really the nasty laser-blasted landscape, that once was called the ancient city of Huntsville. When those nosy teens are busy eating tart berries and stabbing each weak teen with a home-made bite-nats flash blade, we start our personal trek towards South Beach cliffs and waters while watching the deadly action on the television device along with the rest of the world,” he reaches down into the hidden pouch on his chair lifting up then wiggles a tiny device near his jaw line, saying a smile. “I wish for a bigger television devise that would have worked better for my evil plans. A crying shame, you can’t see all the splattered bright red-tinted blood proteins on this tiny screen monitor. But, next year, we can start building bigger television sets and then distribute to all our Colonies, before the Sixth Annual Apprenticeship Program.”
“What Concrete Jungle are you referencing here, Hico?” Kodare turns and stares at the broken side wall. The electronic score board was mounted on the wall during the vicious dance competition, until the box was injured from a shotgun blast by the stupid dance judge. The shotgun blast destroyed the score board, the wallpaper, and the plaster creating a terrible mess down of broken tiles, glass fragments, exposed wooden staves, and dangling iron nails going down to the floor tiles. A large hole stands and exposes a tiny bit of outdoor forest. Behind the broken wall, a hidden jungle of grove shade trees, low-lying rows of plants containing only bugs and berries. He says with a sour tone, “No one lives out there.”
Vovina mentally performs the think object: gown. She stands on the edge of the stage then drags her new lavender-tinted, off-the shoulder, ankle-length ballgown over the rough wood talking out loud about the future dance competitions to Hico. “We make this new event live on a semi-annual basis. No! We display it on a quarterly schedule, like every three months. No! We plan it on a monthly basis. Yes, that’s a great idea. Our new monthly dance competition will include more than girls, who are sixteen years old. We include the age range from thirteen to nineteen years old, who are still teens, in the dance competition, and then offer each survivor a range of abundant rewards including one or two bite-nats paint canisters and a larger television device for each age group. Then, we offer a free house, free healthcare, and a great job to each winner and their family member here in Metro City Birmingham. We will triple or quadruple our population figures and finally establish our great kingdom with you as the new royal King and me as the new royal Queen of the new royal Metro City Birmingham,” she slaps her chest and turns with a smile to see Hico asking with a sweet timber. “What do you think, Hico?”
“You’re evil, my little sugar plum.” Hico states to Vovina then turns staring at the rear hairy bone skull on Kodare, saying with a stern face. “We have buried our dead in red clay and then covered them up with fields of green honeysuckle vines and finally closed the apex of our forgotten city, within the American History books. Everyone wants to forget the three Nuke Wars blinking their eyelids shut and then shutting down the gray matter, with the bad news, the defeat of the great United States of America.”
Kodare exhales with confusion and studies the broken wall announcing with a stern face. “There’s nothing out there but broken fragments of bricked buildings, overgrown patches of colorful wildflowers, batches of vine fruit, including strawberries, blue berries, fallen apples, and some grounded tree limbs, dozens of hiding spots for snakes, squirrels, and rabbits. Not much of a fighting environment for a dance fight battle, Hico!”
“We call our new event, the Survivor Games. No!” She states then spins around still walking on the lip of the stage platform, wearing a smile. “We call our new event, the Warrior Games. No, that’s not good either. How about the Hunter Games for the males and the Huntress Games for the females? Yes, I like that name much better. We should call our new monthly event, the Hunter and Huntress Games. Do you like that name, Hico?” She turns and smiles at his nose profile.
Hico smiles and says at the rear bone skull on Kodare. “You’re evil, my little sugar plum! We shall see what happens next, Kodare. I believe the Bandits will win the fight, barely alive. Brazoria is a vicious fighter along with all those talented South Beachers.”
Kodare returns and nodding with a stern face to Hico, “I expect at least three teens as three winners. Else the audience members are not going to become happy with the new entertainment event. Have you seen the numbers lately? We’re up forty percent, running at six million viewers, after you brilliantly combined the three existing Colonies against the powerful South Beach Bandits. That was a brilliant move, Hico! Adding this television device was my great idea. I’m a real genius here, too,” he frowns. “If there is only one winner, then you can negotiate some better legal terms, using that murderess Taffy against the other South Beach farmers. I suggest that we wait for all the winners, after the dance battle here in Metro City Birmingham. Then all the live winners and the dead bodies, which is better television drama, can transport with us to the South Beach Colony. Because in your new scenario, we are half-way to South Beach, before the dance battle ends here in the city.”
On the edge of the stage, Vovina reaches down and sprays a mist of bite-nats paint from a small spray can over her upright body transforming into a pretend queen figure, wearing a black ball gown, a matching tiara, and a pair of red colored lips. She leans down and sprays more paint on top of the floor touching each rock with a bloody finger that leaves her personal DNA specimen.
Each tan-colored rock turns into a tiny pink-colored pig that stands on top of a heated grill underneath a blue and yellow colored fire pit.
Vovina stands upright from the stage and says with a smile. “I’m the queen. The dancers are dressed as a litter of tiny pigs that slowly roasts underneath my blazing fire. Toasty!” She twirls around in a complete circle wearing her long ball gown.
Inside the chair, Hico says with a grin to Kodare. “You’re evil, my little sugar plum! You don’t think the true winners will not chase after us. I plan to leave one working transport. I don’t want my guests of honors to be too late for my party celebration.”
“You dare to kill all the winners and all the crop farmers for all their bite-nats paint cans. That’s a bold move even for Doboil. He would not have approved, Hico.” Kodare states then laughs out loud turning to stare at the broken wall that hides the outside landscape. The dead body parts of Doboil and his wife Starbe have been tossed down inside a shallow red clay dirt hole and then covered with vines of sweet honeysuckles, a common Metro City funeral.
On top of the lip of the stage platform, Vovina sprays a new mist of bite-nats paint over her body and then mentally performs the think object: gown, tiara, and cape. She transforms and wears a red tiara, a matching floor-length ball gown, and a matching cape. She leans down and dusts the dull wooden stage floor in colors of white, pink, gray, yellow and silver paint as the floor turns into a silver pot showing numerous exposed pairs of furry white bunny ears and a pink wiggling nose. The poor bunnies cook in the pot underneath a purple and yellow colored fire pit. She laughs, “Dress the dancers as white bunnies. Then we simmer them all for my rabbit stew. Delicious!” She swirls around in a circle sounding with her evil laughter, facing all the white bunnies that burn inside each fiery pot.
“You’re evil, my little sugar plum!” Hico says to Vovina and returns back to view the workers down on the dance floor. “Doboil isn’t here to object either. I want all of the bite-nats without force and with a teen. That’s my first option. So, both mama and daddy will relent immediately without their teen and with all of my demands.”
She leans down and sprays a mist of new bite-nats transforming her body, presenting a pair of silver glittery wings, a silver wand, a pink sequined tight fitting dress, and a pink tiara. She paints bite-nats in blue, yellow, orange, brown, and gold on the rock as each stone turns into an orange and brown baking pumpkin pie inside the golden oven on top of a yellow-tinted fire. Vovina stands upright then laughs out loud saying with a smile. “Pluck out each dancer and make it a pumpkin! Then we bake all the dancers in a pie. Yummy!” She spins around in a completed circle sounding with her evil laughter.
“You’re evil, my little sugar plum!” Hico compliments and grins at Vovina.
Kodare returns back and stares, saying with his worried brow to Hico. “Aren’t you afraid that the populace will object to more violence? We just completed five years of peace. Nobody wants another war or battle or encounter that involves their blood and guts and kids, Hico.”
He smiles then states, “No one wants boredom either. Since the surrender of peace and harmony, everything is boring. Everyone is boring. Every place is boring, especially here, within Metro City Birmingham. I have great plans for my town of ancient Birmingham. I want my town to become the newest Entertainment Spot by using these miniature television screens and the numerous cans of bite-nats. The populace demands its entertainment. The populace demands fun. The populace demands its bite-nats. The populace must learn where all the bite-nats cans are safely hidden and who hides them. Then I promise you that there will not be a war or a battle or an encounter, only a peaceful surrender.”
“That works for me!” Kodare nods with a grin.
She turns with a smile and views Hico. “Next month, Hico, I want my new Huntress and Hunter Game with numerous day parties that includes food, beverages, and a row of trained professional dancers as the professional entertainment troops. Then we have a room of amateurs that dance in a formal gown and jacket that wears a mask of bite-nats paint for more rewards of bite-nats canisters. Then the party goes on and on and on…”
Kodare turns and laughs first then asks to Vovina. “Then who or what or when is the final death dance, in the continuous party event, Vovina?”
Vovina slaps her new princess dress and says with a sour frown. “You’re no fun, Kodare!”
“You’re fun, my little sugar plum!” Hico states then winks to Vovina.
June 6th Saturday


Day Three
Dance Competition

Art Gallery location
Cool temperatures with night sky and twinkling stars
05:28 a.m.


Taffy slaps her bite-nats chest armor in forest green patient testing the safety as Rusk laughs at her silly motion. She back steps from Rusk and then spins around viewing her team of Bandits, standing beside Rusk on top of the short elevated stage. She exhales with a nod and states with a stern tone, “All right! We are ready. We possess body armor, flash blades, and home-made cock-rocks all over our naked human bodies, my young warrior teens. We buddy up together to protect each other and move like a team and shake down each enemy eliminating one-at-a time, winning the dance competition today.” Each teen nods in silence back to Taffy.
Taffy and Rusk move off the stage and scoot around each team member providing a handshake or a hug offering words of personal encouragement for the upcoming fight dance competition.
Each team member awoke early at seven o’clock eating the rest of the stale food items, practicing a set of fighting skills, and then re-painting back on the bite-nats liquid over a teenly body.
Vovina appears and stands inside the open archway wearing a patient face of red, purple and orange foundation makeup, a long red-tinted ponytail, and a tone of bronze-tinted skin. She dresses in a yellow-tinted, tight-fitting, long-sleeved ballgown, a pair of matching fashion heels, a yellow-tinted tiara, and a matching necklace. She examines each teen then motions down the hallway barking out her new orders. “O! You’re up and dressed! I’m impressed, ya’ll! Normally, a teen is lazy and sleeps until noon and then gets a plate of food and enjoys the rest of the day by wasting their time with friends or video games. But not this group of motivated teens! All right! And all are ready here! Come this way and follow me, my little sugar plums! We’re beginning the dance competition, right here and right now, my adventurous and brave and bold South Beach Bandits,” she back steps from the archway and then spins around wearing an evil smile slowly leading the teens down the ugly gray tinted hallway, shouting out loud, “One. Two. Three. March. One. Two. Three. March. One. Two…”

At 05:45 a.m., inside the empty hallway, the new musical song starts to play.
The musical song named Treat My Right was released in August 1980, from the studio album entitled Crimes of Passion and performed by Pat Benatar, who was a singer, songwriter, vocalist, and played the acoustic guitar. Her maiden name was Patricia Mae Andrzejewski and married at the age of 19 years old to her high school sweetheart, in the year 1972. The musician played Rock, Hard Rock, and Pop musical sounds.
The musical songwriter was Doug Lubahn.
Pat Benatar always toured with her own musical band. The band members included Neil Giraldo (lead guitar & her second husband); Myron Grombacher (drums); Charlie Giordano (keyboards) and Roger Capps (bass guitar).
