Taffy pulls Jellico towards the open archway first starting the Bandit line. Jellico exits the room following behind Vovina. Atoka follows behind Jellico. Rusk grabs Taffy and pushes her ahead of him. Bat follows behind Rusk. Wolf covers the rear end spinning around, sometimes, guarding the Bandit line with his secret stash of creative and deadly bite-nats weapons watching for a rear attack from either a nasty Rider or a nastier dance guard.
The Bandit team members form a straight column of bodies and slowly strut ahead without words but performing a set of low animal grunts of teenly worry.
In the far distance, on the same hallway, from the opposite end, her heart sinks down into the new, red-tinted, bite-nats, hiking boots. Taffy sees Etta, who leads a column with North Ridge Mountain Riders. She leans sideways and sees Baycliff. He is alive and marches in the rear of the column. She stands upright and presents a sweet smile of relief. Taffy knew that Baycliff would be victorious and vicious as a true snot-hole redneck of South Beach.
The three entrance doors leading into the Dance Hall are blocked and disguised with a tall and wide horizontal dark blue tinted dangling drape curtain in ratty shape with patchwork covering the moth-eaten holes. The curtain hangs before the hidden archway not revealing the interior walls within the Dance Hall for some strange reason.
There are three separate tall and wide door archways and as each one wears this strange dangling drape curtain covering the entranceway and making the appearance of the cold-feeling, black-tinted metal hallway become darker, scarier, and spookier, like a she-ghost is going to pop out from the swaying fabric scaring your butthole shitless.
Vovina stops then stands beside the first dangling curtain without moving through the harmless fabric into the room, saying with a wide smile and a sweet timber to each Bandit. “You will enter one at a time.”
“No!” Taffy shouts and scoots around her team members, moves ahead, then stops, sneering first then repeats with her stern face to Vovina. “No! We enter as a unit. Or we don’t play your stupid reindeer games, Vovina.”
“The new dance rule, Bandit Leader, every dancer enters one at a time.” Vovina states then snaps her black tinted manicured fingernails at Tick. One of Hico’s nasty dance judges in the same bite-nats face mask, Tick obeys then aims the cold barrel on his rifle directly at Taffy. Taffy gasps in shock then swiftly paces backwards from the loaded shotgun, and stops standing in front of Rusk, softly growling with worry and fear for her person and her team mates.
Vovina presses both of her palms down over her new gown saying with a smile, “Jellico, come over and stand right here, dearie! You will enter first through the dark curtain drape. Don’t worry! This is all fun and games. I promise!” She glances back over her collar bone to see Kodare.
Kodare between a third dangling dark blue patched ratty drape curtain and Etta on the opposite side of the lobby area. He nods in silence and then returns back violently shoving Etta through the blue curtain.
Vovina swings back with a smirk and then forcefully shoves Jellico through the long curtain fabric. The cloth is thick flying back blocking the open archway again and hides everything from each teen. Behind the curtain, Jellico screams out loud and then the pain of silence comes from the first Bandit dancer. Each Bandit teen gasps in worry and shuffles in place feeling nervous on a pair of bite-nats painted boots.
Taffy leaps forward from the line feeling worry, trying to rescue Jellico. Tick swings the cold barrel on his shotgun at her face again. She carefully steps back and stands in the line-up growling her displeasure and stares at Vovina.
Vovina shoves Atoka through the curtain fabric next. Behind the long dark mysterious curtain, Atoka hollers out loud and then the same pain of silence comes from the second Bandit team member.
Rusk releases Taffy feeling both fear and worry. She slowly advances ahead, stops and stands beside the mysterious dark curtain looking through the thick fabric and sees nothing on the other side. Then she turns and sneers first whispering her plan to Vovina. “I will kill you last.”
Vovina laughs out loud then says with a stern face. “You’re bravely amusing, Taffy! Your sister Tulu was a real drag, such a mellow and serious teen, all the time. Too bad! She has escaped with those two other South Beach cowboys from the Dance Hall. She would’ve been proud of your teenly defiance!” She softly chuckles again.
Taffy gasps in shock and slaps both of her palms on her parts lips knowing the real truth. Tulu and McCamy have not escaped from Metro City Birmingham.
Vovina doesn’t know the truth. Hico continues to hold her family members hostage inside a secretly hidden compartment here within the Metro City Dance Hall building. Hico is very dangerous man, to everyone.
Another nasty dance judge from Hico’s small army still wearing a same black-tinted bite-nats face mask, Ant moves from the side wall then appears beside Vovina reaching out and grabs the real cloth backpack from Taffy’s collar bone quickly searching through the contents, exposing all her stolen paint cans. Taffy turns and gasps with worry at Ant.

Taffy stumbles through a narrow doorway opening and holds her breath bringing both her fists upright near her face, for the dangerous fight battle, since he/she/it may get one good swing, but she’ll return back viciously to save her life force. The musical song Thriller was performed by American rock and roll superstar musical artist Michael Jackson and released on January 23, 1984. The songwriter was Rod Temperton.

Inside a modified Dance Hall space, South Beach Bandit Jellico stands on one side of the large room, wearing a pink sleeveless vest, a matching pair of blue jeans, and a pair of cherry colored cowgirl boots. Her blonde hair is wet, but her smile is happy.
South Beach Bandit Atoka stands beside Jellico, wearing a yellow vest, a matching pair of blue jeans and a pair of puke green cowgirl boots. Her red hair is wet as she growls at the two Rider girls, Etta and Pemona.
On the opposite side of the formal dance room, North Ridge Mountain Rider Etta stands in matching red colors beside North Ridge Mountain Rider Pemona in orange colors as the two girls slowly form the Rider line-up.
The dance floor is dirty and empty. The live audience is missing and has been replaced with a row of medium-sized television screens. The elevated, naked, wooden shelf with the row of colored bite-nats tubes is empty also. On top of the stage platform, the four worn and ancient oversized chairs are missing too.
On the side wall of dull, torn flower-patterned wallpaper has been removed and replaced with a very large open hole. The open hole exposes each eyeball, every nose hole, and every eardrum to the outside world environment within Metro City Birmingham, in the winter month of January.
Before the three Nuclear Wars, the wintery months of December, January, February, and March provided a cool weather pattern and then a cold weather pattern and finally freezing air temperatures, along with occasional snowflakes and ice sheets. on the grounds and the roadways. However, after the three wars, the winter season weather pattern has changed starting out with mild air temperatures becoming cool then very cold then a continuous snow blizzard coming northernly from the raising Appalachian Mountain Range. The citizens of Birmingham live indoors keeping warm and toasty.
Thus, currently, on the first week of winter January, the bright rays of warm sunshine burns down from the pale blue sky on top of the part-lush green and part-dead yellow tinted ground. Numerous chunks of broken white-colored concrete mortars zigzag across an interior dirty black and white, blood-stained dance floor. Long greenery plant vines and hardy rows of colorful winter wildflowers, short fruit plants, and tall groves of naked trees cover the outside wintery landscape filling the air with buzzing insects and smells of ripen fruit and flora flowers.
Taffy stops with a smile and spins around standing beside Atoka, behind the stage platform, watching the white curtain on the entrance wall, feeling both relief and happiness. She continues to hear the up-beat musical notes and words.
From the Bandit door, on the entrance wall, Rusk emerges a few seconds later with a head of wet blonde hair, wearing a dark blue un-zipped vest, exposing his naked chest, an eight-pack abdomen, a pair of matching blue jeans, and a pair of blood-red cowboy boots. He dashes ahead with a grin and collides into Taffy spinning them around in a circle of happiness. He stops and cuddles Taffy watching the entrance wall for the rest of the Bandit teammates, dancing in place to the wild up-beat musical notes and words.
Bat slowly emerges from the curtain then scans the room seeing his Bandit team mates presenting a huff of relief stomping into the line. He spins around and stands beside Rusk watching for his last team mate. He dresses in a neon colored light green hue.
Wolf dashes through the curtain wearing all brown clothes and a matching pair of brown-tinted cowboy boots, stops, and stands beside Bat.
On the other side of the long room, Rider Leader Baycliff struts out from the far second parted white tinted curtain last, wearing a smile and all black clothes, marching in a pair of black colored cowboy boots and then stops, forming the last of the North Ridge Mountain Riders team mates. He starts to clap and dances with his more friendly teammates to the up-beat musical tune. His other five team mates consist of Etta, Lion, Brazoria, Gator, and Pemona.
On top of the stage platform, standing behind the two dance teams of teens, Hico poses on the lip and claps with a smile to the musical song, also, wearing a gray sleeveless vest, a matching long sleeved shirt, a pair of matching trousers, and a pair of gray dress shoes. He stops clapping lifting both of his arms in the air then yells to the human controller, who sits behind the protective wall. “Kill the music!” The musical song ceases. He continues. “Now, I do believe that we are all even now. No more hidden flash blades or funny cock-rocks. But that was a clever invention, Wolf-man!” He chuckles with amusement.
Wolf spins around and then hisses at Hico slowly back stepping along with his team mates from the wooden platform, standing in the middle of the dance room. He stares at Hico, Kodare, and Vovina and a new row of nasty dance judges wearing an individual gray and black-tinted Insect bite-nats face mask, brown clothes, and holding a hand gun in each cupped hand, pointing at each teen.
Baycliff spins around along with his teammates back stepping from the vile bunch of humans then stops, standing in the middle portion of the room and far enough away from the Bandit team mates. He views and hears Hico also, starting to sneer at the evil cold-blooded murderous dictator and his small army of cold-blooded murderers too.
Hico chuckles at the silly teens then states with a smile, “The slate has to be both level and just. After all, this is a competition and all the competitors must be equal! If you have not noticed the new decorum, behind your fanny, three new television monitors are mounted above the entrance doors. If you will be please spin around and view each illuminated monitor for your additional visual and vocal information, during the new dance competition,” he points at the row of television screens. “And you will be seen, not necessarily heard on all the new mini-television screens, too, so you must all be descent here,” He chuckles then states with a stern face. “Please, go and illuminate each television screen for me, Tick!” Each television screen displays a slightly elevated naturally wooden stave holding scattered individually upright vertical tubes of bite-nats. The paint glitters in lovely neon colors reflecting the bright sunlight rays within a lush green tinted forest environment, not located on the cold hard dance floor. The dancers spin around and view the three television screens in silence absorbing the electronic image.
He says with a smile. “Each bite-nats paint tube comes in various counts and shapes. Two small tubes; three medium tubes, and four large-sized quantities like a milk jug, if you know what an ancient plastic milk jug looks like. That’s a total of nine tubes of various colors as well. There are twelve of you. That’s a decrease three tubes or 25 percent of the grand prize of glittering treasure, if you are mathematically challenged! You get to share, that’s part of the ‘team’ thing. You get to race, that’s part of the ‘compete’ thing. You get to die, that’s part of the ‘death’ thing. The good news, you can take all nine tubes, if you arrive first and then you can share with your mates or keep for your selfish selfie,” he laughs with an evil tone along with his employees and some of the vicious teen dancers. Baycliff, Taffy, and Rusk sneers at Hico. The other teens gasp in shock.
Hico continues wearing his evil smirk. “You must admit covering yourself completely with bite-nats paint sorta ups the iron stakes for your personal body survival. Please, miniaturize each television screen for me, Tick!” Each television screen shrinks down and displays an electronic geographic map of the landscape within Metro City Birmingham, specifically the existing lush forestland.
Hico grins and points down to the floor broken tiles explaining the information. “You are here. Do you see the cute blue blinking arrow on each television screen?” He points up and down around the room during his narration to the teens saying with a smile. “Each tube of bite-nats is someplace there. Do you see the red blinking arrow on each television screen also? You can stomp down and kill any and all the lovely garden flowers and lush forest plants getting your final destination first, not last. Turn to see the newly decorated side wall. Pull back the protective black curtain, Tick! Now, look outside! That’s the real outdoors here, in Birmingham, folks! There was once was a nice wall that had to be destroyed for today’s dance competition. To be fair and just, within the new dance competition, there aren’t any wild mammals, such like, bears or coyotes or cougars, only you and your friendly teammates and vicious enemies. There do exist plenty of beetles, cockroaches, crickets, squirrels, rabbits, snakes, and other crawling critters. Plants, berries, and vines aren’t poisonous to your biological body and can provide food meals, if need be. There are numerous tiny creek stream with plenty of clean and pure, not contaminated drinking water. You are the only lethal thing inside this new Concrete Jungle.” Hico points at each teen and loudly chuckles at his new game, along with his two superintendents and his army of nasty guards. He drops his arm and slaps his leg.
He continues, “You might develop deadly weapons from the visual sources seem outside there. I caution you here. The old building mortars and bricks and walls are ancient and probably will fall into dust bunnies, within your two bare palms. The trees are both old and twisted and extremely rotten hiding nested cuddled worms, marching beetles, and hissing snakes, in some places, maybe nesting into sturdy tree limbs also. The rest of the woodlands are covered in pretty colorful wildflowers, assorted short and tall annoying ground weeds, and knee-high grass blades. I have covered everything. I predict the new dance competition event will finish within two hours or less. Then, you come back here the winner or the winners,” he laughs along with all his employees and some of the bolder teens.
He shares, “The Concrete Jungle provides food, water, sunshine. No wild animals. No weapons. No rain in the forecast for today, tomorrow, the next day, the rest of the week, weeks, and months. You have lucked out, here, this new morning, dancers. You seem eager to fight and anxious to participate in the new dance competition. I will not keep you waiting for your final destination with Mother Nature or each other. We will do this on my vocal mark. Please, play the trumpets, Spider!” A single musical instrument trumpet honks out a group of sour alto notes.
He flips his hand in the air and laughs out loud saying with a grin, “Please, toot the flutes, Cricket!” A single musical instrument flute loudly toots with an array of elegant soprano musical notes.
He flips his other hand in the air and orders, “Please, roll the drums, Moth!” A single drum snarl rolls with a steady beat from the talented adult male then halts. Hico shouts. “Introduce the music!” A new musical song starts to play.

The musicians included Axl Rose (vocals); Slash (lead guitar); Izzy Stradlin (rhythm guitar); Duff McKang (bass guitar) and Steven Adler (drums) and was formed in the city of Los Angeles within the U.S. State of California, in the year 1985.

The air temperatures are cool, and the sunlight rays are dull and slightly warm on each teen body.

Taffy glances back over her collar bone. Bat gentlemanly assists Jellico over the rough and high plant foliage. Then Taffy returns back looking ahead to the ground obstacles and continues to race with Rusk.
Wolf closely follows behind Atoka as they both run ahead with the other Bandits.

“Bossy lady!”

He stops and pants in heavy breaths also. She scoots around and stands in front of Rusk lifting up on her tippy toes, leaning into his sour face and tenderly kisses his pink lips. He stands in place with worry and watches her disappear around the grove of trees exhaling with concern, veering away from Taffy and searches for his other Bandit team members.

At 06:13 a.m., the flat level landscape consists of dead brown colored grass, short yellow tinted weeds, tiny patches of colored wildflower that has quickly changed into scattered and bumpy rows of broken man-made bricks and lumpy concrete slabs. Taffy is racing in the proper direction as she continues to follow way behind Wolf jerking around each broken chunk of concrete, advancing towards a row of damaged black, yellow, brown red, and white colored man-made buildings and structures.
Each building had been twelve or more stories tall, during the last Nuke War, before the last laser blast destroyed the entire city.
Now, each building is a pile of burnt blackened stone or a half the size of the original structure that stands alone within the middle of a lush jungle forest of brown trees and yellow plants.
Taffy halts with a gasp and slams against the side wall on the next building as a plume of red-tinted dust floats down from the air waves and then covers her purple vest and jeans coming for a harmless air attack. She inhales and then exhales while calming down her teenly fears squatting down on one kneecap, surveying the wall corner.
The row of damaged buildings had been separated and maintained a plot of grassy land for a flower garden on the ground. Now, the flower garden has grown up and become crooked rows of yellow wickedly-looking plants and wildflowers.
Taffy slowly stands upright from the smooth short concrete slab, without seeing another Rider or her Bandit friends dashing between two rows of green bushes, spotting a Banana spider.
A Banana spider exhibits a two-inched vertical, yellow reddish abdomen-type body. It is also known as a giant wood spider that comes from the Nephila genus of spiders and is oldest surviving species on the planet. The spider had been discovered with a group of fossilized cavemen, 165 million years ago.
The spider weaves a web between the leaves on a group of plant bushes and the flower stems to catch a set of flying and crawling insects, but basically it is a nuisance right now for a woodland traveler like Taffy. The web silk tissue engineering is a very strong and a very yucky, sticky substance that lovingly adhesion onto any type of delicate human flesh, like Taffy’s naked arm skin.
She jerks through the rows of plants and dashes down an empty row, moving away from the giant spider web, leaping over each fallen tree limb and then stumbles over each moss-covered tree root. She drops down and lands on her stomach, extending both of her arms for a smooth landing hitting a squashy thing, sounding with a loud scream. She shuffles both of her palms around the wet moss and reveals the squashy thing.
A short body contains a set of webbed digits, a pair of protrude eyeballs, a bifid red tinted tongue without a tail, making a dark green bullfrog.
She jumps upright from the ground and then back steps with a sour frown, quickly dashing around the bullfrog, swiftly racing ahead towards the location of the bite-nats tubes with her current life-saving mission. Taffy rushes underneath the tree canopy that blocks out the sunlight and then enters into an open clearing. The flat clearing of yellow dead grass is surrounded by rows of thorny green shrubs and wild berry plants consisting of rounded blueberries and oval-shaped red and black raspberries.
Back home in South Beach, her mother created glass jars of sweet jams and jelly preserves from the wild blueberries and raspberries that her and her sister Tulu picked from the lush plant bushes, after their afternoon chores.
Individual hovering yellow-tinted tiny hummingbirds fly beside an individual colorful butterfly continuing to suck dry the sweet nectar from each honeyberry for their food, on this cool early morning.
Honeysuckles, or the uncommon name honeyberries, grow vigorous within the heated sunlight, possessing nearly indestructible green leaves and produce red tinted rounded poisonous berries inside the honeysuckle field like here at Metro City Birmingham. The arching shrubs and twisting vines overgrow on top of anything and everything, including fallen tree stubs, old broken fencing posts, and low-hanging brick columns.
Taffy spots an old wooden stave in the middle of the yellow weeds without a single tube of bite-nats paint, racing towards the stave, sliding down over the weeds on her kneecaps. She says with a soft whisper, “Gone!” She examines the empty wooden platform then spots the color of lilac hue narrowing her eyelashes, leaning closer down into the honeysuckle leaf. A leaf is not colored in lilac hue, only pale green color.
A tight vine with red berries is coated in tiny bits of bite-nats lilac colored paint also. So, the tube of lilac paint must have broken apart probably after a rush of upright bodies impacted against the stationary and anchored the wooden stave platform, grabbing up the grand prize.
There is not any type of physical evidence, such like, ripped off human body parts or red tinted blood human proteins on top or beside that wooden platform, so her team members must have successfully acquired a tube or two of bite-nats paint also.
Taffy wonders if the lilac colored bite-nats paint could be used as a weapon that rests on top of the honeysuckle leaf. She stands upright from the yellow weeds and then sidesteps into the woodland forest searching for a tiny dead tree twig as a tool implement. She stops and yanks a healthy green leaf from the tree branch spinning around, dashing back to the wooden stave. She bends down and carefully examines each berry leaf seeing a new issue. The lilac tinted bite-nats paint has been ninety-nine percent absorbed into the main component of the vine, including all the honeysuckle flowers, red berries, green leaves, and clay red dirt. The honeysuckle vine is not dead but dying from the man-made bite-nats paint job.
Taffy is not touching the exposed bite-nats paint on each honeyberry which might accidentally transform her human body into a bell-shaped honeysuckle flower, since a finger pad of tiny bite-nats is dangerously morphing live things into a set of dead things.
Her pair of naked legs is covered in a pair of blue jeans, so she can’t paint the lilac bite-nats on her clothing. The clothing will only stain and waste the precious commodity without providing a useful weapon.
She leans over and flings the green leaf over the top of the bite-nats paint spots hitting the flower, the stem, and all of hanging berries while capturing some of the tiny splatters of lilac color. The green leaf flutters by the honeysuckle vine and then lands on top of the yellow weeds in peace.
She stands upright from the weeds with a smile and then dashes ahead squatting down, picking up one green colored tree leaf. The green tree leaf is similar to a tiny hair-horse brush. The brush is dead, so the bite-nats paint cannot morph the brush back into a live horse. She touches the dead tree leaf with a tiny amount of lilac colored paint on her arm and then draws a semi-crooked line inside the anterior of her arm. She performs the think object: flash blade. A tiny lilac colored flash blade forms inside the meat of her arm wearing a tiny set of wicked claws that protrudes on top.
She smiles down at her new gift. She performs the think object: paint. Her tiny flash blade morphs back into lilac paint on her arm.
She slowly stands upright from the weeds and scans the rest of the grounds, moving backwards to encompass the vast landscape. The landscape is beautiful, consisting of smooth fields of yellow weeds, scattered tight groves of lush green trees, and a few winding hidden forest trails into the deep woodlands, where one of her enemies can hide also. Her boot heel slams into an object. She spins around with a gasp, seeing a Thorny Forest.
The Thorny Forest displays numerous semi-crooked rows of low spiny flower species, which is composed of purple bull thistles, pink milk thistles, red flowering thorn bushes, and numerous rose bushes. A rose bush is technically known as a prickle bush, not a thorn.
Hundreds of roses have grown and inhabited the Thorny Forest from orange, yellow, and white small cabbage roses and pink, red, crimson, and mauve garden roses. A rose bush is an excellent perimeter defense for any lawn or yard area keeping away trespassers from the human-kind to mammal-kind.
She fondly thinks of her previous yesterdays in South Beach Colony at her dad’s crop and cow farm.



For years, during their childhood days within the South Beach Colony, Baycliff always brought Taffy a handful of wild pink roses, without the cow drool, that he collected around the cow pastures during his visual inspection of each baby calf and any loose hanging fence posts.

He and his horse galloped ahead like a bronze knight, in a sweaty shirt, visiting Taffy inside one of the many crop fields, toting a gallon jug of cold water with ice cubes and a basket of his mother’s home-baked oatmeal cookies.

Rusk also visited Taffy during their evening mealtime, after all farm chores at Thelee Farms, tagging slowly behind his brother McCamy, who lovingly tongue-drooled over his girl Tulu. Rusk always presented Taffy with a hand bouquet of sweet red-tinted flowered honeysuckles, without the poisonous berries, unlike his evil twin.

Taffy loved the honeysuckle flowers and sucked down the sweet nectar with Rusk on the back porch. While McCamy and her sister Tulu cuddled with each other inside the front porch swing, at her house under the watchful eyeballs of her parents Tourann and Thelee.



Back into the present day and time, within the Concert Jungle location, at 06:31 a.m., in front of the Thorny Forest, Taffy exhales with love at the beautiful roses, wiping her single tear of worry. She had to pick only one South Beach cowboy for her permanent wedded mate, after surviving the vicious dance battle fight last night and obeying the obtuse order coming from Dictator Hico, this morning. Now, Baycliff is in danger and will not last the morning, because of Taffy. The fluttering bright colors break Taffy’s day dream as dozens of flying butterflies silently land on top of her collar bone and both of her drooping arms.
A flock of butterflies is attracted to salt that lingers within the human sweat, which is called sodium. A butterfly feeds on nectar from the flowers for sugar, sips water from the damp patches of honeysuckle leaves, and pollinates any entire species of plants throughout the globe.
A butterfly dates back to the Mid-Eocene Epoch on the Planet Earth, 50 million years ago.
The flock travel in a large swarm over the span of geographical distances heading to their breeding season.
A butterfly possesses four wings covered in tiny scales. The fore and hind wings are not hooked together which creates a wonderful graceful flight while twirling their six legs.
The body lift is generated by non-transitory aerodynamics force of wing capture, which vortices at the wing edge, and then rotates the butterfly body like a machine, which is called the “clap-and-fling” mechanism. The “clap-and-fling” mechanism can change from one mode to another movement very rapidly on the butterfly’s body. So, the set of hind wings allows for a swift take off and tight wind turns while evading a predator.
If you see a single flying butterfly, the insect symbols “one person’s soul.” If you see a large number of butterflies, the swarm of insect represents a “bad omen.”
Taffy giggles at the two silly superstitions, gently flinging both of her arms in the air. The butterfly swarm flutters away from Taffy and then flies ahead towards the rows of garden roses. She drops both of her arms and slaps the vest back stepping from the pretty naturally created Rose Garden and then twirls to face the Thorny Forest, swiftly dashing ahead through the open clearing and darts around each grove of ancient trees and low-lying rows of fruit and plant bushes while scouting for her Bandit team members. In the short distance, she spots a stationary Rusk and dashes into his open arms.
Rusk hugs her wearing a smile then sniffs the air molecules using his pair of inflamed nostrils, saying with puzzlement. “You smell…”
Her eyeballs see a pair of yellow tinted butterflies fluttering towards the bright sunlight and a tree branch of green tree leaves, recalling a new tale. Two butterflies flying together symbolize the emotion of love.
She pulls back from his tight embrace and says with a smile. “I sweat stinky from my run. Did we get some of the bite-nats tubes? The wooden pallet inside the clearing location was empty. But I found some broken glass, probably from a short teenly war. I hope that we won a prize or two. He spins around and races ahead pulling beside her, running through the forest landscape. He says. “I don’t know, Taffy. But I did tell Bat to go and find a forest quarter. Since then, I’ve been hunting for you.”

His eyeballs dart down and trace the water flow following the stream downhill, where creek water runs-off into a larger body of water, probably a pond or a lake. Then he understands the land geology.
A river or a stream completes the hydrologic cycle by returning rainwater falling from the sloped landscape or down a steep mountain peak, running down into the ocean waters. Gravity is a driving an invisible physical force causing all the water molecules to move downwards. Gravity forces the water flow down over the land surface and also moves the water through the ground as groundwater. As surface water flows downwards, the molecules perform the work of both the erosion of rock and the deposits of sand, clay, and slit while shuffling the physical matter away from each side on the river bank and then finally depositing the water molecules down into the salty ocean waters also.
On the surface, a body of calm water waves will appear smooth, but underneath the liquid water, on the wet soil, an individual drop-off or hole in the bottom can exist, where the bedrock has eroded carrying both trash and minerals down into the ocean seas.
Lion has met a natural drop-off point residing at the bottom soil within the natural creek stream and then dropped down underneath the water surface. The drop-off spot has been eroded by both water and time, forming a semi-round open hole for a human body.

That’s the secret to manly strength, ya’ll!

Another thing, Hico and all his dead teens are planning to travel from here and go straight into South Beach, like a funeral parade, which includes all the other Colonists coming from North Ridge Mountain, Grand Rock Valley, and Swamp Island. Swamp Island is that stinky sea island off the coastline of Tennessee. Hico is going to start World War Four with the South Beach Colony and their Colonists.”
Rusk starts to stand and sounds with a gasp saying with an angry face, “Naw! We gotta go and tell my daddy, right now.”
He reaches over and grabs both the biceps on Rusk, shoving his friend back down to the ground. Baycliff says with a stern face. “Not yet! My eyeballs see some new movement in the far distance. It looks like more trouble. You stay here and defend the bushes. I’ll go around and defend the rows of thorny plants. Then we attack from both sides and end this silly fight battle. We need to go and prepare for a real war with Dictator Hico.” Rusk nods his bone skull in silent acceptance.
Baycliff slides away from Rusk and spins around slowly standing upright on top of the grass first then folds down at his fitted waistline. He swiftly races head towards the Thorny Forest moving back towards the Dance Hall building. He plans to surround the pair of Lion and Brazoria from the rear while Rusk attacks the front.
Pemona smiles and slowly strolls away from the Rose Garden moving ahead into a clear meadow, holding the overcrowded gourd in a pretty dethorned bouquet of roses. She stares ahead at the massive honeysuckle field and then stops. A faint whistling sounds behind her rear skull. She feels a sharp pain against the rear bone skull near her earlobe then drops the gourd of flowers on top of the ground. She slowly slumps down in the honeysuckle leaves feeling dizziness within her head and a throbbing pain on her rear neck muscles, standing upright within a soft bed of honeysuckle leaves on top of her two kneecaps. Then her kneecaps slowly spin around and as she gasps in shock. Her entire body falls sideway landing on her side staring at the yellow and green tinted bite-nats T-rex face mask.
Brazoria/T-rex leans down and smashes all sweet juices from each honeyberry as the sweet odor drifts up from the ground, through the air waves, and into the inflamed nostrils on Brazoria. She fakes a smile and stares down into a stunned Pemona saying with a sweet timber. “O! I’m so sorry, Rider Pemona! I must’ve missed that dang Bandit!” She displays a pair of yellow tinted bite-nats fangs dangling down her puke green lips which seriously clashes with the T-rex green leathery scales on her female face. She sneers first then says with a grin. “Now, you stay right here and outta of harm’s way, dear!” Hot liquid slowly trickles down her sweaty neck going down her naked back spine, eating away each yellow tinted bite-nats spike.
Brazoria swiftly stands upright and as she darts her eyeballs away from Pemona staring at the field of honeysuckle leaves. She whirls around and gasps in alarm seeing Wolf. She closes her two eyelashes feeling an intense stinging pain that attacks each brain cell that swiftly travels down each one of her spinal cord nerve endings, going straight into her heart muscle. She hears the loud laughter coming from another pair of lips. Her opens her eyelashes and stares at Wolf and as her body stumbles down and then falls on her back spine inside a soft bed of honeysuckle leaves dead.
Bandit Wolf squats down and leans over sneering at the dead face on Brazoria, yelling at the dead body. “Bitch! You murdered my girlfriend. She was my pretty little Dove.” He mouth spits his salvia down on her face then slowly stands upright swinging around, jogging back towards the building. He tosses both of his arms in the air and shouted to everyone. “This battle event has finally ended.” He disappears into the woodlands.
Taffy stops behind a row of short bushes slowly peeking her eyeballs above the plant leaves, seeing the lonely Rider. She quickly stands upright from the dirt then swiftly races through the low-lying plant brushes heralding her rabbit-spear even with her collar bone sneering with fury and charges directly at Pemona.
Rusk sidesteps with a gasp from the thick tree trunk and then blocks a racing Taffy, racing out and jerks the rabbit-spear from her cupped hand as the weapon de-masks back into a dead tan-colored bunny rabbit’s mutated body. He pitches the dead rabbit down in the honeysuckle leaves staring at Taffy saying with a nasty tone. “Pemona’s hurt, Taffy. She can’t harm you. You need to go and develop some compassion here, girl. We got more important matters that need attending too right now which concerns each one of our family members back there in South Beach. Let her be!” Taffy slumps down into his naked chest sobbing with her worried tears. He hugs Taffy while pondering her current mental state. He also feels both relief and sadness, at the same time, also.


10:29 a.m.
Honeysuckle Field setting
Warmer temperatures with dull sunlight


Wolf reappears and tosses both of his arm in the air yelling at the current survivors of the Sniff, the Honeysuckle Dance, “Ya’ll, unwelcomed company is coming walking underneath those shade trees through the sunrays from the west!” He wears a worried brow, thumbing back over his collar bone and then stops standing in front of Rusk and Taffy. A semi-conscious Pemona continues to rest inside the bed of honeysuckle leaves and flowers.
Rusk releases Taffy. They pull apart and then stand in a semi-straight line along with Wolf.
Wolf, Rusk, and Taffy stare at two familiar, bite-nats, face masks, Ant and Wasp, who offer an equal and un-matched and un-fair fist fight carrying a real shotgun.
Baycliff has been re-captured and marches in-between dance judges Ant and Wasp in a single line, without a drum fanfare. The row moves towards the line of teens and then stops. Baycliff jabs his finger at Taffy and shouts with a sour tone. “You knew!”
Ant and Wasp both de-mask with the bite-nats paint revealing the non-smiling faces of Tulu and McCamy. Tulu dashes ahead with a stern face hugging and then whispers into Taffy’s face. Taffy nods in silence.
Baycliff continues to jab her finger and yells with a sour tone at Taffy. “Taffy, you knew, all this time, that your sister Tulu and my friend McCamy were being held as a set of hostages inside the Power Room setting by Dictator Hico. And Taffy didn’t tell anyone her secret, not to me or Rusk or any real cowboy. Isn’t that right, girl? Have we learned anything important here at the annual Apprenticeship Program! Yes, we have learned that family comes first. Our loved ones come first, Taffy, before any of this silly nonsense. If we had only known, then Rusk and I would have busted McCamy and Tulu out their sealed cells. Then all of us would have been freed and outta of here, high tailing back home to South Beach, right now.”
Rusk turns with a gasp and then frowns with fury staring at the nose profile on Taffy, asking with an un-apologetic tone. “Why didn’t you tell me, Taffy? You, Baycliff, and I have been out here among the sweet honeysuckle vines playing a sour game of deadly warfare with our life force. What for in tarnation, Taffy? Why are we gambling with their freedom? Wonder if?” He looks down with a sneer and kicks the grass blades feeling both angry and worry for his twin brother, Tulu and other his childhood friends.
Taffy looks at McCamy. He stares back at her in silence. She looks at Baycliff. He sneers at her. She looks at Rusk. He continues to stare down at the grass. She crosses her arms over her dirty and bloody sleeveless vest exhaling with worry.
Tulu exhales with a puff worry, too, chases after her older sister then stops hugging her sister, whispering into the cheekbone on Taffy. “Baycliff’s wrong, Taffy. He doesn’t understand. Hico threatened you, didn’t he? We could see you behind the glass window too. We couldn’t hear the words from Hico, but you were upset too. You couldn’t do anything to help us, without getting yourself killed too. I didn’t want to be killed either. We saw the body of dead Apprentice Una and all her dead family members. Hico left the row of bodies hanging by their broken necks in there, in case, another dancer wanted to defect from the dance contest.”
Taffy continues to stare with a stern face at the miles and miles of honeysuckles vines in silence.
Tulu exhales with worry then explains. “Big bad boys like to do bad stuff to good folks. Baycliff, he belly aches all the time, since Amita left him, except when you came along and then kicked his fanny into some common sense. Since his common sense lives down there in his butthole. He likes to fight even with a room full of sissy girls. I don’t understand that teen. Can you understand Baycliff, Taffy?”
Taffy exhales with annoyance and then back steps from the edge of the honeysuckle field, spinning around, moving back into the clearing in silence. Tulu exhales with worry about her upset sister and her missing parents and then swings around dashing beside Taffy. They move ahead, stop, then sit down in front of grove of tall shade trees, beside a sitting Wolf, on top of the flat grass blades and away from Baycliff, Rusk, and McCamy.
In the middle of the clearing, McCamy shuffles ahead with a stern face and then reaches out, grabbing the arm of Baycliff.
Baycliff presents a puzzled brow and struts beside McCamy in silence. Both of them stop and then stand at the edge of the honeysuckle field staring at miles and miles of green tinted honeysuckle vines.
McCamy continues to stare at the new landscape saying with a stern face. “Hico has left out from here, without us, but he travels towards our home of South Beach with all of the dead teens and his merry band of lowlifes, that came from local Metro City Prison Complex. The city is empty, except for a pair of two un-conscious dance judges,” he lifts up and then rubs a row of bloody and raw skin on his knuckles from his fighting fist fest softly chuckling with delight. “These two set of jaw lines were a lot harder than I thought. Our buddy Hixson and Tulu’s parents are with Hico as a set of ransomed hostages. However, Hico is stupid thinking that we’ll sit around here playing a smooth game of table checkers, if we are separated. I can’t wait to beat the heck of Hico, if my daddy doesn’t beat us to him first,” he chuckles along with Baycliff.
The small farmers, that live within the South Beach Colony, do not like company, even friendly.
A swarm of colorful butterflies flies through the air, lands and then perches on the two bend elbows and two collar bones upon Baycliff as he continues to scan the honeysuckle field in silence.
McCamy reaches over and then slaps the naked bicep on Baycliff. The line of colorful butterflies gracefully flies off both arms and both collar bone on Baycliff. McCamy smiles with a nod at the honeysuckle vines saying with a cheery tone. “Back there at the Dance Hall building, I spotted a couple of rusty but operational transports that’ll take us back home. We need to live and prepare for a Rebel War against Hico and all his creepy insects.”
Baycliff continues to stare at the miles and miles of green tinted vines saying with a stern face, “Honeyberries.”
“Yup!” McCamy comments then narrows his two eyelids studying the field of honeysuckles. “There are thousands and thousands of honeysuckles vines. The vines grow wild in the heat or in the shade while overtaking steel trellis, concrete fence posts, wooden arbors, and any other type of vertical or horizontally hard or soft man-made framework. Nothing kills them dead. The flowers are pretty. The juice is sweet. A farmer does not plant the vines around their farmland. Do you remember when that honeyberry batch attacked and then grew over all my mama’s prized Carolina Roses, at our house? She had a shit fit and then me, Rusk, and my daddy had to kill then clean off all those tiny honeyberries, wet leaves, and long vines to appease that woman.” He chuckles thinking about his strong-willed mother as his fiancé Tulu is the opposite of his mother, a mellow, mild, and sweet-mannered country girl.
“And honeysuckle vines provide heavy ground cover routinely used for an erosion control to protect plant roots from freezing in the wintertime season and conserve moisture in summertime heated days. The air temperature get much colder here in Metro City Birmingham, where the city lies between two mountain ranges.” Baycliff states and points to a small hillside representing the ending point for the Appalachian Foothills.
The ancient and vast Appalachian Mountain Range start to descend down from the ancient U.S. State of West Virginia and ends inside the ancient U.S. State of Alabama. However, large portions of the outside mountains were blasted down by bombs from foreign air, sea, and sky warcraft during three Nuclear Wars creating low-lying dirt valleys and hard tall chunks of limestone rock boulders without mammals and men.
Baycliff shakes his cropped blonde hair and announces with a puzzled brow. “Naw! There’s something else here. What do you see out there, McCamy?”
McCamy continues to scan the miles of vines and then gasps in shock pointing at the vine, saying with a smile. “That particular breed, a Golden Flame Honeysuckle vine grows fifteen feet long with a row of flowers in hot pink color with a yellow throat. A Scarlet Honeysuckle vine grows twelve feet displaying red flowers. And there are millions of ground patches of healthy American Honeysuckle vines which are the longest of all the plant vines and grow up towards twenty-five feet in length.”
“I’m not interested in the types of honeysuckle vines. The entire honeysuckle field contains an ultimate purpose, within my mind and my mind’s eyeballs,” he reaches out and grabs the arm on McCamy spinning them around, jabbing his dirty fingernail at the disorganized batches of pretty rose bushes, saying with a stern face. “That lovely sight of flowers over there is something else also. I see a freakingly elegant manicured Rose Garden right here in the middle of a jungle forest. I’ve never seen a freaking elegant manicured Rose Garden right here in the middle of a jungle forest. And the freakingly elegant manicured Rose Garden happens to exhibit a wide variety of roses in various colors and sizes. I recognize Dog Roses, Carolina Roses, and Cabbage Roses. All of these natural flower arrangements are too coincidental, within my neurons, that all those baby seedlings somehow flew away at the same from somewhere and then all of them somehow landed right here in one dang spot, even if the major city and surrounding communities had been reduced down to ant hills with an array of dangerous and deadly nuked blasts, from our enemies.” He exhales with puzzlement and then turns to see the nose profile on McCamy saying with a stern face. “It looks to me like this freakingly elegant manicured Rose Garden has been planted here for a purpose along with these row of thorn bushes. Thorns and prickle plants are used exclusively to defend the home’s property lines from an assortment of pesky critters and also can be very useful for hiding something.”
McCamy parks both of his hands on his fit waistline while studying the thorn bushes, then the Rose Garden, and finally spins back around. He views the field of honeysuckles while pondering Baycliff’s words: hiding something.
Baycliff spins around also and continues to stand beside McCamy staring into the miles of honeysuckle vines, asking with a puzzled brow. “What lives underneath an entirely nuked city, a nest of rats or a cave of gold nuggets or a tomb of dead people?”
McCamy turns and then studies the crumbling walls on each damaged building saying with a stern face. “The city was not nuked. The city and citizens was laser-beamed marked with an atmospheric air strike almost all damaging structures, scaring off the family pets, and killing off a majority of the citizens. And then the enemy forces tried to invade the damaged city, but it didn’t work out that way either as the rebel fighters had planned for such a battle fight and the rebels won it all. And I bet my best pair of cowboy boots that you don’t know this tidbit of information, Baycliff. Hico was once a citizen and a military general in the ancient United States of America Army Corps living right here during the Nuclear War battle fight.”
Baycliff gasps in shock then turns to see the nose profile on McCamy. “Well, I don’t get your best pair of cowboy boots, bro!”
McCamy laughs then states with a stern face. “Who would guard a destroyed city or guard a hidden secret? I bet my best stallion the secret has been buried underneath the miles and miles of honeysuckles,” he points around the landscape at the damaged buildings and then the field of honeysuckles explaining. “Once upon a time, all of this landmass was a major city laying between the mountains and the river. Then that last Nuclear War came here to damage all the lands and then Mother Nature followed up destroying the entire river bed flooding the entire landscape right up to the foothills. Lots of people, pets, and plants died, of course. The small gang of survivors came here and crated a new city, not without blood, sweat and tears. That major city had been named as Huntsville. Huntsville had been the home town to outer space flying rockets and ancient war weapons and the creation of bite-nats paint.”
Baycliff turns with a gasp to see the nose profile on McCamy saying with a stern face. “My daddy was one of those smartass scientists, too, back then. He knows all about the bite-nats paint, including the beginning, middle, and ending. He resigned his work job, before the beginning of Nuke War Three and then moved all of us upwards to the sky living within the Birmingham Mountains that used to be surrounded by rows of thick, rich, green-tinted, lush, tree forests, before it all became the new rock-hard Birmingham Cliffs surrounded by the massively dangerous warm, man-eating, Gulf of Mexico salt waters, which is about…”
“…about the same time that my family showed up there at the newly created South Beach Colony, too. I’m guessing here,” he turns and winks at Baycliff saying with a smile. “Your real name ain’t Baycliff.” Baycliff snorts with a nod. McCamy nods with a grin. “Don’t worry, bro! Our family changed our names and our origins, too. I guess, we’re more alike than different, me and you. Hico must’ve known something as well about the ancient bite-nats history while residing there, within Huntsville, before the last war. He’s a city slicker. Well, I’m an old country boy. And I think that I see a cleverly disguised but hidden foot passageway which is an eye-gleaming bald spot in-between these two tall shading oak trees.” He drops both of his arms beside his legs and softly chuckles performing the think object: flash blades.
A pair of wicked-looking, clawed-tipped flash blades appears on each one of his naked anterior forearms measuring about three feet in length. He flips each arm down towards the ground as each flash blade drops away from his arm skin. His cupped hand easily grabs the handle and then lifts each flash blade up holding near his jaw line. McCamy leads Baycliff into the depths of the honeysuckle field in silence.
Beside the Rose Garden and in front of the honeysuckle field, near the edge of the clearing, above a grove of shade trees, Taffy reaches inside and grabs a cold beverage and a bag of food items from Tulu’s ratty backpack, leaning against the hard tree trunk and scratchy tree bark, feeling an overworked mind and a tired human body.
After the successful but bloody fist fight against the last two dance judges, within the Power Room, inside the Dance Hall building, teens Tulu and McCamy collected a new backpack of fresh food supplies from the kitchen shelves while searching for their friends, the other dance teens, and Dictator Hico.
In front of the grove of trees, Taffy sips the beverage and eats the food items satisfying both hunger and thirst and then turns to spy on her childhood friend and current boyfriend Rusk.
At the end of the gigantic honeysuckle field, Rusk sits down beside Pemona, who continues to sit upright inside a bed of soft honeysuckle vines. He dresses her bruised skull with a set of ripped up cloth bandages that also came from Tulu’s ratty backpack. He carefully holds a juice bottle at her lips while whispering a set of secret words into her non-bruised face, dropping down the bottle in his lip. He nods with a sweet smile and as she smiles back at him.
Rusk acts like a male figure of Florence Nightingale, which is his best personality trait providing tender loving care for all life forms, but Taffy at the moment.
On the line of trees beside Taffy, the tall, blonde-haired, Bandit team member Wolf gobbles down the food and works both his eyeballs and his finger pads on one of the mini-television devises, stolen from Tulu’s ratty backpack too. He presses numerous small buttons and then flips a row of tiny switches producing a show of movement, motion, and activity on the tiny monitor screen, in color, too.
The screen flashes a brief colorful still image from each unique landscape within each Colony, ruled by Dictator Hico, including smooth pink-tinted stone floor within the Grand Rock Valley, the single sea island within the Swamp Island, a tall mountain of forest trees within the North Ridge Mountain, and the flat, limestone gray-tinted, rock-coated tabletop cliff within South Beach. The images are presented to the Metro City Birmingham audience members and beyond within the Colonies of the U.S.A., and then to the survivors of the world.
Wolf hears the continuous dull narration coming from Hico’s voice, without seeing the smiling face on Hico. Then Wolf states and frowns down at the screen monitor. “The audience members within the world, they can’t see us here inside the Concrete Jungle environment.”
Taffy and Tulu continue to sit, together, underneath the shade tree softly whispering to each other, chewing on their food items and listen to Wolf’s information.
McCamy and Baycliff have disappeared among the vines of honeysuckles for some reason.
In front of the tree trunk, Wolf points down to the mini-television monitor saying with a smile. “This little device can’t transmit words into a pair of human or animal eardrums coming from here, within the thick jungle forest. And it’s not the tall shade trees fault either. There ain’t no type of mechanical radio towers, with all those tall and weird twisting metal antennas located here inside this Concrete Jungle environment as Hico had poorly described before. The mechanical radio towers holding all those sky-high antennas are located on the rooftop of the Metro City Dance Hall building. I barely remember this old-fashion television device that held a gigantic screen monitor that played lots of colorful cartoons, an array of ugly monsters, and numerous make-believe people, who acted out with all types of mystery, adventure, horror, and romance pretend human stories. It kept me entertained throughout the day and the night, until my mama yelled out loud for the eating meal. Then I was taken away as she grabbed and dragged me by my hair roots as I screamed for more from my T.V.”
He sniggers then says. “My kidnapping was only temporary. Then I returned back and finished watching my favorite television programs and even some of the television programs that I didn’t really like. But I was entertained every day and every night during the Nuke War activities.
“After Nuke War Three, all these devices were destroyed or de-activated by both sides of the foreign governments, for some strange reason. I recalled all the electronics. Electronics are things ran by electricity power stations that we didn’t have any more here within the Colonies of the U.S.A. The electronics were confiscated from each residential house and private businesses, including my own household. My mama had a shit fit. My daddy was held in place as each military soldier grabbed his arms, legs, and cupping his loud mouth while they toted out each steel and metal television device out from our house, storing them into a line of big large dump trucks.
“My T.V. was gone foreverly. I didn’t do so much after that as far as television watching went. I got to shoot lots of wounded stray dogs and cats and wild forest animals, for fun, and patched up the homestead, for safety, and rounded up all the healthy stray dogs and cats and horses and friendly cougars, for protection, and then fed them and housed them, while I tended all the healthy crop fields and vegetable gardens, for food. I fixed my mama a nice great big beautiful and sweet-smelling flower garden for her birthday along with a small birthday party surprise. We didn’t have much money; but we did have food and freedoms traveling between the treehouses for a few social gatherings,” he exhales with worry for his parents and his farm property, within the North Ridge Mountain Colony.
“I shot some stray visitors trespassing on our farm property and then buried them underneath the honeysuckle vines, like here, within Metro City Birmingham. All of these dead bodies are good manure for the growing plants and crops.” He turns and winks at Tulu. Tulu gasps in alarm.
Taffy laughs without choking on her lump of chewed food. Where she lives, if a stranger happens to wonder onto her daddy’s property, he or she is caught and then interrogated first. If his or her answers or requests are not good, then he or she is shot and killed getting buried underneath the plowed clay dirt soil too. But Tulu does not know of such deadly act or actions as Thelee does not tattle all his dirty deeds to his youngest daughter, only his oldest and wisest one. Taffy dares not tattle on her father, for any reason or body pains or soul sufferings either.
When Thelee and Tourann has ended their life, force set by the Prime Creator, Taffy will run the horse, cow, and crop farmland. Tulu will be married to McCamy. Then Taffy and McCamy will work together running a gigantic farm that feeds and cloths both the surviving and struggling northern and southern small communities, within the Colonies of the U.S.A.
Wolf says. “Today, killing a stranger isn’t against the law. It’s part of life. My daddy says that,” he looks down and examines the book-sized electronic device. “I like these electronic things and hope they place more entertainment programs on the monitor screen. The programs will be something to do back home, within the North Ridge Mountains. I wonder how Hico had gotten hold of these tiny working machines. A row of big gigantic steel towers containing numerous twisted antennas rest on top all the high mountain peaks back home. There might be microwave radio transmitters inside the towers too. My daddy used to work, a long time ago, with all types of electronics. He continues to tinker with collected electronic things, like this, all the time, at our home. Once I’m home, I can ask around with my daddy about other working machines.”
He points down at the television screen and states with a smile. “The audience members, who do possess or share these working machines with family and friends, saw the fun activity, inside that Dance Hall, here within Metro City Birmingham, both the first and second early evenings. They saw us dance and parade around the dance floor in our formal gowns and high heels. I bet my mama liked seeing the dance contest. She likes dancing and taught me to dance too. Now, on the third night, they saw the vicious teenly battle fight. My daddy loved it too while yelling and cheering for the fighters. He likes fighting and taught me to fight too. Now, today, the audience members cannot follow around and see us fighting and whacking each other bloody body part outdoors here within the Concrete Jungle. I guess, Hico’s two guards, Ant and Wasp, were assigned to wait for the teen survivors or winners to emerge from the Concrete Jungle, so each pair of Colony eyeballs could see the results of our...”
He clears his throat then explains. “Well, we can use these little mini-television devices for our advantage point while trapping and tagging a no good Hico, inside the South Beach Colony. No one knows who lives or who has…”
He clears his throat again then offers. “I bet my parents are worried about me. I bet my parents are mad too. Hico had planned all this deadly mess from the beginning to the ending while eliminating almost all the teen dancers, so there were no more eye or ear, or vocal witnesses left within his stupid Apprenticeship Program. I just don’t get it. What does he want from all the selected teens, from the deadly dance competition, from his Apprenticeship Program?”
Taffy exhales with worry then announces, “Bite-nats. Everyone wants the bite-nats paint. Now, everyone knows what bite-nats paint is and can do and will do for them. The bite-nats paint is not harmful or beneficial to us. We can’t eat the paint for food. Originally, the bite-nats paint had been used in the last Nuclear War events as a type of war gear weapon and war body gear protection that covered and protected each war battle soldier. And nobody knows this tidbit of gossip. But over time and space here on the planet, the glittery batch gets stronger and can last for a life time, kind of like, that field of honeysuckles. The entire vine of honeyberries does not die but sleep for a little while and then they bloom back open and produce a sweet scent of honey nectar.”
Tulu nods in silence to Wolf. He continues to listen trying to understand the new information.
Taffy continues. “I can see the entertainment benefit of a bite-nats paint that covers a mask to a mambo to a murder.” Tulu turns and gasps in alarm at her sister. Taffy says. “And I can see combining the entertainment benefit of a can of bite-nats paint with the new concept of an alive broadcast visual program using that tiny mini-television device thing to make something or a new production or a new product. The concept of money or dollars or coins or currency doesn’t exist here anymore, within the year 2081. Everyone must work on their land and grow food for meals. Everyone eats off their land crops and domestic barnyard stock. Everyone lives on their land, for protection. I live and work and play on my farm too. I get plenty of fun, sun, and honeys,” she turns and winks at Tulu. Tulu blushes in embarrassment with the reference to her and McCamy’s love relationship.
Wolf says with a puzzled brow to Taffy. “Well, I’m very suspicious of you now, Taffy. You know lots about a single canister of bite-nats paint. I didn’t know all information that you have kindly shared with me. So, why’s that, Taffy Pudding?” Taffy gasps in alarm and then looks down at the grass blades. He nods with a grin. “So, South Beach is the hot spot. You come from there. Hico is going to there. Based on my limited but valuable accumulated datum, a single canister or more canisters of bite-nats paint live there within South Beach also. We have survived as a nation of country people, after the last Nuke War. We have struggled as a nation of simple country people, after the last Nuke War. We do not possess any playtime or playmates or playing entertainment. I barely recalled the array of numerous television boxes that were colored in black, white, silver, pink, and red that stood around our household furniture pieces, in every room, even inside each lavatory bathroom. Each television box had contained another world, another galaxy, and another time and space which transported me and my brain cells for some fun harmless playtime entertainment. I barely remembered this. I used to watch with my dad a fast action sporting event called boxing. Two people beat the heck out of each other for fun and for money back then.”
“Gruesome!” Tulu comments then exhales with annoyance looking up at the blue sky while wishing to go back home to South Beach.
Wolf looks down at the grass and says with a smile. “The boxing event was great. The screen showed red blood, white teeth, bent bones, and a series of hanging skin flesh from each fighter. Pow! Crack! You could hear each bone snap away from the joint inside the face and across the body. My dad went crazy. His buddies came over to our house and then engaged in drinking, eating, cheering, yelling, and striking the air with both folded fists. Then when the guy finally died on the floor, my dad would commentate about the lame versus great hand-leg strategies for hours and then for days until the next boxing match. It was a physical and psychological rush of anticipation, excitement, and competition for each viewing spectator that provided only one winner and one loser. Pure entertainment! Humans are a breed of barbarians that descended down from the vile and vicious cave men and women, who had hunted down a herd of mouth drooling, Saber-toothed tigers for cloth, food, and fun,” he laughs with amusement then asks. “Don’t you see and understand all it now! Hico supplied the very same idea, within the Apprenticeship Program, through the dangerous and deadly dance competition theme show. We entertained all the watching, speaking and listening audience members, throughout the world, for the past three days and nights. I liked the blood and guts competition. I’m here and I’m alive and loving it, because I learned from my daddy to fight and to survive and to win. And I learned to dance from my sweet mama. I miss my mama!”

They uncover drilling equipment that creates a series of strange beeping noises digging down into each meadow, every water stream, and every crop field while looking for something special.

Nor Baycliff or Taffy can tattle back to their parents as they are only sixteen-year-old teenagers possessing both a vivid imagination and crazy wild ideas, who spend their unlimited free time more in playtime rather than study time.

So, they decide to use their school time to plot, their play time to plan, and their field time to employ the greatest majestic scheme to find a missing South Beacher girl Amita and uncover all the false facts.

Taffy feels smart, hopeful, and helpful.




Nine months ago, within the South Beach Colony, Baycliff continues to act depressed and feels sad regarding his missing girlfriend Amita and as he and Taffy continue to find and collect a set of handwritten letters coming from an alive and breathing Amita. Baycliff and Taffy uses both their sharp minds and tender hearts, together, figuring out each deceptive role, within her new majestic scheme, utilizing wicked humor, playfully banter, soft whispers, warm hands, and thoughtful gifts of stolen wild roses and stolen homemade cookies coming from his mother’s kitchen counter.

Taffy feels happiness and love.

She begins a new daydream pondering her deep mental thoughts.



Three months ago, within the South Beach Colony, Tulu is ordered to enter the Apprenticeship Program by her mother’s word and against the yelling voice on her sister Taffy.

Taffy tries to talk her mother out of that terrible decision; but she is not successful.

McCamy tries to sweet talk Tulu out of that terrible decision, also and he is not successful either.

So, with a heavy heart and a wicked mind, Taffy plots the majestic “death scene” at the fiery fissure site, on Ebro’s farm property, near the Birmingham Cliffs, the day before the Apprenticeship Program.

The deep underground fissure holds a hot and heated continuous fireball down inside the depths of its belly and is a freakingly natural phenomenon coming only from Mother Nature. After all the swarms of nuke dust particles and burning ashes were carried and then cleared away from the atmosphere and also the ground soil, from Nuclear War Three, in the year 2076, all the underground fiery fissions first formed and then foreverly stood, alone and scary, teasing each human and taunting every animal into a death day.

The South Beach location is famous for the numerous fiery features scattered throughout horizontal landscape on top of every flat, gray-tinted limestone cliff, except a pair of eyeballs cannot visually see the cool feature, without losing their eyesight and their earthly soul. Because, the entrance point is a vertical straight downward hard rock bottom, inside the fiery pit of hell, consisting of spewing plumes of boiling water, coming directly from the extremely warm Gulf of Mexico salt ocean waters.

Growing up, among the tall corn stalks, the short cows, and dangerous cliffs, Taffy learns and loves to rappel down 1,000 feet from the tabletop cliff and then enters each hole naturally curved out by Mother Nature located on the side of each cliff face. Taffy and her four childhood friends, consisting McCamy, Rusk, Baycliff, and Hixson are the best cliff climbers, within the South Beach Colony, since each one of their farm lands rests on top of the mountain peak, made of both beauty and danger.

Composed of both new and old guards, each one wears a silly bite-nats painted face mask consisting of either a gray tinted fly or a black tinted tick.

A tall, bronzed-beaten, South Beach farmer continues to stand beside his assigned student desk sneering at Hico, staring down at Hixson at the wall corner. He orders to Hico, “Release Hixson to me, Hico!”

Are you a horse spitting or a cow shitting image of your two sons?” He chuckles. “I never can properly recall my old southern axiom, Farmer Ebro.” Ebro continues to stand beside the student desk threating physical body damage, with a set of loud snarls, to Hico.
The solid wall erupts with an array of bright light in silver and white rows plus a sound of soft static activating the hidden electronic screen into power.
