Festus Farms
Northern portion, South Beach Colony
01:44 p.m.
Hot temperatures and sinking sun of pink, yellow and blue colors


Festus Farms paints a portrait of smooth brown valleys of soybeans swaying besides long fields of bright yellow hay. Miles of flat green pastures are dotted with tiny spots of colored white and black dairy and beef cows used for both numerous food meals and pairs of human walking shoes. Herds of colorful horses enjoy the fertile grass blades also. This crop farm is also a horse ranch providing only four-legged mammals for work, transportation, and pleasure to the good citizens of South Beach.
The ancient van, from Metro City Birmingham, driven by McCamy, arrives at Festus Farms property, two hours right before the stroke of Sun Block. Each teen swiftly exits the van and then dashes ahead inside the house cuddling up in the roomy living room setting. The living room setting is a very large space containing numerous dark-tinted wooden furniture pieces that does not match.
When the series of blue, yellow, red, and green laser beams started hitting down into the city of Huntsville, most of the residents were fired into a pile of dust bunnies by one or more radiation points or were severely injured and then left to die on top of the damaged street corner or on top of the burning floor within their destroyed home. A few of the luckier residents immediately fled the city and then ran away into the mountain peaks while seeking both body safety and shelter.
A handful of residents abandoned their fancy work job and their beautiful house escaping the city streets, before the deadly bombardment as each military aircraft was destroyed by an array of far-reaching nuclear missiles.
Apparently, the Festus family had been one of the earliest escapee farm families from the countryside of Huntsville allowing time to accumulate and then tote away their entire household possessions landing here first within the northern portion of the slowly-developing South Beach Colony. The previous farm homestead had worked then survived as a horse ranch, so the herd of horses had pulled numerous open wagons consisting of their worldly possessions here to South Beach territory, several years ago.
The rest of the fleeing farm families from the surrounding countryside of Huntsville had hauled the entire household possessions out also arriving and found both lands and people. The lands were completely occupied and also claimed. The people were completely mad and held numerous guns for body protection.
So, the other fleeing families either abandoned or toted away a few surviving possessions, reaching the end of the world, which had known as the Birmingham Cliffs. The Birmingham Cliffs are smooth flat large stone dropping off the landscape, down through the air waves, entering the warm, dangerous salt waters, which is still called, the Gulf of Mexico.
Taffy’s family had been one of the last fleeing families to leave the city of Huntsville and then settled within the southern portion of newly formed South Beach Colony, when she was a young toddler, without her baby sister, who was birthed within the new Colony.
Currently, at the Thelee household, all the household furnishings are worn, sparse, and ugly providing a bare existence for a family of four. Taffy has a separate bedroom from her sister Tulu displaying a flat mattress, without a bed frame, donating the ugly piece of furniture to her sister with sisterly love.
The Festus living room furniture setting consists of several long sofas, oversized sitting chairs, a few rocking chairs, three loveseats, all in some type of dark wood. Each piece of furniture is covered in a lovely throw blanket of numerous colors making the room cozy and warm, especially for a gang of fugitives, like McCamy, Taffy, Tulu, Baycliff, and Rusk.
Taffy sits on top of an oversized brown-tinted chair holding a thick pad of fabric that nicely cushions her boney fanny. The Thelee household furniture back home is hard and worn and ugly without a thick padding of fabric for her boney fanny. Across the back rest on her oversized chair, the throw blanket in the colors of green, orange, red, and blue feels both soft and warm. Across her legs, a second throw blanket in the colors of pink, purple, silver, and red colors feels both soft and warm too. Taffy is really confused within her neurons about the interior motions on sixteen years old, South Beach girl Pemona.
The house and the family of Pemona are both friendly and happy.
Normally, a sixteen-year-old teenage from South Beach desires to enter the Apprenticeship Program and hopefully become the winner and then escapes from the hard farming life.
Pemona does not look scarred or skinny like poor Amita. Pemona smiles with happiness and sits next to Rusk. They share one of the oversized comfortable chairs and also share a throw blanket in the colors of orange, gold, red, and yellow as she whispers into his face. Rusk whispers back with a smile into her face. Of course, Rusk is displaying that silly teenly action to make his girlfriend Taffy jealous.
Inside the living room, Amita narrates her year-long capture to each face while sitting next to her beau Baycliff. He tenderly cuddles her into his naked chest. She softly voices with a stern face. “Bright sunlight is bothersome to my sensitive eyes. After the dance competition, on the last day of the Apprenticeship Program, I was declared one of the numerous winners. Then all the winners were trotted off the dance floor and strolled down into a series of underground mines hidden underneath the honeysuckle vines, inside that Concrete Jungle. That term was used by Director Hico. The underground dirt mines are really abandoned old rocket silos used in the year 1960, for some type of outer space race program developed there within in the ancient city of Huntsville.”
He clears his throat as each pair of eyeballs turn to see Festus. The farmer displays a tall body frame with a suntanned and wrinkled face, a head of cropped brown-colored hair, and a pair of hazel eyes. He sits on the opposite side of the warm and cozy living room beside his wife nodding with a stern face to Amita. He states, “That’s correct! A silo is a gigantic vertical shaft, like a deep hole, dug by a powerful machine, about ninety years ago. Each hole goes down in the dirt, which is deep, round, and packed along the sides with hard rock and dense red clay dirt, once located up there in the abandoned city of Huntsville,” he shakes his brown skull. “There is not an exit door or an ascending ladder. There is not an easy escape from a silo hole, without some type of human intervention, by a man-to-man chain gang coming from bottom up towards the top of the surface or with the use of heavy stream driven equipment.”
Amita clears her dry throat and continues to wear the baseball cap over her sensitive eyes saying with a soft timber. “Hico, Vovina, Kodare, Doboil, and Starbe surrounded us like a set of security guards as all the winners were moved from the dance floor, after the last dance, on the sixth day of the Apprenticeship Program, heading to a smaller room along the side hallway. We changed from the bite-nats ball gown into these real work clothes. Then we were put to work by repairing those things like the one on your forward wall, Festus,” she points at the gigantic mounted electronic screen. The screen presents black hue, without power. She slaps her hand back into her lap. Baycliff reaches over and caresses her dirty hands, wearing his stern face.
She exhales a puff of relieve then states. “Down inside the silo, there were located thousands and millions of those broken electronic devices. My granny and I were immediately separated as a family unit for our individual work jobs, but we were brought together both tired and hungry for long periods of sleep, until the next shift of work. After a while, you couldn’t tell the difference from day to night. One person secretly owned a pocket watch which measured some type of day and night chronological time for us but eventually the air moisture overtook her delicate jewelry. I recognized all the girls from the previous Apprenticeship Programs along with their entire family members that consisted of mothers, dads, sisters, brothers, grandparents, cousins.
“Two of the girls and I would wander around our part of the Silo, after our work duty and during our resting hours looking for an escape route. Some wings were empty; while some wings held more work stations for more hours of electronic device repairs. Some wings were only living quarters with the short hard metal cots and folded clean blankets. You were assigned immediately to a specific living Silo, where I lived, ate my food meals, and slept there upon my assigned cot.
“I was also assigned into a working Silo, which separated the families into working units: children, teens, young adult, mature adults, and elderly adults. My granny worked in a different part of Silo until she…passed…” she slaps both of her palms over her open mouth starting to sob, producing her sad tears. Baycliff shuffles closer to her and hugs Amita wearing with a sad face too.
She exhales with sour bad breathes then drops both of her hands down into her lap saying with a stern face. “Her heart was too weak. I couldn’t escape either. Some folks tried over and over again. Of course, they experienced much failure and heartbreak, until Hico got mad and then tossed down, with his love, a basket of rattlesnakes into one particular Silo. You could hear the ear-piercingly screams, dying cries, loud curses, and shaking rattles on each snake, for hours, until all the biting snakes had killed every man, woman, and child,” she sobs with tears and then smiles at Taffy. “That finally maintained a long period of peace and productivity for the slaves that belonged to Director Hico.”
Baycliff leans down and whispers into her eardrum patting her folded hands, saying with a soft timber. “It’s over, honey bell!” He tenderly pecks her newly scrubbed cheekbone from the sweat, dirt, and grime and then pulls back with a stern face then views Festus, then Pemona, and finally Rusk. He declares with a nasty tone. “Hico, he’ll pay for his sins, by me.” Each teen nods in silent acceptance.
She presents a petite body frame and wears a head of black-grayish colored hair, a pair of brown eyes, and is the mother of Pemona. Almena slowly stands upright from the sofa beside her husband holding a bottle of blue-colored liquid over the skull on Wolf, saying with a smile. “Ya’ll are setting pretty in blue tint now. Don’t mess with the blue stuff! The blue stuff is scientifically labeled as povidone-iodine. It consists of a stable chemical, called polyvinylpyrrolidone, which is composed of twelve percent available blue iodine used on mammals…”
“Don’t show off, Mama!” Her youngest daughter Rari states with a frown turning to see her mother. She is fifteen years old possessing a petite body frame, a head of short black-colored hair, a pair of brown-tinted eyes. She turns and drops her chin blushing in embarrassment from her mother’s lecture towards the four cute and tall male teens.
Rusk nods and states to Almena. “Yes ma’am! We use the blue stuff product on all the shallow and deep lacerations that appear on each leg, kneecap, hock, and pastern on all of our horses too and sometimes one or two of the feisty bulls to prevent a spread of wicked infections also. One time, we disinfected a horse of thrush in the medial sulcus on her hoof,” he turns and smiles at his brother. “Do you remember that, McCamy?”
McCamy nods in silent agreement while cuddling his girl Tulu, playfully tickling her rib cage during the terrible narration from Amita. He wants to keep Tulu happy and not too sad about the bad past and upcoming future events, where both the teen cowboys and cowgirls of South Beach will face tomorrow against Director Hico.
Festus continues to sit and nodding back to Rusk. “Well, we offer good healing powers for your cuts and hot food for your stomach lining. Festus Farms will never let strays go hungry. Or we will never let nice folks go free, without aid and supplies. And especially, for the folks that brought our daughter back to us in one piece. Poor mamas and daddies are torn up after seeing on the electronic screen about their offspring. We would be too!” He reaches over and pats the arm on Pemona, who sits inside the oversized sitting chair beside Rusk. He holds back the manly sobs and associated manly tears feeling both joy and happiness, seeing his sixteen-year old girl, alive and well, except for a few visual bruises and a slight mild concession. He turns and smiles saying to his younger daughter. “Rari, can you please show our visited guests around our place, while your mama and I set a nice table for our welcomed and rare company?”
Rari swiftly stands from her chair and points towards the front porch doorway leading towards different areas on her farmland, including the pond, the barn, the meadows, and the playground. Each teen slowly stands upright from the furniture piece and follows behind Rari venturing into a part of Festus Farms.


***


At 02:14 p.m., at the pond water setting, the two paired love birds Tulu and McCamy veer away from Rari and then slowly stroll ahead as one human being. He cuddles her inside his chest which is covered in scattered splotches of blue tinted medicine and black tinted bruises, after fighting and then winning against Hico’s gang of barbaric heathens there at the Metro City Dance Hall.
Almena was a medical physician, before the Nuke War Three ended her medical career in Huntsville. Now, she doctors and treats all the battered and beaten teens insisting that each wound not be bandaged but breath fresh air molecules as each wounded teen need to eat lots of food and rest for the evening hours.
They stop and then slide down sitting on top of the wet bank, in front of the fresh water pond.
McCamy tucks Tulu inside his chest as each pair of naked feet splash down into the cool water.
Tulu sobs, without the yucky clear mucus, and leans into his colorful chest staring at the soft rippling smooth waves, saying with meek voice. “I’m so sorry, McCamy. I’m the cause of this entire ugly mess. I wanted to attend that stupid Apprenticeship Program. I’m so selfish and greedy. Please, forgive me!”
He leans over and places his cheekbone on top of her sweet-smelling honeysuckle, black colored hair, smiling with a soft hum, “Ah, muffin!”
She pulls back and wipes off her running snot using her dirty hand, looking up with a stern face to see his smile. She says, “I want you to hear this all. Okay!” He leans over and then gently kisses her forehead pulling back with a smile. She exhales with relief and disappointment telling her story. “I’m so selfish. I love you, so much, and want great things for us. Great things ain’t great, without you, McCamy. I learned that! Me and my heart, and my soul missed you, so much, when…” she sobs with tears of heartache and then frowns. “I thought you dead, inside that fiery fusion, foreverly, without me,” she reaches over and then pinches his chest wearing a stern face, still producing her rolling tears and running snot.
“Ouch!” He states then sniggers at her tiny bite on his hard chest. She slaps his chest next. He sniggers for fun again.
She exhales with worry then says. “Now, I find out, that it was all not true.”
He leans over and tenderly kisses her lips pulling back, singing with a smile, “Ah, muffin.”
She exhales with another puff of worry then states. “Then I had traveled all the way to Metro City Birmingham heart broken and alone while thinking…” She gasps in alert then turns his face saying with a stern look. “You…you danced with me the first night, didn’t you?”
He leans over and tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with his smile, “Ah, muffin.”
“I was so confused. I would have never guessed the dancer was you. When I touched your hands, I thought of you. But my brain cells had accepted the other fact. You warty-toad, you should’ve signaled me. Or you should have kissed me. I know your sweet kisses.”
He leans over and tenderly kisses her lips pulling back, singing with his smile, “Ah, muffin.”
She frowns then states. “O! I guess, that would’ve been bad for us. You and Taffy would’ve been discovered by Hico earlier. Well, I forgive both of you’ll, since you’ll are here alive and well with me.”
He leans over and then tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with a smile, “Ah, muffin.”
She gasps in shock then states with a stern face, “But you didn’t dance with me the second night. I could tell. It’s wasn’t Rusk either. You’ll are twins but different. I can tell you’ll apart. No one else can but me.”
He leans over and tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with a smile, “Ah, muffin.”
“Nor was it Hixson, so that leaves Baycliff,” she giggles with a silly grin, “Figures! That boy is…”
“Is what, muffin?” He yells then growls with jealous at his childhood friend.
“Well, he tried…”
“He tried to do what, muffin?” He shouts then snarls with harm towards Baycliff.
She laughs out loud then states with a smile. “You gave him a set of instructions, for me, during the dance, didn’t you?” He nods in silence. Tulu says with a smile. “Well, he failed pitifully. He’s not you. You definitely aren’t him, but you’re my warty-toad.”
He leans over and tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with a smile, “Ah, muffin.”
“When you dropped out of the baby blue skies on that second night of the Apprenticeship Program, wearing your silly red chicken lips…” she laughs. “It was a good thing that you toted me out that secret back door underneath the basement space, because I was about to faint. I thought I was seeing my guardian angel, who was also named McCamy and who had ascended from the planet and then came back down from heaven to protect me.”
He leans over and tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with a smile, “Ah, muffin.”
She exhales with a puff of worry then states. “You were there alive and breathing carrying me in your strong arms out the back door with Hixson as the scout. I love you, McCamy. Did I mention that lately?” Tulu smiles.
He leans over and tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with a smile, “Ah, muffin.”
“We almost made it, if not for the two dance judges of Ant and Wasp. Isn’t that right, McCamy? They appeared both nice and friendly at first and then presented a bite-nats flash blade first and then their shotgun barrel second in our faces, in front of my mom and dad. My daddy was mad. My mama was crying. I felt bad for my parents. Then they hauled us down into that tiny jail cell. I thought Hixson would bust that glass window pane out from the frame.” Tulu laughs. McCamy laughs with a head nod.
She grins then states. “Well, he would have, if not for the lack of trying and trying and trying…” Tulu exhales with worry. “Do you think my parents…?”
He leans over and tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with a smile, “Ah, muffin.”
She states with a worried brow. “Hico won’t harm them, ain’t that right? He only wants bite-nats, isn’t that correct? He told us so. I believe him. Don’t you believe Hico, McCamy?”
He leans over and tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with a smile, “Ah, muffin.”
She nods. “My daddy will give him all of these rusty paint cans of bite-nats, if he knew where the cans were hidden. Everyone would do that also to save their kids and their souls and their farms, isn’t that right, McCamy?”
He leans over and tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with his smile, “Ah, muffin.”
“I fear for us and Taffy and our parents. Wonder if, Hico wants more or something else than all the cans of bite-nats. Then what’s going to happen there at South Beach, McCamy?”
He leans over and then tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with his smile, “Ah, muffin.”
“There! I confessed it all out of my brain cells. The best confession of all times is that I love you, McCamy, foreverly. I wanna stay there in the South Beach Colony, foreverly, only with you,” she smiles and states with a nod. “Okay! It’s your turn, warty toad.”
He leans over and then tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with a smile, “Ah, muffin. I love you, too. I worry about your little body and big brain, all the time. Now, I don’t lie, when I tattle that Taffy plotted out that brilliant plan. But I confess to you that I liked it. I helped it. I participated in it to get you back home. Dang! I wanted to kidnap you on that first day of the Apprenticeship Program and then drag your pretty fanny back home, where we can be together foreverly there in South Beach. I love you, Tulu.” McCamy leans over and tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with a smile, “Ah, muffin.”
“My warty-toad,” she smiles.
He shakes his bone skull saying with a stern face, “I didn’t believe Taffy, at first. Then, I found out on the second night of the Apprenticeship Program that Baycliff had tricked all of us into searching for his lost love Amita. His girlfriend Amita always was a stubborn and foolish-minded female. Now, that’s my point of view. Amita high-tailed it out of South Beach leaving her beau Baycliff both high and dry on top of that flat rock at the Birmingham Cliffs, wanting to become the next new Apprentice for Dictator Hico. Baycliff was hurt, acted it, looked it, and talked it. Don’t understand that girl!” He shakes his cropped blonde hair strands again. “But hey! She belongs to Baycliff, not me. I got you, babe!” He leans over and hugs her, so tight, that Tulu gasps for air. He doesn’t want to release Tulu for fear of losing her again. He pulls back with a smile and then leans over, tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back. He sings with his smile, “Ah, muffin.”
She giggles then says. “I got my warty-toad too.”
He exhales with a huff of worry then states. “Yeah, Hixson and I stormed out from the dance contest feeling mad, angry and used. I’m ashamed that I only thought of you, selfishly. That’s why Hixson and I left the competition, before the start of the dancing, after visiting Kodare and threatening to beat his butthole,” McCamy laughs with a wicked grin. “Kodare, he was scared shitless. He paid Hixon and me good too. I got all these gold nuggets stuffed down in my pockets, muffin.
“Always, Taffy told, well, she suspected that Hico was guilty of more than running that silly dance contest. She was right, muffin! Taffy’s smart! Taffy’s tough! Taffy pursued in finding a misplaced Amita. I’m glad that she found Amita and all the other lost South Beachers.”
Tulu starts to sob producing a flowing line of sad tears for all the missing and dead South Beachers.
McCamy states with a worried brow. “I saw you watching that dance competition, on that new electronic screen, when we were penned, like a herd of farm hogs inside Hico’s pretend prison. You looked real sad about those other teens that died that night.”
She continues to sob with tears of sadness.
He says. “That was not our doing, that involved the deaths of all those teens. Do you understand me, Tulu?”
She nods with sobs and tears in silence.
He shares. “That was Hico, Kodare, and Vovina doings. They harmed all these teens. They’re going to pay for it too. I swear working with Baycliff, Rusk, and Hixson as we meet Hico and his vile staff members on top of the Birmingham Cliffs. They’re going to pay for harming all of these teens and their parents. Don’t worry about Tourann and Thelee! Hixson is with them now. Did you see how I sweet-talked Hico into taking Hixson and leaving us behind at Metro City Birmingham?” He chuckles then says. “I did that, because I couldn’t stand to see you leave me, again. Please, don’t ever leave mem again. Okay, muffin?”
She nods with her sobs then present her smile and her tears to him.
He leans over and then tenderly kisses her lips, pulling back, singing with his smile, “Ah, muffin.”
“My warty-toad,” she croaks out the word and wears her smile of happiness between her tears of sadness.
“Ah, muffin! The next few days are going to be dangerous for us, especially Taffy. But don’t worry here, muffin! We’re smart. We work together, good, like a farm team of draft horses, including Taffy, Baycliff, Rusk, Hixson, me, and even that good old boy Wolf-man. He’s smart with that electronic device. Amita looks pitifully weak and sick. Let’s not count her on our horse team just yet. But we got Pemona and her family members that all hate Hico too and is happy that we saved her fanny also.” He leans down and hugs her petite body closing his two eyelids and plants his skull down on top of her sweet-smelling hair of honeysuckles. He exhales with love pulling back with a series of soft chuckle, pointing at the delicate object flying over both of their skulls. He asks, “Do you see the pair of flying yellow colored butterflies, muffin?” She turns and smiles at the butterflies in silence.
McCamy nods and states with a smile. “A pair of flying butterflies is an ancient sign of love between a boy and a girl. That’s me and you foreverly, muffin!” Tulu returns back and kisses his lips with her undying love.


***


At 02:24 p.m., at the horse barn location, Baycliff separates from a talkative Rari and then leads Amita by the hand a few paces north towards a new structure, in the color of dull red, the horse barn.
He stops then opens one of the closed wooden doors for Amita venturing inside ahead of her. He strolls towards one of the hay stacks and brushes off the tiny seedlings from a wooden bench that leans against the barn wall, pointing down at the semi-clean wooden seat.
Amita stands upright inside the open archway and still wears her dirty cap blocking the dull sunlight from her two sensitive eyes, wearing a sour frown and then slowly strolls ahead. She hears the short neighs from the standing horses inside each barn stall as the steeds finish their dinner meal. She stops and parks both of her fists on her tiny waist, saying with a sour tone. “Why are we parked in here inside a horse barn, Baycliff?”
He smiles and continues to point down at the wooden seat. “This will give us some private time from the other teens, honey bell. I really don’t wanna be near the others,” he slides sitting on top of the hard bench and reaches out patting the empty spot next to him.
“You mean, you don’t want Taffy to hear our private conversation. Is that right, Baycliff?” She states with a sour frown then exhales with annoyance.
“Naw! I don’t want any of the other cowboys and cowgirls here with us, only just us. This is my private time with you, before our bedtime, honey bell,” he continues to smile patting the empty spot next to him.
She tosses her baseball cap off and reveals her bald hair, without hair strands. Baycliff gasps in shock. She cocks her chin and states with a sour frown to him. “Is anything wrong here, boy?”
He fakes a smile and states at her new appearance, “Naw! Come and sit with me, here on the bench, honey bell!”
She moves ahead and sits close to Baycliff saying with a stern face. “I’m sorry. I thought of you every day and night while wondering if you had known what had happened to me there in Metro City Birmingham. I had accepted all of the consequences for all my actions last year, until now this moment. Now, I’m here with you. I can’t believe, it’s really finally over for me,” she exhales with relief. “I have waited and watched for one…” she exhales again. “I meant, I had watched my new friends struggle for food, work, and respect. Then, I lost my granny. She couldn’t take the confinement and closet-feeling situation that stopped her pumping heart.”
She exhales with anger then states with fury. “I can’t believe that you let me go so easily, Baycliff!”
“Honey bell!” He states in frustration gasping in shock, leaning over and tries to hug her skinny body.
She slides backwards from his warm hug and says with a stern face. “I’m sorry. I’m difficult here, within my mind, body, and soul. I wanted to see something new and different besides another South Beach farm, farming crops, and all the stinky farm animals. That’s all! I still respect you. You came looking for me. I can’t believe that you did that. Thank you for coming to my rescue! You’re my hero!”
“Honey bell!” He states with confusion gasping in alert, leaning over and tries to hug her body again.
She scoots away from him and says with a sour frown. “Yes, I had lots of time to think, when not working on those electronic devices, eating my limited amounts of food, pooping in the dirt, like an animal, and sleeping in the small hard cot, like a soldier. I hoped I could tell you how much I loved and missed you. But I’m still stunned, shocked, and surprised that you came to my rescue. This moment is incredible for me. How on Planet Earth did you know where to find me? I mean, I, and the other missing South Beach girls, have been living there, since last...” she frowns. “What’s the date of today? I have no idea what day of week it is. How silly of me!”
“Honey bell!” He states with shock and leans over trying to hug her body.
She slides backwards from his warm hug and states with a stern face. “Today is Saturday!”
He gasps in shock then asks. “How did you know that?”
She shouts and wears a sour frown. “I am not the stupid one here, like another person believes. I can keep track of time and the date without a watch or a calendar…”
“Honey bell!” He states in shock and leans over, trying to hug her.
She slides backwards from his warm hug and says a stern face. “Every Saturday, I used to sleep late in my bed then eat a large breakfast plate of eggs, bacon, grits, biscuits, and home-made cinnamon rolls. Then I would drive that broken down farm tractor around the crop fields plowing or planting or harvesting foods of something. There’s always something to do on a cow and corn farm. When I finished my farm chores, I drove the old tractor straight down into the cool water pond, scaring all the bathing geese and floating swans into flying for cover,” she laughs with an evil tone then states with wicked grin. “O! I miss those days.”
“Honey bell!” He states in shock and leans over trying to hug her.
She slides backwards from his hug and states with a stern face. “You found me! I’m so happy, that you found me. I’m home, well, almost. When are we leaving out from here? I don’t like that girl Pemona or her nosy family. We should leave right now. There’s some dull sunlight left, before Sun Block time. We could have been home already, if we didn’t have to stop here and drop off that girl. Pemona is not part of our farmer group, is she? Rusk seems to like her body or her personality. I thought Rusk was crazy for someone else. Wow! I have missed a lot of stuff. I want to go home right now,” she looks down studying his chest, saying with a worried brow. “Do you feel hurt? Your wounds are a bunch of funny-looking blue-tinted colors from that medical iodine that Almena used as a poor substitute for good medications. That blue stuff doesn’t wash off but has to wear off from the naked skin. I guess, it helps the wounds heal faster. Are your wounds healing faster?” Amita laughs with an evil tone.
“Honey bell!” He states in shock then leans over trying to hug her. She slides backwards from his hug and wears a stern face. He frowns with worry. She needs to relax and enjoy their special private time together, before they are required to return back to the Festus household, for the evening hours. Tomorrow, the gang will travel into the southern portion of the South Beach Colony and pay an unfriendly visit to Hico.
She exhales with a puff of relief and states with her meek voice. “Her mother is nice and friendly. I guess. Her mother helped with your body wounds. So, she is okay. But I do not like Wolf or Wolf-man or Wolf-boy. He’s one of the Riders that came from the North Ridge Mountain Colony. Isn’t he a Rider? Yes, he is. Why am I hanging with a Rider, Baycliff? They do not like me. They want me dead and death and done, like slammed roadkill. Wolf-person needs to go too. Wolf-boy needs to go back home to his tall mountains, where he belongs, not here with me. Wolf-boy is going to cause me lots of trouble. If Hico sees him…”
“Honey bell!” He states with alarm and starts to lean over trying to hug her. She slides backwards from his warm hug and wears a stern face. Baycliff leans back into the hard back rest and tosses both of his arms in the air, wearing a stern face. He slaps both of his hands down on top of his dirty blue jeans producing a plume of green and yellow flower dust, stating with a firm tone. “Wolf-man, he’s part of our teen group now. Our teen group is against both Hico and Kodare, and all the unwelcomed others that have invaded our home in South Beach and might harm our family members, farm neighbors, and friends. So, we all will go and protect everyone there, tomorrow morning. Second, he saved your life.”
She gasps in shock then states with a stern face. “No! You saved my life! I saw your face first. I saw you drop down the ladder steps and then stomp on the dirt clay, inside my Silo. I recognized only you and then I recognized snot-hole McCamy. I never liked McCamy, just like I don’t like Taffy. They go well together,” she frowns. “So, how did you know where to find me?”
He reaches down and scratches his exposed chest muscles itching from his healing wounds and the hard coated patches of blue tinted iodine saying with a stern face. “Honey bell!”
“How did you know, where to find me? I can’t believe that you found me, after one year.”
He says. “Taffy, she’s the real treasure hunter here. I give her all the credit and all the brains here. Taffy came up with a plot to spy on both Hico and Vovina. Vovina is our Superintendent there in South Beach. Taffy figured out that Vovina was part of the plan, that misplaced you. Taffy concluded that all South Beachers were missing…”
“Taffy!” She yells then performs her lady growl at the name. “The one and only Taffy from Thelee Farms, she found me, not you. I don’t understand any of this. How in the universe did she know where to find me? Where you didn’t or couldn’t or wouldn’t? You told me that you figured out where I was at. Is that a lie? Are you fibbing to me again? I mean, after all we’ve been through and then separated for the past year, Baycliff.”
“Honey bell!” He states in shock then gasps in worry, “Naw! No! I’m not lying to you. Taffy is smart, like you. She talked to our neighbors and gathered all the secret information about the Apprenticeship Program and all the missing South Beach girls. Then our childhood friends consisting of McCamy, Rusk, Hixson, Taffy and I left our home in South Beach and then traveled up there to Metro City Birmingham staying inside an underground root cellar, inside the Dance Hall, right below the Dance Hall’s dance platform and right underneath the butthole of Hico. We all were searching for you, honey bell. Then we found you hidden inside that underground Silo,” Baycliff smiles with a nod of happiness.
She rolls her two eyeballs and then looks back at him, saying with a stern face. “You found me. I’m so grateful. Yes, Taffy is too smart for her own good. And I recalled clearly that Taffy gave Hico a loose bouquet of purple bull thistles which were weeds that came from her daddy’s corn fields. The sharp prickles pricked and then bleed his hand into red blood. Hico cursed all the way back to Metro City Birmingham inside our transport that day,” she laughs with an evil tone saying with wicked a grin and a head nod. “Hico sworn, on his mama’s grave, to get that teen girl back some day,” Amita claps with delight and laughs with happiness.
He sneers first then states with a nasty tone. “Is that a body threat on Taffy, by Hico? Well, I guess he has threatened Taffy and the rest of us, including my daddy. If Hico is up there, messing things up around in South Beach, then my daddy is not happy, and either is Rusk’s or Taffy’s or Hixson’s daddy. Hixson is getting company tomorrow. McCamy says, we leave tomorrow morning, after Sun Block…”
“Why is McCamy the Leader of Pack here?” Amita askes then sneers at the remark slamming her finger into his chest, “You should lead us victoriously back home to South Beach. You’re smarter than McCamy. He’s a smart-hole. I never liked him. He’s only nice to Tulu, Taffy’s younger sister. Tulu is nice, not a snot-hole, like McCamy and her smart-hole older sister Taffy. They are two of a kind, within the same plantation pea pod. They should be together as a loving couple, since they think alike and boss alike. Nobody likes them. Even Hico didn’t pick Taffy for that malice move she pulled, did he? He picked me,” she slaps her chest and nods with a grin. “I guess, I should thank…” she gasps in alarm. “No! I should not thank, but faint. Taffy caused all of mess to happen to me!”
“Honey bell!” He states in shock and starts to lean over trying to hug her.
She slides backwards from his warm hug and states with a stern face. “No more honey on me, boy! Hico only selected the smart Apprentices. If Taffy hadn’t played that slick step, then she would have traveled with Hico to Metro City Birmingham. Then she would have competed in the dance competition. Then she would have been imprisoned inside that dark, damp, and dank Silo, within the ancient city, that had been called Huntsville, for a year, instead of me. I can’t believe, she did this to me. I was her best friend in South Beach. Now, I know. I learn. I see. I am her stupid pawn. I can prove it.” Amita points her arm towards the ceiling and says with a nod and a stern face. “Hico has ordered Taffy arrested for killing all of the teens.”
He yells. “What?” Baycliff gasps in worry and shakes his bone skull at Amita.
“Yes, Taffy is the newest fugitive from the law.”
He laughs out loud then calms states with a smile slapping his chest. “Well then, Taffy and Rusk and I are also three fugitives from the law as we also killed some of the dance teens. But these teens were trying to kill us first.”
She gasps in alarm then asks. “Why am I hanging with a fugitive then? The fugitives from the law authorities will invite trouble for me. Taffy is trouble for me. I wanna leave right now. I mean, whether you’re healed or not. I don’t want trouble for me here.”
“Honey bell!” He states in shock and starts to lean over trying to hug her.
She stands upright from the hard bench and announces with a stern face. “Do not call me, honey bell, again! Taffy conned me and swindled you into her side picture show. I can’t believe this. You almost got killed from those nasty games that had been plotted by Taffy. She is an evil doer and sly like a fox. She is heading heads over her high heels into major trouble and taking me up and down that roller coaster with her. Just look at your war wounds covering your chest and abdomen from her fight at that dance. Or I will say that death competition having to protect your precious self. Taffy should have protected you, instead of killing all of those poor helpless teens. Where were McCamy, Rusk, and Hixson, your so-called friends? I can tell you. They were running, like a pack of scary doggies away from their mama, tinkling on their hind legs as it runs down into the grass.” She stomps both of her naked feet and says with a sour frown. “We will leave tomorrow, without the other cowboys and cowgirls. We take Hico’s transport and ride it back home to South Beach, especially, without the presence of Taffy Pudding. She is major trouble for me. I hate Taffy Pudding,” she spins around with a worried brow and dashes ahead racing through the old archway into the fading sunlight, from a long day, without the hat or a baseball cap.
“Honey bell!” He yells standing upright from the bench, chasing after her, moving through the open archway then halts a few feet over the manicured grass. He smiles seeing a swarm of yellow, blue, red, green, pink, white, and black colored butterflies. The butterflies gently land then cover both of her two bend arms, both of her collar bones, and her bald mound in beauty.
He paces towards her gently lifting his hand in the air. Each butterfly flies off her posed body. His hand slams down on his dirty blue jeans creating more green and yellow tinted dust particles, “Butterflies are attracted to the salt in your sweat that provides sodium for their body. That’s all! The butterfly dates back to Mid-Eocene Epoch here on Planet Earth, between fifty million years ago. They travel in swarms over a great distance for the breeding season. A butterfly has four wings that are covered with tiny scales. The fore and hind wings are not hooked together which create their free floating graceful flight using all six of their legs…”
“I hate bugs!” Amita shouts in fury and wears a sour frown dashing ahead towards the main farm house, during the fading sunlight, which is close to Sun Block.
Baycliff slowly moves ahead and talks to her back spine. “A single butterfly symbols one person’s fleeing soul. A large number of butterflies are viewed as a bad omen. Yeah, I believe that myth, like I believe Taffy is a murderess. Honey bell!” He yells out loud and races ahead towards the house while chuckling with delight at his girl.

At 02:33 p.m., at the playground location, in front of a tire swing setting, the two teens, Pemona and Rusk slowly stroll hand-in-hand towards the pretty woodland setting.
She stops and points with his smile then says at the fun object. “That’s called a tire swing. Have you ever seen one?” Rusk chuckles at the familiar object. Pemona reaches over and slaps his blue-tinted, wounded, naked chest explaining the object. “It’s called a rubber tire, that was used, before Nuke War Three, on moving cars and trucks, flying airplanes, and the like, to boot. My daddy taught me. He teaches us a lot, since the local School House doesn’t educate the students properly per my dad,” she reaches out and grabs stopping the motion of the large black tinted rubber tire, saying with a smile. “Hop on!”
He explains to her. “We use sets of big rubber tires, almost five feet tall, on some of our terrain tractors driving inside the deeper fields, that lasts a good bit longer than those iron rusty spokes,” Rusk places both of his palms on the hard rubber and then leaps landing his butthole down inside the curved deep opening, fumbling both of his legs around the encircled rubber, until his body is securely attached to the swing. He points down into his lap and winks to her.
She shakes her long brown curls and says, “I best not! If I vomit up green puke on top of the dinner table tonight, then my mother will know that we have been close dancing or something. She is the current medical doctor here among the farmers and she knows all about that stuff and she watches over her two baby chicks, to boot.”
He chuckles then states. “That’s a very good observation for the day! But I can cure you by tomorrow. Do you believe me?” She winks at him in silence. Rusk slowly spins the tire swing around and surveys miles of the open terrain on Festus Farms stating with a nice tone. “Your farm is pretty here. I like it. Your farm is different but sorta like my farm.”
She slowly strolls around the tire swing with him and surveys the landscape, also, then states. “You told me, all about your farm, that’s located on top of the rocky limestone cliffs, where we will drive inside the rear compartment of the van tomorrow morning, right after Sun Block. I guess, a farm here in South Beach possesses the same landscape of yellow corn stalks, white cotton fields, and lots of black and white cows that stand in the pasture lands grazing quiet and mellow,” she returns back and smiles at Rusk. “A herd of cows are quiet and mellow with tender feelings and non-book smarts. However, you’re different from your twin brother. I guess, you hear that a lot as a twin of two brothers. He’s not very friendly and bossy, to boot.”
He exhales with a nod and states with a firm voice. “Do not ever cross McCamy! He will dislike you even lesser than before. He came out first. My mama always joked to me that he was my protector. He fulfills that role very seriously too.”
She leans against the tree bark and watches the tire spin around in a long circle saying to Rusk. “That’s so nice! Rochelle is the baby too but kind of sissy and really nosy, to boot. Ugh! She saw us on the electronic television screen last night and has been asking me a ton of nosy questions about the Apprenticeship Program and my part of the fights. I still can see each teen, who continued to wear their mask of death. I can’t stop the images. Do you see the dead teens also?”
“Before last night, I never have killed a person, lots of animals, including some sick livestock on my farm and hunting the wildlife around the woods. I have never killed a real person. I don’t think about it during the heat of bloody battle. You live or die! You die or live! I wanna live. That’s all!”
She looks up with a stern face and views the fading sun. “Just live, I like that, too,” she looks down and smiles at Rusk. “That’s all, to boot.” She tries to store her last bad memories from the Apprenticeship Program involving a dead Brazoria deep down within her sub-consciousness.
He slides off the tire swing and reaches out, grabbing her hand, saying. “Yeah, I like it here. You got lots of fun stuff,” he reaches out with his other hand and shoves the tire swing in a circle. The tire swing rotates around alone. Rusk and Pemona slowly stroll by hand-and-hand, moving ahead towards a wooden picnic table, that he had seen in an ancient picture book. “You got a tire swing, a wicked metal body slide, two kiddie swings, and a long and sturdy wooden table for a picnic meal. We could eat our meals here in the mornings or at nights, after the Sun Block event. My farm doesn’t have all of these fun things, only cotton, cows, and corn, maybe some cats and bears. Do you like bears?” He spins around then sits down on top of picnic table surface, wearing a smile, parting his legs.
She moves ahead, stops, and stands in-between his parted kneecaps, saying with a smile. “I do not think, I’ve ever met a bear. Are they friendly?”
He rubs both of her arms slowly moving up each one of his arms towards her collar bone, wearing a smile. A single fluttering red and pink colored butterfly starts to land and then perches on top of his collar bone. He draws her into his smile and says with a whisper. “Yeah, a bear is very friendly and very cute, to boot.”
“I like cute. I heard they like sweets, to boot.” She states then reaches out shooing away the single butterfly from his collar bone, shifting both of her hands over his naked chest, rubbing the smooth skin. She softly giggles.
Rusk leans down and says with a smile into her face. “The bears and I both like something sweet, to boot.” Pemona leans over and kisses his soft lips for a long time.

At 02:37 p.m., within the vast backyard behind the main farm house, Wolf slowly strolls ahead through the patch of pretty flowers and reaches down feeling each soft petal between his calloused finger pad while admiring the beautiful yellow flora.
Rari moves beside him and points at each flower then says. “That row of flowers is called tulips. They keep bugs away from the garden vegetables.”
“I really prefer the color of red.” He states turning to wink at Taffy.
Taffy stands in the same row and watches Wolf then snorts with amusement, recalling his vocal death threat to Hico. She swirls around and sits down within a row of rusty iron chairs that creates a sitting scene a few feet from the back porch, underneath a grove of shade trees lie near the flower and vegetable gardens. “Thanks! I think!” Taffy states then snorts wearing a wicked grin.

Taffy sips then swallows the cool beverage. She states. “Actually, Wolf-man, he saved your sister Pemona from one of the un-friends.”
Rari looks down and states with a sad face to the grass blades. “I saw it. We saw the dance competition last night. My daddy won’t allow me to view the screen, this morning, when we saw that Pemona had un-masked last night,” she looks up with a worried brow to see Taffy. “I can’t ask my parents. They’ll freak out. What was like to kill?” She views Taffy then Wolf.
Wolf gasps in shock and then states with a stern face to Rochelle. “Kill or be killed! That’s an old axiom that my daddy taught to me, when I was a little cub. Yeah, I sliced and diced my steel flash blades made of bite-nats paint into all the boney chests, fleshy hearts, and moisture eyeballs. It was not pretty. It was a survival instinct. That kicks in during any deadly dangerous dilemma…”

My legs, my fingers, and my heart were shaking the entire time. I couldn’t run. I couldn’t hide. But I could fight for my right to breathe and see Sun Block, the next day.”
Rari gasps in shock then asks with a meek voice. “Do you think I…I might have to fight to breathe to see Sun Block, the next day, Taffy?”
“No!” Taffy firmly says then gasps in horror at the terrible image presenting a sweet smile. “No! You will absolutely not be in that situation, Rari!”
Wolf looks up and says with a frown to Taffy. “You don’t know what’s going to happen next for us, Taffy. We all might have to…”
Taffy swiftly stands upright from the chair and then preforms a lady growl to Wolf, holding the cold beverage, without tossing the liquid in his face. She says with a smile into his silly face of red-tinted bite-nats paint. “No! I said no! We’re smart, smarter than Hico. We’ll figure another way to rid him from South Beach and then return our farm lands back to us. Our parents…”
“…have been kidnapped and carried out from Metro City Birmingham and are currently held hostages by Hico, in South Beach, if McCamy’s facts are correct. That means, we all have to fight to get them out of there…”
“Wolf-man!” Festus shouts and stands on top of the back porch slab waving both of his arms in the air, moving ahead into the flower garden. Wolf swiftly stands from the chair experiencing worry. One hour later….

At 04:05 p.m., after the suppertime meal, among the hot air temperatures, with rays of sizzling sunlight, standing inside the living room setting, Wolf squats down and hides behind the mounted television devise rigging the power wires into the wall, standing upright from the floor. He back steps from the screen and the wall standing beside Festus, clapping with a grin, nodding several times. He announces, “I fixed it, sir. Now, everyone, watch the screen!” He presses a button on the remote control devise and says with a smile. “We’re getting a live-action feed coming from Hico, who is staying in the southern portion of South Beach.”
“Sit down, everyone! Let’s see what Hico has planned for tonight’s events.” Festus shouts to the teens then shuffles ahead from the kitchen space sitting in the shared love seat with his wife Almena. Each teen finds a new seat or shares a seat, with their mate, sitting and watches the screen.
Tulu cuddles with McCamy inside a shared oversized chair, near the row of glass windows.
Amita and Baycliff sit side by side, holding hands on top of a long sofa, in front of entrance wall.
Rusk and Pemona sit inside a pair of separate oversized chairs, holding hands together over the floor space as her father Festus watches Rusk with one eyeball on the male teen and the other eyeball on the television screen.

Taffy moves ahead from the kitchen space and selects a rocking chair, sitting down, slowly rocking back and forth. She feels isolated, lonely, and sad, without her own boyfriend. She glances at Rusk, who tickles the fingers on Pemona. Then the ancient curved legs on the rocking chair sound with a squeaking of wooden pain. Each pair of eyeballs turns to see Taffy. She slaps both of her naked feet down on the wooden floor, stopping the motion, staring at the rows of silver and gray static on the television screen.
In the early morning hours, on top of Earth’s surface, from the time period of 06:00 a.m. until 08:00 a.m., a person sees a dark black skyline, much like, during the nighttime hours, when a person sleeps for rest inside a bed mattress. Then, like a sack of oven popcorn colonels, at precisely 07:59 a.m., the Sun Block event swiftly burns away the dark matter in atmosphere, making the air wave pop and sizzle from the heated light. Then the rays of heated sunshine glows brightly down burning each crop fields with hot temperature, signaling people to their daily work chores, starting at 08:01 a.m. until 05:59 p.m. at dusk.
The time of dusk resets the Sun Block event presenting another dark matter field, within Earth’s atmosphere, exactly at 06:00 p.m., in the evening, every day.
On the electronic television screen, inside the living room, on Festus Farms, the sky is painted in black hue with an occasion white-tinted strike of heat lighting that dashes across the darkness. The moon is full beaming down bright rays of white hue. Each individual bright star twinkles down over the calm waters and the flat landscape coming from a far distance, within the vast outer space environment.
The center screen displays a square-shaped object covered in streaks and strikes of numerous colors consisting of purple, blue, red, green, orange, pink, and yellow. In the middle of the square object, there is a red painted wooden door leading into a new environment.
In front of the door, Director Hico wears a blue and white-colored, checkered-patterned, long sleeved shirt and a pair of dark colored blue jeans, standing on top of an elevated wooden platform that raises four feet above the ground soil as a new gigantic television screen stands behind Hico.
The screen displays numerous visitors to South Beach, who can hear and see Hico also. The mounted screen slowly rotates around on top of a thick pole as Hico controls the motion with his remote control devise.
Hico wears a cropped head of brown-tinted hair and waves his arm in the air, saying with a smile and a pair violet-colored dancing eyeballs, “I have enjoyed my dinner of fried chicken, buttered mashed potatoes, hot home-made biscuits, and a piece of sweet pecan pie.”
The audience is comprised of numerous other Colonists coming from Grand Rock Valley, North Ridge Mountain, and Swamp Island. Numerous semi-crooked rows of visiting Colonists move around or sit down or stand beside their family members or friends. Each one is either eating or clapping with the other Colonists.
Inside the living room, at Festus Farms, Baycliff states with a confused brow to the screen. “Where’s Hico located at? I can’t tell from the angle of the screen. Its nighttime there at our home also.”
Rusk sneers and points at the screen saying with a nasty timber. “Hico is located in front of our School House. He and his stupid guards have constructed an elevated platform right in front of the red-tinted front door and the row of glass windows. I guess, they covered the windows for some reason with thick wooden boards that matches the colorful paint on the exterior rock walls of our School House. Or they broke out the glass windows and then covered them for some reason. And they also moved the front door. Why do you move a front door? It, now, stands directly behind Hico, which is also four feet above the ground. What’s he doing out there? We should leave now and surprise Hico, Bandits!”
“No!” Taffy yells. “We stay here and watch first. Then we leave tomorrow morning, right after Sun Block.” She continues to sit in the rocking chair and stares with a worried brow at the screen.
The screen slowly turns and then displays miles of crop fields and cow pastures that have not been damaged in the far distance and then halts showing the current ground soil. Numerous rows of unfamiliar faces and huddles of bodies move or stand or sit on top of the ground soil while eating or talking or laughing.
Rusk jabs his finger and growls at the screen saying with another nasty timber. “And the audience members are comprised of other Colonists that have come from Grand Rock Valley, North Ridge Mountain, and Swamp Island. You can see a pale face that is connected to a pale body. Every farmer is dark skinned due to the bright sunshine. And all these unwelcomed visitors are stomping down on my mama’s Rose Garden. Do you remember when, McCamy? Our mother planted a garden in a circle on each side of the School House’s front door, so all the little kids would run into the prickly thorn on each rose stem and then back into the classroom for school, for their school learning skills. That Rose Garden has been there for years and years. I loved seeing the blooming roses, every spring. Now, the roses are gone. These vile people have destroyed the gardens. I hate Hico. I wanna go and tear out his throat,” he starts to growl at the screen.
On the screen, back in South Beach Colony, Hico continues to stand behind the new door and says with a smile to the visitors and audience members. “Is everyone enjoying your visit to South Beach also?” Each audience member continues to move around or stand or sit while applauding with a set of loud hoots, screams, and whistles.
He nods and exclaims, “Excellent! I promised a good time here in South Beach. Did I not? And I do not fib to ya’ll.” Each audience member continues to move or stand or sit while screaming and applauding, after his words.
“At this moment, there is a new dance platform, for our newest deadly competitive, the Huntress and Hunter Games. Ladies are first always!” He laughs with a nod. Each audience member continues to move or stand or sit while applauding, after his words. Hico smiles then states, “The new dance platform is being constructed a mile south of here.”
Inside the living room, on Festus Farms, McCamy continues to sit with Tulu and turns with a nod and a smirk viewing his brother Rusk. Rusk turns and nods back to McCamy in silence and then turns with a wink to see Baycliff. Baycliff turns and nods back to Rusk.
Each teen male holds the secret knowledge that the dance competition platform will rest on top of the flat limestone rock cliff, which is more dangerous to a foe rather than a friend. Each friend returns and stares back at the screen in silence.
On the television screen, back in front of the South Beach School House, Hico smiles then announces, “I estimate the work will be completed in two more days and one more night.” Each audience member continues to move or stand or sit applauding, after his words.
He continues, “I can feel the live energy here. Everyone is both excited and pumped for the fight or flight.” Each audience member continues to move or stand or sit while applauding, after the words.
He shares, “Each entry dance team is anxiously competing for the first whack at our returning champs, the South Beach Bandits.” Each audience member continues to move or stand or sit while applauding after his words.
He explains, “To accommodate the lucky first revel team into the new Huntress and Hunter Games, I have created, the Showcase event,” Hico turns with a smile and nods to Vovina. “The lovely vision of sugar plums, our own Superintendent Vovina will present the Showcase event. Vovina, if you please, come over here and stand next to me, dear. Please explain to our wonderful audience guests here in South Beach and the wonderful viewers there at home.”
On the same elevated platform, in front of a wooden board of multi-colors of purple, pink, green, yellow, and orange paint, a row of folding chairs holds the two remaining superintendents.
South Beach Superintendent Vovina is familiar with the landscape and the leaders from the native Beachers. She slowly stands upright from the folding chair wobbling sideways, balancing her body. She wears a satin-coated, yellow-tinted, long-sleeved blouse with an array of long white-tinted fringed strings bobbing against her big breasts, a blue-colored circular skirt and a pair of blue and yellow-tinted cowgirl boots. Her makeup appears in a pink tone with soft purple shades. Her lips are bright red matching her hair strands.

I’m happy to be present here in South Beach with ya’ll and pleased to bring you, the new Huntress and Hunter Games. Ladies are always first!” Each audience member continues to move or stand or sit while applauding, after her words.
She continues, “Our first rival team against these big and bad South Beach Bandits will be the grand winner of our Showcase event. The Showcase event will invite all of the competitive teams, or teens in this case, to show off their best creative mind imagination of teenly intellect using all their bite-nats paint talents.” Each audience member continues to move or stand or sit while applauding, after her words.
“Your team will come up with a wild and crazy Showcase theme, for your individual team Showcase to show-off, to a new team of Showcase judges. That’s me and the other staff members from Metro City Birmingham’s office administration. Then, the best theme wins the first whack at the big and bad South Beach Bandits. Thank you!” She tosses a set of pretend kisses at the camera lens and then drops both of her hands slapping her skirt with the leather whip, standing beside Hico. She smiles in silence. Each audience member continues to move or stand or sit while applauding, after her words.
Hico leans over and shoves Vovina away from his body, facing the audience, waving both of his arms in the air. He chuckles then states with a smile. “Thank you so much, Superintendent Vovina. There! You have heard the Showcase event explanation and instructions. Tomorrow, you will set up your team exhibition using any expectable theme, that a teen mind can mustard. Then, we will judge each team exhibition, later in the afternoon, selecting the rival team for the new Huntress and Hunter Games starting later that night, which will go up against the reigning champions, the big and bad South Beach Bandits. But right here and right now, enjoy the bright sunray and the sizzling heat before Sun Block is upon us at 05:59 p.m. So, adieu, until tomorrow morning, after the morning’s Sun Block!” He stands and laughs out loud with an evil tone wearing a wicked grin. Each audience member continues to move or stand or sit while applauding, after his words.
The television screen flashes into a black tint and then displays the interior rooms inside the School House building. On top of a wooden floor, five teenagers stand against a wall of boarded windows without smiling and stare into the camera lens. The camera lens is located on the mounted gigantic television screen on the opposite wall. The striking teen male possesses a tall body, a head of cropped blonde-colored hair, a pair of blue colored eyes, a tone of bronze skin, and is named Hixson, who stands in middle of the four other younger pre-teens and teens.
Inside the living room, at Festus Farms, Taffy swiftly stands upright from the chair as the rocking chair sounds with squeaks. She jabs her finger at the screen and screams out loud with a worried brow, “Hixson! He’s not part of the South Beach Bandits. That’s us, not him. He didn’t dance or fight or kill or compete last night or this morning within the team of South Beach Bandits. We did. We did. He didn’t. He didn’t. And we ain’t there to participate in Hico’s new freak show event either. So, Hico has replaced us by endangering more teens within his crazy dance competition. That is now renamed as the Huntress and Hunter Games,” she stomps both her bare feet and waves both of her arms in the air shouting out loud again, wearing with a sour frown. “We have to stop this madman right here and right now!” She drops both of her arms and slaps her legs fuming in her teenly anger, inflaming both of her nostrils, for the upcoming fight then death of Hico. She snarls at the television screen.
“I only recognized the beaten and bloody face on our childhood friend Hixson. Who are the rest of those pre-teens? Garage Building location
Laboratory setting
04:38 p.m.
Hot temperatures with dark skies
   bright stars and moonlight rays


Festus stops and stands in front of a one-story, square-shaped wooden building presenting three different very large metal garage doors. He reaches down and grabs the handle lifting the closest garage door upright, revealing a new rectangular-shaped storage room, 25 feet high by 55 feet wide by 42 feet long. He enters inside and points around the room sounding with a set of chuckles. 
He states, “Boys, welcome to my laboratory! Almena don’t like me staining the dull non-polished wooden floors that she laid down last summer in the living room with any of my messy inventions.” Each teen moves ahead and scans the room wearing a smile in silence.
He stops and stands beside the first object reaching out, gently patting the metal frame on a low sitting vehicle that looks similar to an ancient old-fashioned golf cart, without a roof. He turns to face the wondering teen males and states with a smile, “I call this vehicle, a terrain machine or land, not water or sky machine. Each terrain machine is four feet and three inches high, which is shorter than my wife. And each terrain machine is four feet and three inches across the metal frame body but not wider than my wife.” He softly chuckles.
He continues. “And finally, each terrain machine is seven feet long with a three feet of cargo storage. Okay! It’s a lame joke. But my set of metal babies ain’t no joke here. Each terrain machine runs on a pail of steam pumped creek fresh water, which is newly patented by me,” He chuckles again then says. “Heated water is generated for the gears inside the engine tank that creates a vacuum of condensation atmospheric steam that forces or blows like an ocean breeze, or in this case, the vehicle moves in motion, in any direction.”
Baycliff stands behind the entrance wall and smiles at all the fascinating shiny, pointy dangerous objects inside the garage space, reaching out, grabbing an old-fashioned fencing saber. The skeleton framed on each terrain machine is colored in grayish-black with a T-bone shaped metal roof, without a rooftop, displaying two side doors, two rear doors, and a lid cover over the cargo storage box. A set of two naked worn and faded leather seats in beige hue and a gray tinted scratched up metal hood that covers the powerful engine. Four gray-tinted, dull-looking, metal fenders cover each wheel. Rusk reaches over with a grin and touches the rough metal outline on the topless vehicle while admiring the home-made workmanship. He narrates to all eardrums, “The history of a steam engine dates back to Ancient Roman historical period times. Each driver drives a kart on top of an ancient street with a set of four wheel grooves cut into the dirt road for a smoother ride. McCamy shuffles ahead with his smile then slides down in the rough driver’s seat banging both of his naked palms on the worn leather steering wheel. He leans down touching the floor stick for a three-speed transmission on the terrain machine. He pumps his foot on the brake pedal first and then the drive pedal next while testing the mechanisms of the new driving/riding vehicle.

He shakes his skull then shares. “I experience that medical condition with some of the dumber cows that graze during sunrise or sunset. At 05:03 p.m., after all the female teens had quickly assisted cleaning up the supper dishes, a petite, grayish-brown haired, 50-year-old Almena looks like her older daughter Pemona and leads all the girls into a new room, entering through the archway and side steps, pointing at the table. The playroom design displays three pink or purple tinted painted walls and measures 30 feet long by 18 feet high by 25 feet wide. One side wall holds a solid reflection mirror. The opposite side wall displays a living room setting containing three long sofas and six oversized sitting chairs against a purple tinted wall. The doors lead onto a brown-bricked outdoor patio. In the middle of the room, a large round table stands alone, which is surrounded by numerous plain wooden hard-back chairs.
Almena moves ahead and then stops blocking the patio doors, pulling dark drape curtains across the glass window while blocking out the upcoming Sun Block rays that will present at start of the night time period, in the South Beach Colony, within Metro City Birmingham territory.
In the early morning hours, on top of Earth’s surface, from the time period of 05:00 a.m. until 05:58 a.m., a person sees a dark black skyline, much like, during the nighttime hours, when a person sleeps for rest inside a bed mattress. Then, like a sack of oven popcorn colonels, at precisely 05:59 a.m., the Sun Block event swiftly burns away the dark matter in atmosphere, making the air wave pop and sizzle from the heated light. Then the rays of heated sunshine glows brightly down burning each crop fields with hot temperature, signaling people to their daily work chores, starting at 06:00 a.m. until 05:58 p.m. at dusk.
The time of dusk resets the Sun Block event presenting another dark matter field, within Earth’s atmosphere, exactly at 06:00 p.m., in the evening, every day.

Hico has renovated that old run-down hotel near Baycliff’s farmland, which is located on the outskirts of the limestone cliff. So, we all check-in and register for the first Showcase event, like the rest of the Riders, Rockers and Swamplanders. Then we all separate into small groups and go and scout out who’s home and who’s not.” Each teen nods in silence. She nods with a smile. “I agree with Wolf-man. We need some type of simple code names like A, B. B for Bee. I’m Bee. C for...”
“I want the name Zee that starts with the letter of Z, not the letter of C,” Tulu waves her hand sounding with a giggle.
Wolf tosses both of his arms in the air and says. “I want the letter of C for my new code name of Cam.”
Baycliff points and laughs at Wolf then comments. “If he’s called the code name of Cam, then I’m called the code name of Dam,” he laughs with the others.
“No, snot-hole!” Rusk shakes his skull then says.
Taffy smiles then shares, “A, B, C, D…”
“I wanna be called the code name of Dee.” Pemona informs then giggles.
Taffy continues to smile and shouts the rest of the alphabetic letters. “E, G…”
Baycliff frowns then states. “Okay! I’ll take the letter of G. For geez, this is so obvious that we’re making up names just to enter and then win the first Showcase event, so we can participate in the throat-cutting, blood-festering, death-marking dance competition…”
“No letter of G for obtuse Baycliff,” Taffy states then frowns. “We start with the letter sequence of H, I, J…”
“I wanna be called the code name of Jee.” Amita states then stops her walk and stands beside Baycliff, wearing her smile.
“Kee is me.” Rusk says then smiles and points to Baycliff. “The letter of L belongs to Baycliff, who can use a code named of Lee,” he laughs with the others.
“Look! If you use that silly rhyming scheme, then I wanna be Pee.” Baycliff says and slaps his wet chest. Rusk shakes his skull and chuckles with his South Beach buddy.
Taffy exclaims. “No, Baycliff!”
“No, snot-hole! You’ll become the code name of Lee. Or you’ll become my fist.” Rusk states and holds his natural fist near his smile.
“I’ll be called, Lee.” McCamy states and raises his hand nodding to each teen to retire the catfight. McCamy wants all his friends to rest and prepare for the upcoming deadly fight against Hico and his true outlaws.
Rusk smiles then states, “So, Baycliff’s code name is Tee. We’re done. Time to go to bed, you’ll!” He spins and claps leading the others from the Play Room setting for bedtime routine.

June 7th Sunday


Kitchen space setting
04:04 a.m.
Warm temperatures and dark sky without stars


Rusk stands in front of the kitchen counter hearing his growling stomach, slapping a piece of bread on top of the pile of fresh meat, stuffing the first newly created and delicious sandwich onto his pink tongue then chews vigorously. He scans the empty kitchen counters and searches for an empty tray to hold seven more turkey sandwiches for a hunger belly from three whiny teen males sleeping or resting inside the Game Room. He spots a flat brown-tinted paper bag near the wash sink and reaches out grabbing the paper, gently dumping down a tower of food and then folds the lip on the paper bag for food protection.
A faint sound echoes in the close distance inside the room, where the nighttime remains dark with bright stars, until the heat index increases at an exponential rate, before Sun Block.
A dark shadow sneaks into the kitchen, then dashes ahead, and finally stops behind Rusk. A pair of soft hands reaches around and grabs his bicep swinging Rusk around to face Pemona.
Rusk reacts with a sneer then twirls Pemona in a half-circle, slamming her back spine against the wash sink in front of the glass window, sounding with a gasp. He sees her stunned face. She gasps in alarm then smiles slapping her hand over her parted lips, sounding with a set of giggles.
Rusk leans over and slaps his wet kiss on her forearm, then her cheekbone, reaching out, grabbing and guides the fixed sandwich into his open mouth, chewing vigorously the second bite of food. She frowns at the food item then whispers. “Rusk, my mama will prepare the breakfast meal around six o’clock, this morning. There’ll be plenty of food to go around.”
He swallows the lump of food then states. “I’ll eat that too,” he bites another hunk of food and chews with his grin, leaning around Pemona, narrowing his eyelids and focuses on a distance object.
“Does my breath stink?” She inquires and reaches out with her palms pressing his wrinkled tee shirt down, outlining his chest muscles and travels down to his belly button.
“Naw,” he states then bites another chunk of food, chewing and then refocuses his acute eyeballs on a distance object, leaning over the side of her body, narrowing his two eyelids.
Outside in the quiet hallway, the male voice yells out loud. “I hear voices! Who’s awake and up before breakfast time?” Festus appears and stands inside the archway, sounding with a gasp of shock. “What in tarnation?”
“Daddy!” Pemona exclaims and turns with her gasp to see her father.
“Duck!” Rusk shouts and drops his sandwich and the paper bag of food items down on the floor, reaching over, wrapping his arms around Pemona. They swiftly fall sideways away from the wash sink, landing down on his shoulder on top of the tile as he cuddles Pemona into his chest for body protection.
A series of loud bangs echo throughout the room as four separate bullets break and then explode out the kitchen window glass. One of the stray bullets hits the upper bicep on Festus. He back pedals into the oven stove and then kneels down on the floor, sliding across the room while holding a bleeding shoulder and cursing like thunder.
A single fire bomb flies through the broken glass landing inside the dry sink and then burns into a light flame, slowly dying from the water drops.
A second fire bomb enters through the same broken window landing on top of the kitchen counter, burning a hole down into the tile materials.
A third fire bomb sails through the air from the same broken window and then gracefully slides down on top of the metal-coated oven stove. A series of hot flames swiftly crawls around each stove eye then quickly licks up the dried grease and all the fossilized food exploding into a wall of flames that brightens in the kitchen setting in shades of reds, yellows, and blues.
On the floor, Rusk swiftly moves off from Pemona and then sits upright on both of his kneecaps, leaning backwards, moving in a butt-crawl over Pemona and leads to the open archway. He shuffles over the kitchen floor and then out through the open archway as numerous plumes of bright colorful flames tries to invade the wallpapered hallway. He stands upright from the floor first and then leans down, assisting her to stand, shouting out loud to the other occupants of the house, “Fire! Get out! Fire! Get out! Fire! Fire!”
Pemona reaches out and touches his naked arm yelling out the new information. “Daddy is a mechanical engineer. The entire house is rigged with his mechanical commands.” She swings around and screams to her father. “Daddy, are you harmed?”
Inside the kitchen archway, Festus slowly shuffles backwards from the kitchen archway sounding with a string of soft curse words and then slams into the side wall inside the hallway, reaching out with one hand, touching the proper button. He slaps the button and turns to see the burning kitchen setting, wearing with a worried brow. A steel door crashes down into a set of slanted grids that has been built into the wooden floor between the kitchen setting and family living room. Behind the steel door, musical notes of splashes and then swishes of pumped fresh pond water and tons of chemical foam work together extinguishing the kitchen flames and fireballs.
He coughs out loud and then mumbles loudly. “I’m fine, sweetheart.” He swings around with a worried brow and sees Rusk and Pemona, shouting with alarm, holding his bloody arm. “Prepare to fight against Hico’s guards, Rusk! Go and get the girls and boys up!” He turns and views Rari inside the hallway, shouting out his commands. “Go and release the horses, before they set the barn on fire, Rari. Hurry! Hurry, Rari!” The loud echoes of hitting bullets awake the other occupants inside the house.
More individual bullets smash through some of the front entrance glass windows damaging the family living room setting as a running upright body drops down and lands on the wooden floor for protection, cursing with fear. Then each body stands upright and then races quickly into a different direction.

Warm temperatures with darkness without stars

The protective helmet blocks out the bright stars and the rays of moonlight in the nighttime sky. Her pupils slowly adjust to the dark tinted glass and as a set of eye protection mirrors is built inside and outside the rounded helmet. The new technology makes the helmet weigh five pounds that grinds your neck muscles with slight pain.

Wolf lifts both of his hands and cups all of his fingers, protecting his pair of sensitive eyeballs, staring into the double darkness with a big smile, in silence, too.
A white hue slowly creeps on top of the dark brown dirt like a set of spider legs spraying a band of pink color sprinkles like glitter on top of a birthday cake between each expanding band of white hue. Each individual rising and heated white tinted sun ray musically pops within your eardrums sounding like an individual popcorn cornel that resides on top of an oven stove as the heated air temperature immediately rises over 100 degrees Fahrenheit of gathered hotness, before six o’clock, in the morning.

An array of bright yellow bands swiftly soars into a blaze of colorful fireworks high into the white tinted skyline as a tiny stream of numerous semi-crooked rows of red tined tiny sparkles paint above the yellow tinted sun rays coming from each burnt blade of dry brown-tinted weed created from the lack of nourishing rainwater and fertile cow shit.
The finale presentation of Sun Block displays an array of white light, pink sprinkles, blue bombs, yellow streaks, green grass, brown trees, and finally brown soil brightly morphing into a permanent daylight environment, for a pair of human eyeballs protected behind a helmet. Then the solar sun swiftly leaps upright into the low skyline creating a yellow tinted horizon for the start of a new day here, in the South Beach Colony, within the newly created Colonies of the U.S.A.
One terrain machine stands alone and creates a long, dark silhouette over the flat plain on each end of the short row. Tiny wooden shack setting
Rainy cloudy of gray with cool temperatures without sunshine
