The rain shower has three main purposes, clearing the dry humid air, watering the sprouting farm crops and replenishing the drinking fresh ponds.

Front porch setting

The musical song What Was I Think’ was released on April 14, 2003, by the American country singer and songwriter Dierks Bentley. The songwriters are Dierks Bentley, Deric J. Ruttan, and Brett Beavers, who also produced the musical record. His musical tunes play Country sounds. His musical song was an up-tempo beat, in which, he recalled escaping one night with pretty young girl from South Alabama and then committed an array of foolish activities, during the night.

The jacked-up pickup truck slowly rolls over a smooth pathway of gray rock and small patches of green short grass, where the heat kills the plants. The open skyline is painted in a lovely pale blue hue with a set of scattered white-tinted clouds. The heated particles from the engine flings off the truck hood drifting up in the air waves creating a lovely rainbow of colored steam plumes. The trunk’s four big rubber tires smooth steer over a roadway of red-tinted mud puddles, where the rainwater has not been evaporated by the sizzling heat. The truck slips to the left then slides to the right.
Rusk is an expert vehicle driver in the mud puddles and muddy dirt particles while jerking the steering column side to side, chuckling at the fun ride.
Taffy slides side to side without wearing a safety belt and laughs at the fun adventure, glancing back to see the other teens.

After a while, I figured out how good she is for me, how unique she is for me, and how much she likes me. I got overwhelmed and confused at first…”

Where the strange green reptiles crawl

When shadows filled the sky

Said, “Don’t come looking again!”

The musical song Funkytown was released, in the year 1979, by the American disco musical band named Lipps Inc., from their debut album entitled Mouth to Mouth. The musical song was written by musician, composer, and record producer Steven Greenberg and sung by Cynthia Johnson. The musical song was written in the musical instrument key of C Major and expressed the desire for the person to keeping moving and grooving, looking for new energy. Steven composed the song living in the cold northern city of Minneapolis, within the U.S. State of Minnesota with future career dreams of moving and grooving to New York City, with the U.S. State of New York.
In the first recorded musical video, singer Debbie Jenner served as the face of the band named Lipps Inc. while performing in the countries of the Netherlands and Germany. She dances and mime the words from the popular song. The musical song entered the United States of America on March 29, 1980 becoming the number one musical song playing on free American air waves from May 31st to June 21st and becoming a permanent disco party musical song for all social parties, since the year 1980.

The gigantic individual semi-circular limestone cliff holding the land property on the Thelee Farms is no different from the Erbo Farms or Baycliff’s daddy’s farm property. Each plot of land is 100 miles wide and 125 miles long setting 200 feet high above the rough, warm water of the Gulf of Mexico, if you wanna use some math numbers, for your tiny brain cells. Each plot of land contains numerous scattered bald spots of hard, gray-tinted, limestone solid rock holding no grass or dirt or creek but cleverly hides a single deep growling fissure pit that heats the crops, the trees, and the plants, growing them into an array of gigantic objects.
However, the individual decorative bald spot of rock is wildly placed by Mother Nature. Around each bald spot, Mother Nature has used her personal touch and created her own art work, for herself or maybe the surviving humans. She must’ve felt sorry for the stupid bastards killing each other off, without harming the planet, her domain.
Some of the flat rock-coated bald spots are surrounded by miles of green-tinted grass for cows, goats, horses, chickens, and pigs. Other bald spots guard miles of red tinted clay dirt plots, for fertile crop productions. Another group of bald spots protect a grove of tall, thick, shady, cool forestland housing a small variety of wild animals, used for both beauty and food, by Mother Nature and the humans.
The flat rock-coated bald spot here on Thelee Farms runs 1,000 feet wide by 500 feet across and displays, several yards away from a thick lush woodlands, a large pink-tinted, stone-covered barn and four smaller barns for storing both hay rolls for horse food and herds of horses during a bad weather pattern. Surrounding the bald spot, four meadows of green short grass blades are protected by scattered woodlands, currently housing a pen of both geldings and mares; a pen of mama and baby horses, and a single pen with a stallion and three goats. Running through the fields, without literally exercising but slowly strolling around becoming fatter for a future meal, numerous chickens, chicks, roosters, and wild turkeys also feed off the tender tiny grasslets as the animals peacefully graze while ignoring the silly loud movements from the humans.
On the farthest side away from the row of barns, a tall wall of thick, green-tinted cool shade trees, McCamy ceases the loud musical song on the player, stops, and then parks the truck killing the engine, observing the new environment.
The other teens drop down out of sight and sit on top of the metal floor wearing a stern face while waiting for McCamy’s instructions. They hide away from the active band of Rider guards.
Each barn material is comprised of hard stones in dull pink hue. The structure does not contain a single viewing window as the building is used for protection of both food stuffs and livestock. The only entrance or exit point is a set of double wooden doors painted in white hue.
The largest barn is surrounded by a lovely circular pathway of rose bushes and fruit trees guarding a tall wall of thick, green-tinted cool shade trees. Tourann does not work outside but commands the indoors completing her personal chores, within the family household. But she asks her husband to nicely decorate each lonely barn with colorful bushes that keep out the pesky wild animals and the stinging insects when her two daughters enjoy riding the horses or working outside around the meadows. Of course, Thelee obliges with the commands from his lovely wife of twenty-three years.
The band of Riders stand in boredom but alertness near the closed doors guarding all the leaders from the South Beach Colony, which includes the biological parents of Taffy, McCamy, and Baycliff.
Each Rider is not painted in bite-nats colors either wearing a pale-tinted skin tone, a head of blonde-tinted hair strands, a pair of blue eyeballs, a white-tinted, short-sleeved tee shirt, a pair of dark blue jeans, and a set of sneakers toting a shotgun. A Rider resides within the side of the cool mountain air, not the blistering sunlight. A group of Riders have parked on the opposite side huddling underneath an overstory cool shade, away from the bright sunlight rays, provided by a grove of tall tree leaves.
Inside the truck bed, McCamy gives the whispered signal through the open center window to the other three male teens. Two of males change from a white or colored tee shirt into a black one as during a vicious fight, you wanna punch your enemy, not your friend.
The naughty Riders wear white hue; the nice Bandits present in black hue.
Each male teen slides down the side metal railing without disturbing the quiet peace among a heated day and then squat down hiding slightly behind the driver’s door on the truck.
Each male also wears a pair of faded, ripped, dirty blue jeans and a pair of colorful, polished leather cowboys with a set of pointy toes.
Inside the cab, driver McCamy opens the door and then slides out standing on top of the short grass blades wearing a black-tinted, short-sleeved tee shirt, a pair of clean faded, ripped blue jeans, and a pair of polished blue and red colored leather cowboy boots with a set of pointy toes.
He smiles leaning inside and grabs Tulu. She scoots sideways and then sits on the edge of the front seat wearing a pair of faded, ripped blue jeans, a pink-tinted tee shirt, and her pair of polished maroon and pink colored, leather cowgirl boots. She poses a few feet away from the girly couple of Pemona and Taffy, who stand folded at their waistline inside the rear bed compartment. They spy on the pink-tinted barn and rows of Riders in silence.
Tulu places both booted feet on top of the lift kick, which does not touch the ground, standing even in height with her tall boyfriend. She wears a worried brow for her parents, her boyfriend, her sister, her friends and her mission.
McCamy stands in front of the kick lift and orders. “Stay put right here, in my monster truck, muffin! You’ll be safer right here. I’ll be back, after my fun.” He softly laughs with an evil tone then leans down kissing her lips, pulling back with a wink. He back steps and gently shoves Tulu back onto the cab bench closing the door shut, spinning around to face a prominent horse trail of flattened light green grass blades and dark green tinted tree leaves.
Baycliff appears with a wicked grin and moves beside McCamy handing off a second tin pail holding a set of live croaking bullfrogs. The two male teens shuffle ahead and bump into each other, for fun. Wolf and Rusk pad together following them.
Inside the trunk cab, Tulu quietly sits and watches the back spine on McCamy, Wolf, Rusk and Baycliff. The male teens slowly pace towards the Riders, who continue to huddle underneath the shade trees, in front of the barn’s entrance point. She spins around facing the open center window and leans into the frame, saying to Taffy. “Taffy, are we staying put here along the truck bed?”
“Aw naw!” Taffy whispers back to her sister. “We’re going to have some fun playtime too. Open your door, Tulu, and get out, squatting down on the grassy ground!” She wears a pair of faded, ripped blue jeans, a red-tinted tee shirt, and a pair of unpolished brown and black colored, leather cowgirl boots. She slides across the metal floor and then shoves Pemona into metal railing, for fun.
Tulu opens the door and then slides out, squatting down, staying still. She faces the engine hood.
Pemona wears a pair of faded, ripped blue jeans, a light blue tee shirt, and a pair of polished orange and red colored leather cowgirl boots. She drops down from the metal railing, squats down and waits behind Tulu.
Taffy leaps from the truck bed, lands on the soft grass, squat down behind Pemona. Then she twists her body around in the grass and starts to butt-crawl ahead leading the two teens slowly down the metal side of the truck. She crawls ahead behind the row of low-lying green tinted plant bushes and underneath the low-lying tree limbs. She leads towards the rear of the barn as a huddle of fourteen Riders focus on the four advancing South Beach cowboys.
McCamy pads beside Baycliff heading towards the barn, scanning each side, seeing the open meadow. The herd of horses has been safely moved away from the barn structure and feed near a grove of trees, where the herd is safe and silent. He smiles at the pretty herd of horses then returns back seeing the Riders, ordering to his brother. “Stay behind me, little brother. I lead and then I…”
“I’m the negotiator here, big brother,” Rusk says with a calm timber and shuffles Wolf.
McCamy swings two pails holding the stunned small mammals in each hand saying with a smile, “Naw, boy! You’re the peacekeeper while keeping good peace between me and our daddy for a long time now, filling in for our sweet departed mama. Anyways, Baycliff is the real negotiator among the four South Beach musketeers. I’m the fighter. And Wolf-man, he’s our secret weapon. Ain’t that right, dude?” He laughs.
Wolf laughs without commenting, toting the secret weapon, for the upcoming encounter, with his own fellow clan members, clapping in excitement.
Underneath each overstory green tinted shade tree, Taffy continues to move in a squat over the short grass blades and then quickly crosses the open space between the bushes and the side of the barn. She stand upright then rapidly races ahead hiding behind the rear wall on barn, stopping near the opposite end of the wall.
Tulu and Pemona stand upright and quickly follow behind Taffy and then stops beside her in silence.
Taffy leans down and places both of her naked hands down into the soft dirt digging out a larger hole, until she sees empty space. She points to her boots then fingers the new open hole.
Tulu nods in silence understanding the secret message from Taffy, removing her leather boots that will impede her body movements into the hole. She moves ahead and leans down wiggling and grunting down underneath the hole, disappearing from Taffy and then emerges in the interior walls of the barn setting.
Pemona nods in silence also removing her boots, crawling down on the dirt and enters the hole next, disappearing into the barn interior. Inside every barn wall, numerous farm implements are always stored and now available, such like, hoes, shovels, and pick axes, for a short but sweet fight with a nasty band of Riders, even without her cowgirl boots.
The open hole was created by the loving litter of young and mature family dogs, last season. The canines have fun scouting and searching for each other, during the heated daylight hours, like a fun doggie Hide and Seek childhood fun game. However, the smarter dogs learned to dig in the soft dirt, without the roots and thorns attacking their paws and ear points, coming from a lovely planted red tinted rose bush, then created a large hole, crawling through the hole, and then emerged into the cool shade of the barn interior. They ended up sleeping, during the heated day, without performing any of their assigned doggie chores, of course, on Thelee Farms. Taffy was assigned to fill the hole permanently ceasing their naughty canine behavior. However, her secret spying tasks, along with her current boyfriend Baycliff, greatly interfered while learning about the new bite-nats information from each new farm neighbor, taking high priority over her regular farm chores. Thus, she never was able to fill the hole.
Now, it is with great luck, coming from the heavenly angels, that a stupid Hico has selected this particular farm site, on Thelee Farms, to house and hold all the leaders from the South Beach Colony. Now, Taffy and her friends will be able to execute a fast and furious rescue of all the hostages, including her sweet parents.
Taffy softly chuckles with her deep, dark secret now shared with her sister, swiftly removing her boots then wiggles down over the dirt last crawling underneath the open hole, disappearing from the heated air waves.

At 03:14 p.m., in front of the entrance doors, McCamy stops and stands shoving his pail into Baycliff’s hands, smiling then says to the tight huddle of Riders, “Howdy, bubba!”
The Riders quickly and quietly flee the shade, then un-huddle, and finally form two semi-crooked straight lines with a combination of seven males and females guarding the closed entrance doors, toting a shotgun in both of their crooked arms, scanning each new face.
Not all of the South Beach natives are mad or insulted with the numerous un-invited visitors visiting here at their home Colony. Mainly, the South Beach adults are upset; some of them are held in their homesteads as a group of hostile hostages, until Hico receives his demands. The South Beach youth act normal playing outside with their farm neighbors ignoring the other Colonists. The South Beach teen males do not bother with a furious fight against all the visiting Colonists either but continue to hunt and fish, for their daily meal.
The leader of the Rider became the leader, after beating up a group of four little girls into blue bruises and red blood proteins, who were happily playing near the newly created hotel building used for the upcoming Showcase event tonight. Hico had witnessed his nasty ways and then assigned the Rider to guard the hostages here at the barn building.
The leader sneers at the four South Beach teens then states with a nasty timber, “What do you want over here, Bandit?” He punches the rib cage on his girlfriend Rider first then they march ahead and stop, leaning down into the tin pails that dripping down to the ground with a set of individual water droplets.
McCamy extends his single tin pail towards two Riders showing a set of live brown spotted mammals inside the metal as each bullfrog musically croak its love song in the air. He says. “Can we hunt around the patches of pretty wildflowers over yonder, sirs? These things like to eat all the crawling bugs.” The other South Beach teens softly snigger at the nasty comment.
“I’m a girl!” The ugly female Rider states then stares with her lady sneer at McCamy.
“Know that, stupid!” The lead Rider states and cuddles his shotgun, staring down inside the pail of live bullfrogs.
“Bubba’s smart!” McCamy says turning to wink at the ugly female Rider while laughing along with Rusk and Wolf.
Baycliff doesn’t acknowledge the wink or the compliment to the Rider from McCamy, sneering with a sour frown, saying with a nasty timber, “Smart-hole.”
McCamy nods with his smile staring at leader then asks. “Can we hunt over yonder? We’re all hungry for some snacks.”
“What snacks?” The leader states with confusion and continues to frown down at the pail of bullfrogs.
“A fried frog leg is a very nutritious afternoon snack. We eat them for energy.” McCamy states and then points down into the pail chucking with amusement.
“Yum. Yum. Dum. Dum.” Baycliff comments turning to sneer at each Rider’s face.
“Know that, too, stupid!” A third male Rider shouts then moves ahead standing beside the leader and in front of McCamy, viewing the pail of bullfrogs, lifting the shotgun onto his collar bone.
“A frog leg tastes, like a fried chicken drum stick. Do you like fried chicken fingers?” McCamy asks the Riders then laughs with amusement.
“Everything tastes like fried chicken.” Baycliff states then huffs at each Rider.
A fourth Rider shuffles ahead from the guard line wearing a smile, stops then stands beside the female Rider, asking with a calm timber. “Do you have any turtles? A dead cooked turtle in a soup tastes like…”
“…chicken…” Baycliff states then laughs with his friends.
“Everything tastes like chicken to Baycliff.” McCamy states with a grin then turns with a wink to see his friend.
“What’s a Baycliff?” The third Rider looks up with his puzzlement to see McCamy.
Rusk smiles then asks. “Don’t you know the cliff, where the bay meets the hard rocks, dude?”
“Naw! It’s him!” McCamy states and bumps into Baycliff nodding with a smile at the row of Riders.
The female Rider looks up and examines the two teens, gasping in shock, jabbing her finger at Baycliff and then McCamy. She yells with puzzlement. “It…he…they’re the wild gang of renegades, outlaws, bandits that we’re been hunting for.” She quickly shifts the shotgun from her collar bone into both of her cupped palms, without time to aim the barrel at Baycliff, the known South Beach Bandit.
Baycliff slaps his chest and states. “Naw, man! I’m the rebel! I like that term much, much better than renegade, because a rebel means…” he rears back his fist holding his breath, punching his arm towards the ugly nose bridge, on the uglier female rider. She tumbles sideways landing on top of the hard rock, dropping her gun, moaning in pain. Baycliff laughs then dashes ahead into the rows of Riders starting to punch both of his flying fists into the closest teen, female and male.
The leader Rider swings his shotgun barrel directly at the chest on McCamy, laughing out loud, yelling at the teen, “I win, here, jack hole!” He ducks sideways, without firing a bullet, swiftly away from the flying fist at his jaw line.
A set flying folded fists from each Bandit hits into the Rider’s jaw line. Each Rider’s bone skull tilts to the right and then to the left exhibiting a dizzy mind and as each arm tosses away the gun then flings to the left and then to the right knocking the person down on top of the hard rock surface.
McCamy ducks to his left coming from a Rider’s fist punch.
Rusk reaches out with a sneer and grabs the advancing fist from the Riders shoving the tall, strong, female Rider away from his body slamming into the tree bark. He knock her unconscious.
A flying fist from a male Rider slaps the eight-pack abs on Baycliff. Baycliff laughs out loud without pain then swiftly rears back and then slams his folded fist against the glass jaw and as the Rider stumbles backwards dropping down inside a tiny dry mud puddle on top of the rock surface.
McCamy shoots both of his fists at the six-pack abs, like two battering rams, on the next fighting Rider, who stumbles backwards then lands down on his back spine, on top of the hard rock surface, curling sideways in both intense body pain and spilled red tinted blood proteins.
Rusk runs ahead and chases down a new Rider, shoving the back spine on the same Rider into the lovely rose patch with the thousands of prickly thorns beside the barn doors. The Rider lands on top of the sharp thorns, scratching all his exposed and clothed body parts, screaming in terrible pain. He yells in pain slowly trying to stand up from the flora attack.
Baycliff finishes the next female Rider with his left hook to her glass jaw and as the teen tumbles sideways dropping down on top of a tiny dried mud puddle within the large hard rock surface. She sleeps without feeling her painful body.
A new female tall and ugly Rider quickly advances from the entrance door, on the barn pumping her shotgun into action, direct pointing the cold barrel in Rusk’s nostrils. Rusk flips up both of his palms upright for a quick surrender, before his death call.
Wolf spins around from an unconscious Rider and leans down grabbing up a grounded hard tree limb, tossing the object at the back spine on the female Rider. The Rider swings around with a growl and finds a flying fist from Wolf on her glass or weak female jaw line. The Rider has two black tinted eye sockets and a broken nose bridge, slowly tumbles backward, dropping the gun and lands on her kneecaps and cries in pain.
Inside the interior wall of the barn, the musical song repeats again for the captured hostages.
The musical song Huntin’, Fishin’ and Lovin’ Every Day was released on March 14, 2016, by the American country singer and songwriter Thomas Luther “Luke” Bryan. The songwriters are Luke Bryan, Dallas Davidson, Rhett Atkins, and Ben Hayslip. His musical songs play Country; Country Rock and Country Pop sounds.

A loose huddle of numerous adult males sit quietly looking at each other, turning to see each Rider guard that stands at the entrance wall. Outside the entrance doors, loud shouts occur then bombard the room space. Each Rider swings around and faces the closed doors, slowly padding ahead, toting their rifle.
The leader from the row of Rider guards reaches out and cracks open the door, watching the fight between the Bandits and the Riders.
Tulu carefully crawls over the smooth stone coming from hidden hole inside the rear wall then stops beside the barn’s gun cubby reaching up, grabbing three hand guns. Pemona copies Tulu and holds two hands gun. Taffy squats down and moves ahead stopping in front of the gun cubby, getting four weapons.
Tulu totes the weapons in one curled arm on top of the smooth floor towards the huddle of adult males then stops, gently placing her gun in untied cupped hand on the closest adult. The adult recognizes the items and accepts the weapon watching the tight huddle of Riders, who crowd into the cracked doorway.
Pemona also crawls over the floor and passes out a hand gun to the other adult male, in silence, while watching the back spine on each Rider guard.
Now, most of the adult males are armed with a loaded gun and then slowly stands upright from the smooth floor, without detection, pointing the cold barrel at the huddle of Riders, without scaring each teen into an accidental murder of a human body. Each adult male slowly advances ahead and points a cold barrel into an individual body part then halts softly warning the Rider to quietly surrender, reaching out and snatches away the Rider’s weapon.
Each Rider carefully spins from the cracked door then views a row of smiling from each South Beach adult, who magically holds a loaded gun. Each Rider lifts both of their empty palms near their jaw line wearing a sour frown in silence.
Ebro flicks his barrel tip towards the side wall in silence.
Each Rider slowly sidesteps away from the entrance door and then huddles into the wall corner while mumbling in a string of soft curses.
The two barn doors swing open.
McCamy rushes inside first and then halts with gasp a few feet from the entrance doors seeing the line of armed South Beach adult males then views his female friends. Each South Beach holds a hand gun also. He laughs out loud expressing both his relieve and worry.
Baycliff, Rusk and Wolf dash inside and then stop standing in a row with McCamy while pointing at the males, laughing in relieve also.
The other adult males stand and aim a loaded gun at the sitting line of teen Riders without harming the young persons while each daddy greets their biological child, secretly celebrating their love and happiness.
Ebro hand his gun to his neighbor and then swiftly moves ahead colliding with love into his older twin son, pulling back with a smile. He yells in relieve, “McCamy, I’m totally befuddled here; but I’m very happy to see your body, alive and well, son. Follow me and collect one of the heavy chains! We’ll start tying up each Rider teen from escaping from Thelee Farms,” he sidesteps and hugs his baby twin Rusk, pulling with his smile, saying with his nervous timber. “I’m so happy to you, too, son! I don’t know the details of your adventures in Metro City Birmingham. I wanna know the details; but I can’t spare the time, right here and right now, for the details. So, we’ll talk and eat later,” he spins around from Rusk, laughing out loud with relief, shaking his long locks of blonde-tinted hair strands. He silently prays and thanks the Almighty Father, Brother Christ Jesus, The Holy Spirit and all of his heavenly angels for the return and safety of his two sons. He moves ahead towards the huddle of Riders sneering at the nasty teens.
Thelee hands his weapon to his fellow neighbor also then shuffles again hugging his oldest daughter Taffy while presenting his grateful tears of joy. He thought his elderly daughter dead and buried down inside the deep fiery fission hole on top of the limestone rock cliffs. He whispers into her cheekbone. “I don’t know where you went or where you came from. But I’m glad you’re right here with me, Taffy. And I bet your temporary disappearance has to do with an evil Director Hico.”
Taffy pulls back with a nod first sounding with sobs, wearing her own tears of joy and worry also, explaining the situation. “Yeah, Daddy! I disappeared and then reappeared, because of an evil Hico. Dictator Hico is trying to take our lands and our folks, but McCamy, Rusk, Baycliff, Tulu and I are here to show the way and save the day!” She smiles then sniggers at her silly but serious statement.
 Thelee shouts and nods in joy then proclaims. “Amen!” He hugs his lost but found daughter again then parts from her turning to see his younger daughter Tulu. Taffy stands and starts to cry from the intense three days of death, destruction, and deception.
Ebro stops in front of the side wall and points down to the floor. Each Rider slows separates and then drops down on top of the smooth floor. Ebro points an empty shotgun at each face and orders. “Go and get more of these chains, too, Rusk and McCamy! We need to chain up this gang of nasty Rider teens, before more of them shows up here.” Rusk and McCamy obey their father bumping into each other, laughing with relief for his safety. They head to the side wall with numerous mounted equipment pieces and hidden wooden cabinets of farm supplies.
Thelee collides and hugs his baby daughter with his love, slowly pulling back with a smile whispering into her tears. “Tulu, I am so sorry that I sent you away to Apprenticeship Program.”
Tulu wipes her tears then shows her sweet smile expressing her mixed teenly feelings, “Don’t worry about it, Daddy! McCamy and Taffy came and got me! They didn’t want me to go to the Apprenticeship Program either. So, we’re all back home to stay here, foreverly, Daddy. Where’s Mama?” She turns and scans the room not seeing Tourann.
He shouts to the heavens. “Amen!”
“Daddy!” Baycliff shouts with a smile, dashes ahead, then collides hugging his father with his love. He starts to sob with his own manly tears from the terrible set of events, for the past three days. He pulls back with a smile and wipes off his wet face staring at his father. 
Manbanna, Baycliff’s father laughs out loud nodding his bone skull then states, “Figures! My son is behind all this mess.”
He laughs out loud then states. “Yeah, my boot toe is always behind someone’s butthole, moving them out of my way.”
Manbanna laughs with his head nod then states. “I didn’t understand. Why you ran off from South Beach, after the two deaths of your childhood friends, McCamy and Taffy? But I do understand now! You and your four South Beach friends have found something weird and dangerous and deadly that involves a nasty Hico and his nastier band of ugly insect guards.”
He nods then expresses. “Yeah, and the evil thing has followed us back home to South Beach…”
“… not for long, son…” Manbanna states then laughs with an evil tone.
Wolf enters the barn and wears an unconscious mud-covered Rider over his back spine slowly limping ahead then slams the female body down top of a short hay bale. He sneers down at the ugly girl with an uglier soul.
Baycliff turns with a smile and points at the back spine on Wolf saying with a calm demeanor. “Daddy, this is my new friend, Wolf, who is a Rider. But he helped save my life and the lives of all my friends here.”
Wolf hears his name then back steps from the unconscious Rider spinning around, advances ahead and stops, standing in front of his new friend Baycliff and Baycliff’s father, who is a duplicate of his handsome son but years in age from the rough weather patterns.
Manbanna smiles and extends his hand, shaking Wolf’s hand, saying with his head nod. “A friend of Baycliff is a friend of mine. Thank you, Wolf! I’m very grateful for your kindness, smarts, and friendship to my son. Do you need a place to stay for the night, son? You and your parents are welcome to stay with us at the Baycliff Farms.” He withdraws his hand and nods with his smile to Wolf.
Baycliff turns and scans the room asking with puzzlement. “Daddy, where’s my mama?”
“Thank you, sir! I’ll do that!” Wolf nods with a smile then spins around exiting the barn. He is worried about his parents, who are not present here inside the barn setting. Hico might not know Wolf’s identify and thus does not know his biological parents either. But Wolf will find and protect his parents, if they are located here within the South Beach Colony too. But first, he wants to gather up the rest of the unconscious Riders from the exposed ground, so they are not found by a new set of Rider scouts.
Manbanna swings his old body around to see his older adult farm friends and the young farm teens exhaling with worry, announcing with a stern face. “Good job to our brave and bold sons and daughters for rescuing a room of old men and taking down the young evil teens! Listen up, everyone! Hico has taken all the women and the children to a secret, hidden location.”
“What about our friend Hixson, Daddy?” Baycliff returns and then frowns at his father.

Ebro Farms

05:05 p.m.
Sun Block
Showcase event

New Hotel Building
Ground floor setting
Full moonlight, dark night, bright stars, and heated temperatures


Every member, on the ancient South Beach Bandit team, meets and greets each fake face wearing pale-tinted bite-nats paint, inside a very busy hallway, after registering for their Steampunk Showcase in the exhibition to enter the dance fight competition tonight.
The building is not a true hotel structure with hotel rooms, for visiting guests, but a carriage house, owned and operated by Farmer Ebro.
An ancient carriage house or a coach house, within the ancient United States of America, was an outhouse built for storage of numerous horse-drawn carriages, horses, tack gear and hay bales. The carriage house was close to the horse stables and near the crop fields. The fancy and larger carriage house provided living quarters for carriage staff, who managed both the horses and the coaches. The house was built like a traditional home featuring individual compartments for either the carriage or the staff members.
Over the centuries, within a civilized society, the coach house developed into a small homestead, for a family unit.
Thus, decades ago, Farmer Ebro his wife Pecola started to employ the same concept, after fleeing the Nuclear War Three, establishing a new farm among the limestone cliffs. His farm lands are reached next, after Farmer Manbanna chases off each invader stepping a booted foot onto his farm lands.
Ebro was not so unreasonable and started to employ the desirous males and females, who were escaping from both poverty and hungry. The carriage house had been built a very time ago, before the birth of the twins, with the purpose of storing numerous farm items, including a horse-drawn carriage requested by Pecola.
Over the decades, each worker received free food, clothes, and free shelter while assisting in expanding the carriage house into a small free-standing motel setting, where each tiny room held an individual bed frame and a private lavatory for the worker. Ebro needed the workers; the workers needed a job. The arrangement worked sweetly.
Ebro’s twin sons do work the land too, but there’s too much work for two adults and two teenagers.
Of course, Hico came along today and either killed all the devoted workers for Ebro Farms or recruited all the ambitious persons for his evil purposes here at the South Beach Colony. Thus, the new hotel building has been quickly restructured with numerous large, medium, and small rooms for all the uninvited and non-paying Colonists, who want to see the new Huntress and Hunter Games as well as destroy the land within the South Beach Colony.
From a personal perceptive, it is very hard for a mean person to destroy rocks and Hico desires all the farm land grabbing the rights to each fissure pits housing all the bite-nats paints, for both his personal and professional use. So, Hico does not allow destruction of property as much as damage to pods of pretty flowers, holes in the walls, and torn off wooden doors, and broken glass windows while stealing all the fresh food items. And the gang of uninvited and unruly Colonists hang out around the hotel campus while eating, drinking, laughing, dancing, pissing, shitting and waiting on the upcoming show.
After receiving two separate small rooms, one room is for the gang of males; the other is for the group of females, each disguised South Beach teen reapplies the bite-nats paint maintaining a pale-face skin tone, wearing their individual imaginative Steampunk outfit. Then each one slowly moves down the staircase in their bite-nats costume while spying on the other teens, before the grand Showcase competition begins at nine o’clock this evening. A musical song plays in the background.
The musical song Hotel California, on February 26th, in the year 1982, by the American Rock and Roll musical band named Eagles. The musical band members included Donald Hugh Henley (lead vocals, drums, percussion); Don Felder (12-string acoustic & 6-string electric guitars, backing vocals); Glenn Lewis Frey (12-string acoustic guitars, backing vocals); Joe Walsh (electric guitar; backing vocals), and Randy Mesiner (bass guitar; backing vocals).
The musical songwriters were Donald Hugh Henley; Glenn Lewis Frey, and Don Felder. The musical band played Rock and Soft Rock sounds.

Running for the door

To the place, I was before

You can check-out any time you like,

Six colorful Mother Goose characters danced and performed songs with classical nursery rhymes helping children learn phonetics, new words, and English sentences. Songwriters were Jho Sona Sophia and Shaw Andrew Craig.

The group of teens quickly stroll ahead and enter an empty slot preparing their Victorian Exhibition, for the start of the competition. Part of the preparation involves that each teen quickly paints sections of the three walls with colorful bite-nats paint then stands at the painted wall while producing all the bite-nats equipment pieces or structures for the Showcase.

At 06:06 p.m., after Sun Block, the sky continues its darkness displaying a full moon, moonlight rays, and twinkling stars. All the guest start to venture outdoors into the sizzling heated air molecules to investigate the nighttime.
A row of five riflemen stand ten feet apart on the entrance wall between the lovely row of glass windows lifting up, aiming at the tall ceiling planks then fire an individual live bullet into the planks on the ceiling, for attention, not attack. Falling wooden splitters explode invading the air waves slamming down into the guests.
Hico presents a smile and stands in front of the gunmen, wearing his cowboy hat in bright blue hue that protects his bone skull from the invading wooden particles. He patiently waits for the vocal and visual Showcase presentation. A hallway of nervous people and children scream out loud first, duck down onto the floor second, and then roll a body away from Hico over the floor or against the wall while getting away from the noise, the bullets, and the falling wooden splitters. Each one covers their bone skull crying in fear.
Hico chuckles with delight then lifts the ancient hand-held, black-tinted microphone into his lips as and his face appears on a gigantic television screen located within the tall wall corner slightly above the row of food tables. The television program is broadcasted to all mini-television screen monitors throughout the lands and beyond the air waves at Metro City Birmingham and as the invited guests here at the South Beach Colony watch the action outdoors while avoiding Hico, eating the food, enjoying the scenery, and socializing with their family members and friends.
Hico grins then shouts, “Surprise, people! Welcome to the first ever Showcase event tonight. We will select the winning dance team to fight against the big bad Bandit dance team, who live and reside and play and work here in South Beach.” The audience members slowly stand from the floor or leave the lobby producing an array of loud boos and hisses.
Hico states into the microphone and points to the entrance doors at the two individuals. “May I re-introduction my two associates, Vovina and Kodare!” He drops his hand and slaps his side. The audience members sound with an array of hand claps and loud cheers from his words.
“The first ever Showcase exhibition is represented on the opposite side wall, within this wide hallway. You, as our invited guests, come here and sit down against the side wall in-between me and the food tables. We will examine and then decide each independent exhibition for the first place winner of the Showcase event, which will complete in tonight’s evening dance competition. Keep in mind here! The winner of Showcase event tonight will fight against the winning Showcase team of tomorrow night’s competition. So, let’s go and rock and roll!” The audience members sound with an array of hand clasp and loud cheers then start to scoot around the hallway, standing against the wall, sitting on the floor. They are eager to see the new Showcase event too.
Vovina, Hico, and Kodare scoot down a crowded hallway and then stop standing in front of the first Showcase holding an old-fashion ink pen and pad of lined paper. They slowly scribble down their hand-written notes and then huddle together while whispering in their secret information regarding the first exhibition. Once they are satisfied with their final decision, they scoot down to the next Showcase.

At 06:33 p.m., the bite-nats covered female displays a red-haired ponytail, stands five feet and eight inches in height, wearing a suntanned skin tone, looking young and fresh. She hears the annoying musical song making a sour frown on her pretty bite-nats covered face.
The musical song Musta Had A Good Time was aired from the album entitled Feels Like Carolina, in the year 2012, and performed by the American Country musical band Parmalee consisting of brother Matt Thomas (lead vocals, guitar); Scott Thomas (drums); blood-related cousin Barry Knox (bass), and best friend Joshua McSwain (guitar). The musical tunes played were Country and Country Rock sounds. The songwriters were Barry Knox; David R. Fanning; Joshua McSwain; Matt Thomas, and Scott Thomas.

The musical song entitled The House of the Rising Sun was released in the year 1964 and performed by the American musical band named as The Animals.


There is a house way down in New Orleans
They call the Rising Sun
And it’s been the ruin of many a poor boy
And God, I know, I’m one

Mother was a tailor, yeah, yeah
Sewed my Levi jeans
My father was a gambling man, yeah, yeah
Down, way down in New Orleans

Now, the only thing a gambling man ever needs
Is a suitcase, Lord, and a trunk
And the only time a fool like him is satisfied
Is when he’s all stone cold drunk


Lead singer Eric Burdon had heard the words sitting in a nightclub, in the town of Newcastle, within the country of England. The song was performed by the Northumbrian folk singer Johnny Handle. Eric and his band named The Animals were touring in the year 1964 in the foreign country as a cover band for the American Roll and Rock musical superstar Chuck Berry.
The musical band named The Animals had created their own version and played their new song to their audience members while getting a tremendous reaction to the tune. By an executive decision from the band’s musical producer Mickie Most, the band stopped by a small recording studio, on the street of Kingsway, within the city of London and then recorded the song, in one take, taking 15 minutes, on the date of May 18th, in the year 1964.
The electric guitar notes in A Minor Chord arpeggio was composed by band member Hilton Valentine. The lead vocals from Eric Burdon performs a howling, soulful, deep gravelling musical tone, such like, one of the many ancient songs sung by men going to work to earn their keep, within a northeast English coal town of Newcastle.
Musician band member Alan Price played the pulsating organ notes on a Vox Continental Organ musical instrument. The song runs 04 minutes and 29 seconds and it is very long for a single Pop record and the tune is played in 6/8 meter, unlike the 4/4 meter from the earlier musical versions from various American musical artists.
On June 19, 1964, The House of the Rising Sun was released in the United Kingdom (Great Britain, Ireland and Wales) with the radio version play time at 02 minutes and 59 seconds, climbing to the number one, within the U.K. Pop Single Chart, and then was released in the United States of America, on August 8th, in the same year. The song reached the number one on the date of September 5th, on the U.S. Pop Single Chart.
The musical song became the signature song for the band and also became the first British invasion, into all the Great Britain cities, by an American musical band, such like, the reverse musical phenomena from English musical group, The Beatles, who invaded by thunder and lightning the American landscape and American girls, in the 1960s.
The American band members included Eric Burdon (vocals); Hilton Valentine (electric guitar); John Steel (drums & percussion); Alan Price (organ), and Chas Chandler (bass guitar) living in Liverpool, Great Britain. The musical band played Folk Rock and Blues Rock sounds.
The musical song was described by musical critics as:

The first folk rock hit!
The band connected the ancient tune to a live wire!
The first folk rock tune!
A revolutionary single!
A brilliant rearrangement!
A new standard rendition of an old standard composition!

The location of the physical structure, Rising Sun, is another cult mystery among all the musical fans. Based on the mystical words. from the tune, the place is listed within the city of New Orleans and represents a brothel or a parish prison for women or a gambling hall.
The proper words, Rising Sun, does provides an ancient American historical reference to a hotel building, located on Conti Street, within the French Quarter, in the year 1820 or in the year 1830, a Club House located on Cherokee Street, within the riverfront Carrollton Community and used for both social aid and pleasurable activities, such like gambling and prostitution.
In the year 1860, a coffee house on Decatur Street in front of the lake provided coffee, beer, and food items to patrons and their guests.
In the years 1862 to 1874, on 1614 Esplanade Avenue, a building was named, The House of the Rising Sun, and was owned by Madam Marianne LeSolei Levant. Levant means, the rising sun, in the French language.

However, a new musical song plays on one of the television screens.
On the date of March 20, 1973, the musical song entitled Bad, Bad Leroy Brown was released from the album entitled Life and Times, by the American folk rock musical artist and songwriter James Croce. The song was produced by Terry Cashman and Tommy West. The musician played Rock and Roll and Boogie-woogie sounds.
The song reached number one on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 in the month of July and held its first place, when he died on September 20th from a terrible plane crash, in the city of Natchitoches, within the U.S. State of Louisiana. 
His song was the second number one tune to speak the nasty word, damn, in the musical lyrics.
James Croce cited the theme from his musical tone coming from an AWOL army buddy at Fort Dix, in the U.S. State of New Jersey. The soldier talked about how bad he was and then fled his post for a month. At the end of the month, the AWOL solider returned to collect his payroll check and was arrested for a deserter from the United States military. His army buddy was gone to the military jail and was named Leroy Brown.


Well, the south side of Chicago
Is the baddest part of town
And if you go down there
You better just beware
Of a man name of Leroy Brown

Now, Leroy more than trouble
You see he stand about six foot four
All those downtown ladies call him, “Treetop Lover”
All the men just call him, “Sir”

And he’s bad, bad Leroy Brown
The baddest man in the whole damn town
Badder than old King Kong
And meaner than a junkyard dog

And he like his fancy clothes
And he like to wave his diamond rings

He got a custom Continental

Badder than old King Kong
And meaner than a junkyard dog

Leroy shooting dice
And at the edge of the bar
Sat a girl named Doris
And oh, that girl looked nice

Well, he cast his eyes upon her
And the trouble soon began
And Leroy Brown had learned a lesson
About a-messing with the wife of a jealous man

And he’s bad, bad Leroy Brown
The baddest man in the whole damn town
Badder than a-old King Kong
And meaner than a junkyard dog

Leroy looked like a jigsaw puzzle
With a couple of pieces gone

On October 3, 2011, the musical song Sexy and I know It was performed by American Hip Hop musical dance due named LMFAO. The five alphabetic letters represent, Laughing My Freaking Ass Off. The group consisted of Redfoo and SkyBlu. They lived and formed the musical duo in Pacific Palisades, within the city of Los Angeles, in the U.S. State of California.
The musical song was written by songwriters Skyler Husten Gordy; Erin Beck; Stefan Kendal Gordy; Kenny Oliver Kenny; David Jamahl Listenbee, and George Matthew Roberson.
Among the dance group, the Shuffle Bot was a popular character. He was portrayed by American disco jockey, dancer, and rapper Andrew Furr, who always wore a white-tinted square box over his bone skull. The box featured a pair of painted eyeballs and a wide smile on the front. He won an internet dancing contest and then joined the LMFAO’s dancing troupe.

Baycliff leans inside and grabs the body of Rusk, jerking Rusk from the rear seat, sliding his friend over his collar bone. He says to McCamy, “Pemona is leaning against Hixson near the side wall. She’s hurt from the fight, McCamy.”
“Rusk!” McCamy whispers and reaches out touching the pale color on Rusk’s face while feeling both worry and fear.

McCamy, he got the last one, who looked like a lion mammal. Kodare is not dead but in a state of unconsciousness. Once I get up, Kodare is dead. Hico has escaped from us.”
Baycliff props Pemona slightly upright onto the naked, sweaty heated chest on Rusk. Pemona has her two eyelashes shut and as she is slowly dying from her nasty abdomen wound. The bite-nats hand spear has also contaminated all her organs with its nasty germs coming from the dead mammal, flooding through her blood stream. Even a can of bite-nats paint cannot heal her internal injury and save her life force back into a healthy state of wellness.

Why’s Rusk so pale-looking and in constant pain? He was not in the Rider fight,” she looks up with a smile and scans the dance platform.

Vovina lies near the entrance wall presenting an unconscious state also. Amita moves ahead from the entrance wall towards the huddle of Bandit team members. Her life force cannot be healed or saved by an entire can of bite-nats, due to the nasty germs coming from the dead animal, on the spear tip. At the side wall, Tulu gasps in alarm and then races ahead towards the back spine on McCamy, feeling her worries.
“Amita!” Baycliff shouts out loud then slowly pulls his bloody grounded body across the hard wooden surface, cringing in pain.
“Do you see me, now, Baycliff? I’m a cowgirl, too. I can shoot, saddle, and spit, just like Taffy Pudding!” Amita yells tossing both of her arms in the air with the gun and shakes both of her hips while laughing out loud.
Taffy mentally performs the think object: flash blade. She produces a flash blade on the interior of her arm.
She had painted a yellow-tinted straight line inside the coolness of the rocket ship for both her body protection and her physical girly fight with an evil Director Hico.
Taffy slowly stands upright from the wooden surface and then moves around shuffling away from an injured Baycliff while protecting her friends and her family members. She smiles and says to Amita. “Of course, you can, honey bell.”
“Amita!” Baycliff shouts and tries to scoot across the wooden planks, trailing his blood proteins over the wood, cringing in pain and then huddles beside a grounded McCamy. They both continue to dress their leg wounds with pieces of ripped off cloth from Baycliff’s clothes. Each leg wound is not serious enough for a bleed-out but stings like a swarm of attacking wasps.
Amita raises the pistol again into her chest and then rushes ahead towards Taffy, screaming out loud in fury, “My man! My man! You took everything from me, Taffy Pudding!”
“Amita!” Baycliff shouts and rests sideways while bleeding on top of the wooden planks, cringing in pain, “You’re mad at me, not Taffy! Look! We can leave outta here and go talk someplace else about all of this!”
“No talk! No walk! No nothing! I got nothing! No family! No farm! No future!” Amita shouts and continues to race ahead producing sobs of her fury, pointing the warm barrel on her lady pistol at Taffy, “Dead! You are dead! You’re dead, Taffy Pudding, for my pain and suffering, for one solid year, living inside that dark, dunk, dead Silo. You tricked me with the same pretty pink colored thistle trick that you played on Director Hico.”
Taffy slowly advances ahead then veers sideways moving away from an injury Baycliff and McCamy, hiding her flash blade within her crooked elbow. She states and smiles at Amita. “I didn’t trick you, Amita. I didn’t want to go to Apprenticeship Program. But you did. And you went there, without me. Your lady pistol is empty, honey bell. It holds only four bullets. Vovina has not moved from that entrance wall, since I came back here into the battle fight. So, you killed Superintendent Vovina with your lady gun. I mean, I wished that I had killed her instead. Give me the gun! Then I won’t have to beat your ass, Amita.”
Amita halts her running motion and gasps in shock flinching with worry, looking down with confusion at her lady pistol.
That’s the distraction Taffy needs!
Taffy increases her speed then leaps up from the surface, flying in the air at Amita, reaching out for the gun. Taffy shoves Amita backwards. The smaller lady gun tumbles out from Amita’s cupped hands. Taffy drops down landing on her kneecaps on top of the platform, exhaling with a heavy grunt and then jerks the flash blade from her forearm skin.
Amita slowly stands upright first.
Taffy tries to stand but falls back down from her pair of oversized boots, waving both of her arms in the air with her flash blade. She mentally performs the think object: paint. The blade turns back into yellow paint for body safety on Taffy.
Amita gasps in pain and then dashes ahead towards the grounded pistol. Taffy views the grounded pistol again then leaps from a folded stance and flies in the air colliding into the rib cage on Amita. They both fall down landing on top of the rough hard surface.
Baycliff rests on top of the wood and bleeds through the cracks on the planks, laughing out loud, watching Taffy and Amita’s battle fight. He calmly states, “You know, McCamy, I usually enjoy watching two females fight, like a pair of pissed off alley cats, ripping massive handful chunks of pretty hair from each skull, along with all the pretty clothes from a naked body. But, in this instant, I seem to find that I’m a little partial with this round to…”
“…Taffy…” Tulu hollers for her sister, “Go, cowgirl!” She rushes ahead sliding down into the back spine on McCamy, cuddling next to him. They watch Taffy and Amita’s fight battle.
Taffy and Amita twirl in a fight dance on top of the un-even surface of hard planks pinching a fingernail into a cheekbone, punching a flying fist into an eye socket while still rolling towards the edge of the cliff.
“Taffy!” Baycliff shouts out loud and tries to stand upright but falls back down cringing from his leg wound.
“Taffy!” Tulu shouts and stands upright expressing her fear starting to step her boot toe towards her sister.
McCamy reaches out and catches the ankle bone on Tulu pulling his girl back down to the planks with him, hugging her body into his body. Amita will kill Tulu, if she gets the chance, but not a tough cowgirl Taffy.
Amita kicks out her pointy kneecap into the open mouth on Taffy. Taffy falls sideways and lands down on the hard surface, spitting out the blood proteins from her busted bottom lip. Taffy kicks out her boot toe and hits cutting the smooth cheekbone face on Amita. Amita tumbles backwards and then lands on her back spine on top of the hard wooden planks.
Taffy leaps in the air then lands upon her two booted feet, shuffling ahead, then squats down sitting in-between the chest cavity on Amita. She performs the think object within her mental mind: flash blade. She jerks a yellow-tinted flash blade from her anterior arm meat and holds her weapon in a two-fisted pose, staring down into the scared face on Amita. Taffy growls in anger then states with her nasty girly timber. “Once I loved you like a sister…”
A single bullet explodes from a live gun echoing into the night sky. Each face turns and stares at the open archway, on the entrance wall.
Taffy turns and then gasps in shock seeing a lonely figure standing at the entrance wall. Amita slams her arm into the rib cage on Taffy. Taffy rolls sideways and then shuffles off from Amita, landing down on top of the hard wooden planks.
In front of the entrance wall, Hico stands upright a few feet from the open archway, holding the shotgun on his hip. He extends his hand and shouts, “Amita!” Then a musical song starts to play from the exposed speaker boxes in the air waves.
In the year 1971, the musical song Witchy Woman from the musical album named Eagles and was performed by the American Roll and Rock musical band Eagles. The musical band members include Glenn Frey; Don Henley; Randy Meisner, and Bernie Leadon. The musical album named Eagles was produced by Glyn Johns. The guitar player Bernie Leadon composed the musical notes, giving the melody a very haunted and creepy feel.

Amita sits upright on her two kneecaps and turns with her smile to see Hico, slowly standing upright from the planks, brushing the dirt and sand from her bite-nats costume and then stares down at Taffy. She says with a nasty timber, “Once upon a time, I was princess in the land of cow and cotton. Then, I became the queen in the city of high technology and hidden hostages. We planned all of this, Taffy Pudding. You fell and failed for my ploy, kinda like, I fell and failed for your plot, Taffy.”
Taffy sits upright on her kneecaps and then turns to see the rocket ship. The rear compartment is open and is being emptied out by Hico new guards, who present a new bite-nats face mask, consisting of Rabbit, Squirrel and Bird. They steal the sixteen cans of bite-nats paint cans loading down into three rolling karts and then leave the wooden platform in silence.
Amita smiles, slaps her chest, and then shouts to the other teens. “I will, now, be leaving all of you, smelly cowboys and cowgirls, for my glamour destiny. Ebro has bargained with Hico. You will send cans of bite-nats paint, every season, to Metro City Birmingham. Then we do not invade here again.” She turns and scans the wooden platform, then the dark skyline, and returns back to see Taffy, moving ahead towards Hico and laughs out loud with an evil. She announces with a smile. “Now, ya’ll have a long, hard-working, and happy farm life here in South Beach.”
In front of the entrance wall, Hico stands in place with a grin and continues to hold the shotgun, extending open his arm for Amita. She cuddles into his body. They hug. She kisses his face and pulls back with a smile. They spin around and exit the platform in both peace and silence.
Ebro, Thelee, Tourann, and the other parents next enter the wooden platform, dashing ahead to their injured or healthy child, assisting with their care and love.

At 11:51 pm, among the warm temperatures with bright twinkling stars and rows of yellow moonlight beams, each teen and their parents surround the lip on the fissure pit located in the middle of the wooden planks used for the first annual Huntress and Hunter Games.
Ebro squats down at the side and lifts his dead son into his bent arms slowly back stepping from the wall, spinning around while sobbing with his own sad fatherly tears. He carefully moves ahead towards the fiery fissure and then stops staring down at the blue-tinted face on a smiling Rusk.
Years ago, when his son Rusk was three years old becoming hurt on top of his hard skull, falling off from the moving pony while trying to ride the horse’s saddle using his two cowboy boots, instead of his ten finger pads. Ebro and his wife were there to attend the hurt.
In front of the fissure pit, Ebro is going to miss his baby son, but the Prime Creator has granted him two colts in one delivery coming from his loving wife Pocola. Pocola had a hard time shoving out these two little pups from her inner guts, but she blessed Ebro with two hardworking and smart sons.
Now, Ebro silently thanks the Prime Creator, Brother Jesus, The Holy Spirit, and all his heavenly angels for his double gift of life. But Brother Jesus has decided that Rusk’s duty as a human is done and is needed back in heaven for his new duty as an angel. So, Ebro gets to keep his feisty but hardworking first born son McCamy. He slightly chuckles with amusement. McCamy and Ebro are two peas inside a farmer pod.
Ebro leans down and kisses the cold-feeling, blue-tinted forehead on Rusk while saying a silent heavenly prayer, thanking Brother Jesus for giving Ebro the chance to raise a good kid here on Planet Earth. He stands upright and exhales with sadness sniffing up the running snot, leaning over and tosses the bio-shell of Rusk, which is now only made of water and proteins, down into the flaming fire, burning the flesh and bones quickly.
Each Soul from Rusk and Pemona is living inside beautiful heavenly realm now.
Ebro repeats the same quiet and quick ritual with the blue-tinted body on Pemona, after learning her family unit had died, during the battle fight against Hico also. Thelee, Tourann, the other parents, and all the other teens still huddle for a set of quick prayers around the fissure funeral of both Rusk and Pemona.
A few minutes, before midnight, within a new early day, each sad parent escorts their battered and beaten single child or children back home to recover and recuperate from the nasty vicious dance fight with an evil Director Hico and a nasty Amita, during the first annual Huntress and Hunter Games.
Thirteen years later…


Month of January
Hot temperatures with bright sunshine
McCamy Farms
Flat meadow setting
04:04 p.m.


On the edge of the flat meadow with the wild flowers and purple tinted thistles, a herd of grazing cows enjoy the fertile tiny grasslets. Four years old, blonde-haired, pony-tailed, skinny child named Pemona dashes ahead from her house and then stops standing inside the two open arms on her Uncle McCamy. She is the only child from the married couple Taffy and Baycliff.
She wiggles sideways with a giggle and holds a dusty mini-television device between her dirty fingers, saying with a smile. “Uncle McCamy! Uncle McCamy! Look at this old thing. Can you see the pictures that move with tiny people that talk out loud? If I twist this little knob, you hear…”
“Welcome to the Fourteen Annual Huntress and Hunter Game! I am your hostess Superintendent Amita. May I present my husband of Metro City Birmingham, Director Hico. He and I are here tonight to…”
McCamy reaches down and twists the knob, reducing the volume on the device, removing the machine from her tiny hands. He drops the machine down on top of the grass and says. “Happy Birthday, Pemona!” An older and wiser McCamy wears a grayish black-tinted face of whiskers on a muscular body reaching out and pats the worn tree stump with his calloused hand. He reaches out and lifts her body landing her butthole on top of the tree stump.
Pemona kicks out her naked legs and feet pointing down at the machine then states. “I went exploring and found it with my mama down inside that hot cave. I helped her cook up that blue shiny glitter paint. Can we go there to the place on the television machine, too? They got lots of pretty prizes. I like prizes, Uncle McCamy.”
He leans down with a smile and whispers into her dirty cheekbone. “You know, I got some prizes, too.”
She gasps in shock then states with a smile. “Do you too! Are the prizes for me too?”
He grins then states. “Extend your arm, muffin.” She reaches out and smashes her small palm into his dirty shirt as McCamy chuckles then says. “That’s my girl.” He paints a single pink-tinted circle around her tiny wrist bone, reaching up, gently touching her temple. “Close your eyelashes. Think the picture of a pink bracelet.”
Pemona closes her two eyelashes, softly hums a song, wiggles her nose, and finally waves her hand in the air and as the warmth invades her arm and then the coolness creates her mentally image coming from her brain cells. She opens her two eyelashes and gasps in shock saying with a smile, “O wow!” She reaches out and gently touches each individual pink tinted bead, on the single bracelet, using her finger. “What’s it?”
“It is magic, Pemona!” He whispers then leans down planting his light kiss on her dirty cheekbone, pulling back with a chuckle to his cute niece.
She studies the bracelet and states with confusion, “Magic! May I please keep my new pink bracelet, Uncle McCamy?”
He leans down and whispers with a smile into her face, again, “You can keep the pink bracelet foreverly, muffin.” She giggles with delight. He sits back and then reaches out lifting her body up from the old tree stump, standing her naked feet on top of the soft grass. He states with a grin. “Why don’t you go and show, Mama?”
She scratches her arm from the insect bite and fidgets on top of the grass on a pair of skinny legs, nodding with a smile. “Yeah! I wanna go and show everyone! Mama, Daddy, Grandma Tourann, Grandpa Thelee, Granddaddy Ebro, Aunt Tulu, and even mean old cousin Rusk, too. Come and look at pretty me! Come on, Uncle McCamy! It’s time for supper.” She spins around with a giggle and then races ahead towards the wooden front porch on Tulu and McCamy’s house while carefully waving her arm with the tiny pink beaded bracelet in the air. She continues to yell out loud for her family members to come and see her new pink tinted bracelet.
McCamy slowly stands upright from the grass and protectively watches while smiling with delight at his new and old family members, starting to limp ahead towards his house to kiss his wife Tulu and hug his only child Rusk, before the wonderful hot suppertime meal with all his kin and kind, and is very grateful for all of his blessings here within the South Beach Colony on Planet Earth.









THE END
